story:
Where have the maps gone?

Richard Pargeter's maps have been in circulation for decades. They've been on trails and backpacking trips with thousands of outdoor enthusiasts and hung on the walls of equally as many residents of Washington. But in recent years, Richard's had to take a step back from his work and retire. Unfortunately, this means the maps have began to fall into obscurity.

We want to change all that.

We're Diane and Lucas Pargeter, Richard's grandchildren, and we want to keep Richard's works in the hands of everyone out there that will truly enjoy them.


So what do we need?

It's been several years now since Richard stepped down from selling his maps, and most of the stock of these maps has since depleted. Over the last few years we've been pooling the money from what sales we can manage with the maps we have left, and we're nearing the possibility of a reprint. 

We want to get these maps to you this year, and we want to do it by the late spring. But to do that we need your help. We need an additional $5000 to cover the costs of printing and laminating several thousands of maps.

What do you get?

For every $25 donated, you will receive a copy of one of Richard's maps of your chosing. If it's one of the maps that is out of print, you will receive it as soon as it's made available. If we can presale just 200 of these we'll be able to make our goal, so every map counts!


Are you a business interested in a larger order?

We'd be more than happy to presale you a quantity of Richard's maps at wholesale prices. You can contact us for further information on this by emailing lucas@pargetermaps.com


Other ways to help.

If you can't help monetarily, you can still help by letting your friends and family know about our presale. The quicker we can reach our goal, the quicker we can get them back in stores!

story:
Indian Old Persons Home Takes Care of 150 Seniors without Families



In most modernized countries, there is a social system that supports
retired citizens, but in India, the second most populous nation in the
world, there is no such system.  Seniors who are without families must
fend for themselves or rely upon charity.  One of these charities located
in Pragathi Nagar, India is a home that houses and cares for 150 of these
“orphan” seniors. Without this critical care, most of the residents would
be begging in the streets or deceased.


Founded and managed by Ganta Madhusudan Reddy, the Orphan Old Age Home was established in February 2016.  There are currently a handful of employees including a Cook, Barber, Washer, Physician, Watchman, and Yoga Teacher who care for the residents.  Each of these seniors receives a minimal food allowance and proper medical care, but the costs are considerable.


Indian Orphan Old Age Women are taking Breakfast on line



Our Mess Menu of Orphan old -age Home

at 07 a.m.  Breakfast

at 10-00 a.m.  Meals, Dall and Soup

at 1-00 p.m.   Meals, Curry and Curd

at 5-00 p.m.  Snacks

at 6-00 p.m.  Meals, Curry, Soup and Curd


To help raise the $45,000 needed to maintain operations, Ganta Madhusudan
Reddy has sponsored a fundraising campaign on Indiegogo.  These funds will
be used to pay employee salaries, obtain foodstuffs, and maintain the
health of residents. Your generous donation to this worthy cause will help
feed and clothe residents of the Orphan Old Age Home, and pay for the
administration of the charity.  Please consider helping these helpless men
and women by making a donation or spreading the word of this campaign on
Facebook or Twitter.   To learn more about the Orphan Old Age Home or to
make a donation, please visithttps://goo.gl/P38H5O.

https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=1000126...

https://twitter.com/Gmadhusudan3

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=56teVqIMeeo


        Your Sincerely,

  • Ganta Madhusudan Reddy,

    Principal Organizer,

    Of Orphan old age Home,

story:
About us

You may be aware that Aberdeen Football Club has recently announced plans to build a 20,000 capacity football stadium with training pitches on a site adjacent to Westhill. 

A group of likeminded individuals has come together to work with those in Westhill, Kingswells and wider who would like to object to this development. We are greatly concerned about how our well established communities will be affected by this development.

What will the money be spent on?

We need funds to support the campaign: we will commission consultants to prepare unbiased assessments of the proposals and the services of a legal team to protect the interests of residents in Westhill and Kingswells.  We will also organise press releases and media communications relating to the campaign as well as leaflet deliveries to the local area.

You can support our campaign by giving what you can here. You can also get in touch via our web site and on Facebook and Twitter.

story:
We are excited to introduce the Trim-Daddy, an innovative new handheld electric trimmer that revolutionizes the process of trimming.

As more and more states legalize the production of cannabis, the competition is heating up and prices are going down. The growers that make it in this industry are finding more and more ways to cut costs, and one of a grower's biggest costs in time and money is the process of trimming.

For years we've all been spending our valuable hours trimming with traditional scissors or paying up to $200 per pound for someone else to trim, which is a huge drain on time and money.

The Trim-Daddy is specifically designed for trimming your buds with speed and accuracy, giving your growing operation the efficiency it needs to stay competitive. Our consumer tests resulted in an average trimming time of 1.5 hours per pound, which is 5 times faster than traditional scissors. At that speed, and with our Indiegogo campaign's price of $99, the Trim-Daddy pays for itself on the first day.

With the tremendous savings and accuracy that the Trim-Daddy gives growers and trimmers, the question isn't if you need to have it, but when you'll give your operation the proper tools it deserves.


Does your harvest need it or does it deserve it?

The Trim-Daddy sets itself apart from other hand held trimmers in 4 different ways that makes it the most optimal, comfortable, and highest quality trimmer on the market.

These 4 aspects include:

1. Industry-first 5-blade cutting system

2. Patent-pending Robust Motor

3. Sleek and comfortable design

4. Best price point in the industry


1)  5 blade scissor technology for accuracy and precision

The Trim-Daddy's 5-blade system was specifically designed for the accuracy and precision needed to manicure such a delicate and valuable plant. Unlike the saw-type blades found with other electric trimmers, our blades are designed to snip only what you intend to snip and keep your bud beautiful.

Our blades work just like scissors except a lot faster and nearly effortless for your hands. They are made of high carbon stainless steel for longevity of use, and are easily removed for cleaning.


2. Patent pending Robust Motor

The Robust Motor is the heart of the Trim-Daddy. We have specially designed and engineered this Patent-Pending Brushless Motor to last over 10,000 hours at full speed, while the brush motors found in most other trimmers last only 2,000 hours. This will allow you to use the Trim-Daddy for years without having any heart problems.

The powerful 25,000 RPM motor, longevity of use, and overall efficiency of the Robust Motor allows it to maintain a strong performance through even the toughest and stickiest of trim jobs. You can choose between two speed options that allow you to stay in control of power.

We combine a specific variety of metals to craft the motor such in a way that reacts perfectly to our unique treatment process. This allows for the motor to be immaculately smooth on a microscopic level, enabling years of use without overheating. It has been tested to produce more power with less energy for optimal efficiency. Our brushless motor technology has also been designed to not exceed a temperature of 137 degrees Fahrenheit, allowing you to work for hours without overheating.

The Robust Motor is currently patent pending and is found exclusively in the Trim-Daddy.


If you enjoy what you do for work, you never have to go to work again

3. Sleek and comfortable design

Ergonomically designed for comfort and ease of use, the Trim-Daddy eliminates the backaches, hand cramps, and tediousness of trimming.

Speed settings can be changed with the easy flick of a switch near the thumb.

The Trim-Daddy is light weight, allowing it to move almost effortlessly as it beautifies your buds.

The 120V AC power cord keeps you at full power at all times, and at 8 feet is more than long enough to stay out of your way. This device also works in Europe or other countries that require a 230V AC power chord.

The Trim-Daddy designed to pass ETL safety standards, and we are currently in the process of earning our certificate. We expect the Trim-Daddy to pass this safety standard with flying colors.


Can't afford to not have it

4. More than affordable

At a retail price of $199 and special Indiegogo deal at $99, the Trim-Daddy boasts the best return on investment of any handheld electric trimmer. It can pay for itself in the first few hours of use depending on volume and trimmer experience.



This tool is spectacular

Specs
-30 watts
-input voltage 120V AC & works with 230V AC for European standards
-50/60 hertz
-Transmission 25,000 RPM
-Blades 650-950RPM (high and low settings)
-Blade length 2 inches
-Trim-Daddy height 6 inches

-Eight foot cord for continuous power at all times

Trimming is a pain, but doesn’t have to be. The Trim-Daddy revolutionizes the process of trimming by using advanced technology to do most of the work for you. It helps you do the work faster, thickens your wallet, and saves your hands for times you need them most.

The Trim-Daddy is currently in production and will be complete and sent to your home in March 2016. We have invested $100,000 into our first round of production and another $50,000 this past half year for our warehouse rent and other overhead costs. Rest assured that our company is fully operational and ready to deliver a Trim-Daddy with your pledge of only $99.

The Trim-Daddy will be available in hydroponics retail stores across the nation upon its release date in March. We decided to launch this Indiegogo campaign to get a head start with our product release and to reward our early supporters with a Trim-Daddy at half its retail cost for helping us doing so.

Pledge for yours today and get one for just 99 bucks. Get ahead of the game and order yours today!


$99 on Indiegogo, $199 retail. Don’t wait!

The Trim-Daddy in these photos is a 3D printed version we have for testing. The actual Trim-Daddy will have the same look but will also have a nice bubbled Trim-Daddy logo on its side.

Sharing is caring

Share this campaign with growers, trimmers, and friends who work in the industry and can save thousands using the Trim-Daddy.

Video Soundtrack

Special thanks to BairFro for letting us use one of his original sound tracks. Check him out on SoundCloud.

Contact Us

You can also visit our new website at Trim-Daddy.com
Or email us with any questions via Sales@Trim-Daddy.com

Risks and challenges

The product is currently in production, and so far everything has gone as planned. The only potential obstacles is a slight delay in manufacturing, which can happen with any product even with a promise from the production end. To avoid this, we have set preliminary agreements with our manufactures to complete the the product by a certain date. We even gave an extra 2 week leeway for any unexpected delays.

story:
Who we are...what we do...the fun stuff

Name: Jeff Hanson.  Business: Connectrify.com.  I'm an entrepreneur who has an issue with the world revolving around big business and the supposed 9-5 jobs within.  So, what does someone with an issue do?  Create a solution.  In conjunction with Smart Success Meetup.com live entrepreneur groups, I have begun to create a site that brings those in-person relationships online.  Local to International.  Simple as that.  

What we need.  What you get.

The basic value proposition of any concept.  Noone goes on Indiegogo looking for love, so I'll throw it out there, we are looking for money to get this thing running.

  • With $15,000 we can complete our site and begin our mission to bring Entrepreneurship to the forefront of American business (at least push it a bit closer).
  • We will also bring on experts to teach our members how to expand their business reach and create stronger value propositions and even stronger relationships.
  • Perks are listed to the right, but we want our perks to at least be meaningful to someone you know or even don't know.  Use them yourself or donate them. Either way, you'll get membership perks to our website...or as I said, donate them!  
  • Lastly, if we don't reach our goal of $15,000 we will still utilize the money accordingly but may need to take on an initial financing partner.  As you all know, that can hurt the overall goal so let's hit $15,000 and all go to sleep happy.

The Sneak Peek...

story:
STOP the waste -> FOCUS on RESEARCH


About ME:

  • My name is Simon Roy orinally from Laval, QC, Canada.
  • Ph.D in Animal Physiology (endocrinology option)
  • B.Sc in Biotechnology
  • Passionate about all types of sciences for as long as I can remember.
  • Always wanted to contribute to 'changing the world' but didn't know how...
  • Founded Civic Bioscience Limitée on Sept 15th, 2015 from A to Z, without any funding, with a mission of providing Good Citizenship to the field of Life Science Research.

About Civic Bio (www.civicbio.com):
  • We (I) started off the company a year ago by doing distribution of life science research reagents that are intended to be used for research only.
  • Our goal is to find the Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEM) that make products/kits for big companies so that we can provide lower cost to customers by NOT doing private labelling.
  • We wish to expand and provide services.

Origins of the Project:

  •  Biology scientists (cancer, reproduction , agriculture, etc. ) are facing day-to-day problems . Solving their problems themself, often by trying out new reagents, is costly and it slows scientific discoveries.
  • Last February, we offered a group of scientist to help them solve a problem of DNA amplification by polymerase chain reaction (PCR). We solved their problem quickly while they could continue research on non-problematic parts of their research. Since then, we solved a dozen of similar probems (read about it here: PCR Success Stories).
  • Thus, we realized that :
  1. the need was present in several research laboratories;
  2. it makes researchers happy when we find answers to their problems;
  3. they save valuable time and money;
  4. we made more sales by providing our technical help.

The Main Project you will be financing:
So far we have solved basic low-throughput problems but science being what it is requires higher throughput and diverse equipment to perform biological experiments.
  • We wish to be able to solve scientist problems of other nature (for exemple: quantitative measurement of nucleic acid expression levels) which require more technologically advanced equipment,
  • High technology means higher amounts of reagents wasted by researchers at the moment, which also means we will be saving them that much money (coming from our taxes!)
  • Provide this service for FREE - Good Citizenship - we will get enough from the sales afterwards.
Why this project is important:
  • Life Science research is majorly funded by the taxes we, the citizens, pay everyday. Saving Research money = more research, more cures, better food, better pest control or alternatively more investments in other areas.
  • Change the World - by setting a new way to do business in the life science research field.
  • Better than a donation - you will really help ACCELERATE scientific discoveries.



What we NEED and what you GET

What we have (equipment):

miniPCR DNA Discovery system by Amplyus (founded on Kickstarter)

  • Works great!
  • Low cost, but low throughput, basic PCR instrument enabling us to perform only 8 reaction at a time. Similar machines in research labs can do 96 to 384 reactions, have temperature gradients and many other options.

We need :

  • Quantitative PCR thermocycler (10 000 to 20 000$ with accessories) to be able to perform advanced measurements of nucleic acid expression in a high-throughput fasion.
  • Benchtop Laboratory Refrigerated Centrifuge and Rotors (approx. 10 000$ with rotor and shipping). It's basic equipment that will allow us to perform nucleic acid and other sample extraction and purification.
  • Consumable plasticware and reagents (5000$)
  • Extra 5000$ for IndieGogo perks, shipping fees and other fees.
Where the money will go if we don't reach our target:
  • If not entirely funded, we will use the money to purchase the basic minimum equipment strting by the centrifuge and we will downgrade the PCR machine to a regular 96-well thermocycler without quantitative measurement function. The equipment will still be used to help scientists with their challenges.

 WHAT DO YOU GET?!
It's about time we got to this section :-)
Depending on your contribution, you can receive:
  • Level 1 - HUGE virtual thank you
  • Level 2 - Mention of your contribution on our website and other pages.
  • Level 3 - Civic Bio mouse pad
  • Level 4 - Basic DNA analysis of your own DNA* (requires hair or saliva sample) sent to you in electronic format.
  • Level 5 - Basic DNA analysis for you and another family member (can be your pet too) sent to you in electronic format.
  • Level 6 - Advanced DNA analysis of your own DNA* sent to you in electronic format.
  • Level 7 - Advanced DNA analysis of your own DNA* and up to 3 other family members sent to you in electronic format.
  • Level 8 - Advanced DNA analysis of your own DNA* sent to you on a high-resolution printed poster.
  • Level 9 - Advanced DNA analysis of your own DNA* and up to 3 family members on 4 high-resolution printed posters.
  • Level 10 - Advanced DNA analysis+sequencing of your own DNA* sent to you in electronic format.
  • Level 11 - Advanced DNA analysis+sequencing of your own DNA* and up to 3 family members sent to you printed on a high-resolution printed poster.
  • Level 12 - Your very own miniPCR Discovery system! - 990$ value
  • Level 13 - Your very own miniPCR Discovery System, Reagents and Training - > 1100$ value
  • Level 14 - All of the above (1 + 2 +3 + your choice of 4 to 11 + level 13)
* requires hair or saliva sample


 Your Impact

  • We all know someone who either has contracted a disease, a virus, cancer or has a genetically-inherited disease -> your contribution will ACCELERATE all types of research.
  • The food and forestry industries will also benefit from your contribution.
  • You've made donations in the past to health organizations and don't know really what your contribution has accomplished --> now you'll know and even will be able to see the results!
  • You pay taxes everyday --> Stop the waste in life science research and encourage the only company that embraces Good Citizenship in that field.
  •  Read the testimonials (mostly in French) about what we have accomplished so far: PCR Success Stories.


 Risks & Challenges

 We won't lie to you - we won't be able to solve every scientists problems. If we ever were to do so, we would need a whole lot more equipment, staff, expertise and personel on the field.

BUT, we will do whatever it takes, using our resources and new equipments to help scientists accross the globe find more cures to diseases, grow better food, save trees and endangered species. We are committed to science first. Good citizenship means the we have to respect our rights and obligations to society. We will thrive to do our part for society.


 Other ways you can help!


  •  Tel your friends about it - they may know someone experiencing technicl problems in life science research in which we can help!
  •  Share, share, share - Use the Indiegogo sharing tools, they're easy to use and efficient!


In the name of my company, I thank you very much for encouraging our efforts at helping scientists in Canada and accross the globe.
story_txt:
STOP the waste -> FOCUS on RESEARCH

About ME:

My name is Simon Roy orinally from Laval, QC, Canada.
Ph.D in Animal Physiology (endocrinology option)
B.Sc in Biotechnology
Passionate about all types of sciences for as long as I can remember.
Always wanted to contribute to 'changing the world' but didn't know how...
Founded Civic Bioscience Limitée on Sept 15th, 2015 from A to Z, without any funding, with a mission of providing Good Citizenship to the field of Life Science Research.


About Civic Bio (www.civicbio.com):

We (I) started off the company a year ago by doing distribution of life science research reagents that are intended to be used for research only.
Our goal is to find the Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEM) that make products/kits for big companies so that we can provide lower cost to customers by NOT doing private labelling.
We wish to expand and provide services.


Origins of the Project:




 Biology scientists (cancer, reproduction , agriculture, etc. ) are facing day-to-day problems .
Solving their problems themself, often by trying out new reagents, is costly and it slows scientific discoveries.

Last February, we offered a group of scientist to help them solve a problem of DNA
amplification by polymerase chain reaction (PCR). We solved their problem quickly while they could continue research on non-problematic parts of their research. Since then, we solved a dozen of similar probems (read about it here: PCR Success Stories).
Thus, we realized that :



the need was
present in several research laboratories;

it makes researchers happy when we find answers to their problems;
they save valuable time and money;
we made more sales by providing our technical help.


The Main Project you will be financing:

So far we have solved basic low-throughput problems but science being what it is requires higher throughput and diverse equipment to perform biological experiments.

We wish to be able to solve scientist problems of other nature (for exemple: quantitative measurement of nucleic acid expression levels) which require more technologically advanced equipment,
High technology means higher amounts of reagents wasted by researchers at the moment, which also means we will be saving them that much money (coming from our taxes!)
Provide this service for FREE - Good Citizenship - we will get enough from the sales afterwards.

Why this project is important:

Life Science research is majorly funded by the taxes we, the citizens, pay everyday. Saving Research money = more research, more cures, better food, better pest control or alternatively more investments in other areas.

Change the World - by setting a new way to do business in the life science research field.
Better than a donation - you will really help ACCELERATE scientific discoveries.




What we NEED and what you GET

What we have (equipment):
miniPCR DNA Discovery system by Amplyus (founded on Kickstarter)


Works great!
Low cost, but low throughput, basic PCR instrument enabling us to perform only 8 reaction at a time. Similar machines in research labs can do 96 to 384 reactions, have temperature gradients and many other options.

We need :


Quantitative PCR thermocycler (10 000 to 20 000$ with accessories) to be able to perform advanced measurements of nucleic acid expression in a high-throughput fasion.


Benchtop Laboratory Refrigerated Centrifuge and Rotors (approx. 10 000$ with rotor and shipping). It's basic equipment that will allow us to perform nucleic acid and other sample extraction and purification.

Consumable plasticware and reagents (5000$)
Extra 5000$ for IndieGogo perks, shipping fees and other fees.

Where the money will go if we don't reach our target:

If not entirely funded, we will use the money to purchase the basic minimum equipment strting by the centrifuge and we will downgrade the PCR machine to a regular 96-well thermocycler without quantitative measurement function. The equipment will still be used to help scientists with their challenges.


 WHAT DO YOU GET?!

It's about time we got to this section :-)
Depending on your contribution, you can receive:



Level 1 - HUGE virtual thank you

Level 2 - Mention of your contribution on our website and other pages.

Level 3 - Civic Bio mouse pad

Level 4 - Basic DNA analysis of your own DNA* (requires hair or saliva sample) sent to you in electronic format.

Level 5 - Basic DNA analysis for you and another family member (can be your pet too) sent to you in electronic format.

Level 6 - Advanced DNA analysis of your own DNA* sent to you in electronic format.

Level 7 - Advanced DNA analysis of your own DNA* and up to 3 other family members sent to you in electronic format.

Level 8 - Advanced DNA analysis of your own DNA* sent to you on a high-resolution printed poster.
Level 9 - Advanced DNA analysis of your own DNA* and up to 3 family members on 4 high-resolution printed posters.

Level 10 - Advanced DNA analysis+sequencing of your own DNA* sent to you in electronic format.
Level 11 - Advanced DNA analysis+sequencing of your own DNA* and up to 3 family members sent to you printed on a high-resolution printed poster.

Level 12 - Your very own miniPCR Discovery system! - 990$ value

Level 13 - Your very own miniPCR Discovery System, Reagents and Training - > 1100$ value

Level 14 - All of the above (1 + 2 +3 + your choice of 4 to 11 + level 13)


* requires hair or saliva sample




 Your Impact

We all know someone who either has contracted a disease, a virus, cancer or has a genetically-inherited disease -> your contribution will ACCELERATE all types of research.

The food and forestry industries will also benefit from your contribution.
You've made donations in the past to health organizations and don't know really what your contribution has accomplished --> now you'll know and even will be able to see the results!

You pay taxes everyday --> Stop the waste in life science research and encourage the only company that embraces Good Citizenship in that field.

 Read the testimonials (mostly in French) about what we have accomplished so far: PCR Success Stories.




 Risks & Challenges
  We won't lie to you - we won't be able to solve every scientists problems. If we ever were to do so, we would need a whole lot more equipment, staff, expertise and personel on the field.
BUT, we will do whatever it takes, using our resources and new equipments to help scientists accross the globe find more cures to diseases, grow better food, save trees and endangered species. We are committed to science first. Good citizenship means the we have to respect our rights and obligations to society. We will thrive to do our part for society.


 Other ways you can help!


 Tel your friends about it - they may know someone experiencing technicl problems in life science research in which we can help!
 Share, share, share - Use the Indiegogo sharing tools, they're easy to use and efficient!

In the name of my company, I thank you very much for encouraging our efforts at helping scientists in Canada and accross the globe.

story:
Background: Hi, my name is Angie Garris. I’m 5’1’’, I have short hair, and I’m a tax preparer who started her own company called, The Tax Corner. I wasn’t always into the business side or taxes or accounting, I was more into fitness and athletics. As I entered my final year in high school, I was introduced to taxes and accounting heavily, when I took a class on these subjects. In school, I was very successful with each form I completed. Taxes were, simple in my opinion. Once I graduated, I went to college for my bachelor in business. With a nearly 4.0 GPA, business seemed easy as well. It wasn’t until my grandmother needed help on her taxes that I did a complete 180 spin, and decided I had to reach out to the community; who knew how many were out there just like my grandmother! My grandmother didn’t want to go wait for four hours in a gym to get her taxes done for free, she just wished she could have them done quicker. Standing to long made her uncomfortable, and she’d have to stand for at least an hour before a seat opened up, and once a seat was open she planned on waiting another three hours. When she was discussing this with me, I was overcome with a feeling of remorse, I felt like I should have known this, or I should be able to do something for her… and I did. I told my grandmother to give me her current tax season material and her last year tax season material and I would file them for her. Of course within an hour and a half I was finished, and I called my grandmother and told her whenever she wants to come sign and I would be available. With this, my fire was lit. I was kicked into gear to start a company so that people who are just like my grandmother can file their taxes for free. I went to work; taking classes, getting certified, researching, finding out prices and to my surprise, filing taxes is not cheap. So I changed my focus from only the elderly to everyone. With this in mind I knew I would need more money than I had in the bank to cover all my startup costs, thus this campaign was born.

Importance of the campaign/what it is funding: This campaign is personal for me. It’s so important to help the community, especially during the tax season. People don’t quite understand taxes and it’s our jobs as tax professionals to help them get an understanding, not drive them bankrupt until their income taxes come in. I was very uncomfortable with the information I found about prices that big companies and sole proprietors-like me-charge people so much. I decided that, I would not come up with a price, instead I’d do it for free. I’d prepare taxes for free and give my community a break, hoping to someday expand to place my free offices everywhere. With this campaign I am asking for help raising $15,000. With this $15,000 I will be able to cover the costs for the following;

  • Computer (desktop)
  • Fax/Printer
  • Scanner
  • Tax Software
  • Cover website and email fees
  • Cover ads in the newspaper and online fees
  • Marketing materials
  • Phone line and installing fees
  • Office materials, etc

This list is a few of the bigger fees I am hoping to tackle with this campaign. Your donations will make an outstanding impact, not only on The Tax Corner, however on the Buffalo community. It will make tax season a little simpler for all. I hope to raise the entire amount, however if I am not able to raise this, I will use whatever donations I receive on these startup costs. Each donation counts, and no matter the amount, each donation will be used for my business. As well as anyone who can’t donate, putting the word out not only about my campaign, but about my business would be just as good as any donation!

       How this campign is valuable to you:  This project is not only of value to me and the Buffalo community, but it will be of value to you. When you donate, your proceeds are the difference between someone over paying for their taxes to be filed and someone filing for free with me. You are helping me make difference to the people who pay their last dime to get their taxes filed and have to wait until their income tax checks come in before they can pay another bill, put food on the table, pay for their child’s lunch. This campaign is a big responsibility and with your help, you are helping me open a valuable door to the community. With your help, I can avoid all risks of no customers. I can advertise and give out marketing materials to bring people in and secure a clientele. With your help, this tax season can be the season that will bring families a little closer, make pockets a little fatter, put a little extra joy in the homes of all. I’m not hoping to serve only the low income community, but to serve, everyone, everywhere! We all deserve a break. If you’re ever in the Buffalo area during tax season, come visit us and see how your donation has made a difference! Thank you for your donation.

Sincerely,

The Tax Corner: Taxes made simple

story:
The purpose of this campaign is the funding to meet all EPA registration requirements, including registration with all 50 United States, and Territories.

B'Lou Bug Spray is made with five essential oils, all plant based, and is highly effective in repelling mosquitos, ticks, fleas, gnats, black flies, and more. Naturally, and simply. It contains oils many people use directly on their skin every day, but together, labeled as an insect repellent, registration with the EPA is required.  B'Lou Bug Spray, LLC, has already obtained both a Company Number and an Establishment Number. The next step is the Product Registration, and the price is steep. Beyond that, B'Lou Bug will need to be registered in each and every state in which it will be sold. Consumer protection is the goal. We are more than happy to be in compliance. The sooner the better.

Once those hurdles are cleared, we are setting up with another small business in Massachusetts to handle manufacturing. Then B'Lou Bug Spray will be available anywhere and everywhere. We are already set up with Amazon and other large retailers, with a major distributor standing by, and will be ready and able to meet the demand once the EPA gives us the go ahead.

story:
Hi, and welcome to 'The Job App'

In talking to business out there, it is apparent that it is both difficult and costly to find good staff.

Via 'The Job App' based in the Sydney area, we aim to create an app that lets business (though the swipe of a button) shortlist staff for as little as $1-$2 each person.

The benefits to business are enourmous;

1. No messy handling of 1000s resumes and paperwork

2. You are in control at all times

3. Cost Economical. You pay only for what you use (as opposed to a job board, you pay no matter if you get 10 people apply or 2000 people to your ad)

4. Time Economical. No need to get back to hundreds of non successful applicants


Whats in it for me?

Well, not to mention being part of something revolutionary. there are some things we will give you in return; ($49 individuals/$199 business)

1. Foundation membership- free use of the app forever (Value over $500)

2. Business sponsorship, your branding will be highlighted in the app

3. Added to facebook community for recruiting and job seeking advice & guidance

4. Ability to provide input and feedback as well as beta test the app development

Should the project get the green light, I will be putting $500 of my own funds towards the app development and marketing.


The Impact

The App will give business an alternative to posting an ad up on a job board like seek and gumtree.

Social impacts will be enourmous. Considering there is a 20% youth unemployment rate and the fact the segment are early adopters to technology, this will provide excellent tool for young jobseekers to be searched by local businesses.

Not to mention the impact of lower time and economic costs to business with the old model of recruiting via job boards.

The app is free for jobseekers to use.


Risks & Challenges

There are always risks assigned to any project.

The major risk is having too many business looking for staff and not enough people registering initially for it to be of value to them. 

However, we will be doing an extensive paid social media campaign to get talent to the app if the project gets the green light with funding.

The other risk is how much input does one get on the app development. The rule is I ask the community a question on what they think on a stage of the development and they get 1 vote within a specified timeframe. Majority rules and democracy applies.



Other Ways You Can Help


If you cant contribute financially, I would appreciate if you could;

a) 'Like' and 'Share' the FB group 'The Job App' which is here www.facebook.com/thejobapp2

b) Subscribe to my youtube channel https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC7RcSty2rDr6DdhK5TJm6hQ  

c) Tell others who are looking for work(particularly in Sydney/Wollongong) to check us out on the links above.


Thank you for reading and your interest in this project, it means alot! 

:)

story:
closetAUCTIONS is an e-commerce marketplace where consumers and merchants connect.

Reward points are earned throughout the site and used to 'bid' auction-style on brands, products and services sponsored by our brand partners.  Items out for bid retail from $25 to $300.  Items may include skydiving, restaurants, electronics, wedding, apparel, entertainment, skincare, home goods, party goods and the list goes on... oh, and you can also trade items from your closet with other members nationwide to earn points.

         ______________________________________________________________

 

Hi there!  I’m Christine Fleming, CEO & Founder

About Christine - Growing up in East Los Angeles as a child on welfare and having one parent has taught me to reach for the stars.  As I have grown both personally and professionally I have learned that having dreams can only take you so far unless you truly dedicate yourself to what you believe in.  Luckily, I have always had a scrappy, entrepreneurial mindset.

The idea of closetAUCTIONS came to me five years ago after one of my many 'live' auction charity events.  As I researched the e-commerce industry which is male dominant, I decided that I wanted to provide a ‘fun’ way for merchants and shoppers to connect and at the same time, save money.  Hence closetAUCTIONS was born.

With your help and support we can target our launch for this September.  The monies will help us hire our new team members, produce 'live' closet auction events and media.   You should know the money does not cover my own efforts.  Should we accept funds above our goal, we promise to make the site more exciting for many of you to win fabulous items on behalf of closetAUCTIONS.

Not everyone believes or understands what ‘Crowd Funding’ is so the more people we share this with, the more others will be able to contribute.

My team and I truly appreciate your support!  We look forward to seeing you enjoy our site once we launch. 

Cheers, Christine  

 

 

  Signature girl Sammy

story:
We Are Blue Owl Coffee 
Since I was 15 years old, everything important in my life happened in a coffee shop.  From first dates, to starting record labels, it all had some delicious caffeinated beverage to encourage open communication.  This is what brought the idea of Blue Owl Coffee into being. The thought of being a neighborhood anchor for open dialogue,  a voice of lasting hope, and those delicious espresso concoctions is what drives Blue Owl Coffee.  

What's this fundraiser for?
As we inch nearer, and nearer, to having our own brick and mortar store in REO Town Lansing, we are hoping to build conversations and neighborhod partnerships. Our intent is not only to raise some needed capital, but to give our neighbors conversation starters with some fun perks!  Blue Owl Coffee has set a Goal to raise $15,000.  This would cover one months expenses for the shop.  Obviously,  it would be amazing to see our friends and neighbors jump on board to create their own coffee shop moments, and go way beyond that mark! The amount of stress from the opening day, and the resounding questions, "Are we going to make it?" can be removed by your support!  The ability to welcome our friends into our new home, for a drink, gives us purpose! You can help us to do that more easily with this campaign. The fifteen year old in me, will be so over the moon with gratitutde, that you may see the adult me, do a little dance of joy behind the bar!  Blue Owl Coffee looks forward to seeing, and serving, all of you soon! Thanks for supporting us and for spreading the word!

story:
About San Vicente Chapel

San Vicente Chapel is a humble establishment devoted to their deep-rooted faith and a love for the Christian religion. For the villagers within the community, San Vicente Chapel is the core of the community's strength and a place to worship the love for God and their savior Jesus Christ. The chapel is overseen by Father Cruf F. Climaco, St. Anthony of Padua Parish, Anahawan, Southern Leyte.

Inside the existing San Vicente Chapel

The local parishioners whom attend San Vicente commit much of their lives and time to promoting community growth and development through hard work, social unity and educating future generations the importance of handing down necessary family and community traditions critical to their survival as a people. It is because of San Vicente Chapel that many local parishioners are afforded opportunities they would not otherwise have had. We would now like to request your generous help in making sure this community could continue to grow and develop.


Community Background

The remote village of San Vicente is one of 14 Barangays within Anahawan; a province of Sothern Leyte located in the Eastern Visayas region of the Philippine Islands and considered the second least populated region of the Philippines. Much of the surrounding areas of San Vicente experiences yearly rainfalls of over 60 inches on average lending to devastating landslides and extreme flooding. 

The community of San Vicente itself depends exclusively upon self-sustaining efforts and the sharing of those efforts with others within the community. Farming and fishing are an important way of life and help provide needed food for the local villagers. The entire community lives off what they can trade, grow, sow and catch. Fisherman generally begin fishing at 3 am and continue their efforts until sundown every day. While some of the fish is consumed as a food, it is also traded for other goods and services within the community. 

Farming mainly consists of growing small amounts of rice and vegetables (known as the vegi 7). Another essential farm crop includes coconut, which is one of the most important crops of the region. In addition to crops, farming of animals such as pigs, chickens and caribou are also important resources for sustaining the community. The people of San Vicente understand the importance of sharing and giving to the community to promote continued growth and development.

A Community's Story

This story was related by Flaviano Butalon, the oldest man in the barangay during the early part of the 19th century.

Long time ago, barangay San Vicente, a place best suited to farming and fishing, was peaceful and orderly. The people were hardworking and the lifestyle was simple and happy. One day, the barrio (now barangay) was greatly disturbed by the dangerous and contagious disease Cholera; a terrible epidemic which caused deaths every day.

During that time, no medical doctors could be found but quack doctors. Herbal medicines and oracion (Latin prayers whispered to the patients. Some used their saliva as medicines spitted at the center of the head during said orations. Unfortunately, those herbal medicines and orations did not work out well. The virus continued destroying life, young and old.

The elders are very much respected by the people. They served as advisers in the barangay. The eldest of them called the elders to a meeting. One of them believed that the epidemic was a punishment from heaven. One could imagine that deaths occurred every now and then. The group agreed to ask and pray to God through the Patron Saint Senior San Vicente Ferrer. On the shoulders of four men, hearty and serious procession (praying and singing on the way) was done around the barangay in ocho ocho form.

After several procession, untoward deaths stopped. From then on, the people made the prayers, novena and procession every Friday evening at 6pm. The said old chapel is located where the barangay hall is situated today.

The succeeding generations have relied on the heavenly assistance of Sr. San Vicente Ferrer. Those who migrated to other places come home to attend prayers, novena and procession. During the fiesta of Sr. San Vicente Ferrer, others send their donations for the chapel as a sign of gratitude for the countless blessings and graces received through the intercession of our beloved Patron Sr. San Vicente Ferrer.


Why We Started This Campaign

This campaign emerged out of a desire to help people I didn't even know. Until recent, I had never heard of San Vicente, nevertheless there was a community of Christians working hard to complete renovations of their chapel. Through a friend, I had heard that the entire community was trying to complete their chapel and only needed a small amount of materials to complete the outside. 

As you can see by the pictures, San Vicente Chapel is in need of valued and appreciated materials to finish the outside shell of the structure and protect their very sacred alter from the coming rains (average days of rainfall each year are 160). 

Although they have all the needed labor, which is being volunteered by the community, as well as local tradesman are, the materials to finish the chapel are not able to be purchased because of the low income status of the community. 

Without the needed materials, the efforts of the community can not progress toward their goal of having a new chapel to maintain their strong community bond, which is held together by their Christian faith. 


What the Money Will Be Used For

The donations collected through the global community will be used to purchase materials needed to finish the outside. Those materials include:

  • Outside Shell Materials - $3500.00 approx.
  • Roofing Materials - $2500.00 approx.

Reaching a goal of $6000.00 will be a true blessing and greatly appreciated by people whom understand the importance of sharing and giving to promote community growth. 


How You Can Help?

Please give what you can - every dollar will make a difference and even if you can't contribute financially, you can help share our story with your family and friends via Facebook, Twitter and other social media. We want to reach as many people as we can in the global community.

We truly thank you for whatever you may be able to do.

story:
Short Summary

A little bit about me: I am a queer, trans artist, musician, and innovator.

Bay Area hardships of finding housing--problematic for artists, activists; tiny home community in urban setting, solutions...

As far back as I can remember I've known that there are other ways of living life outside of what we're presented with by our capitalist society, outside of the status quo and mainstream American values. This project is, in part, my pursuit of that "knowing", putting my ideals into action.

This project is inspired by my own life experiences of not always having a place to stay that I could call my own, it’s inspired by past experiences of being homeless, and by my history in the foster care system, which I was basically born into.

I'm also inspired by an innate quest for freedom, self sufficiency, sustainability, and mortgage/rent-free life. 

Through this project I have this amazing opportunity to create a lifestyle better suited to my needs and aspirations. I look forward to being able to offer the fruits of this experience to anyone else interested in modeling their life around similar ideals and values!!

What We Need & What You Get

Here is a breakdown of the $15,000 fundraising goal:

Because of my limited experience in the field of construction, the success of this project depends on the help and know-how of skilled carpenters, electricians, and plumbers. To me, it's very important to be able to bring this opportunity to Queer and Trans* people of color in those trades and to be able to compensate them for their skills and their time.

This is where well over half of funds raised will go. Your donations will enable me to support the people from within our community whose skills are crucial to making this vision a reality. 

Another important aspect of this project is recruiting volunteer help. I would like to be able to support folks who volunteer by providing meals and covering the cost of transportation. Your donations will make that a possibility. At least 10% of funds will be allotted for this part of the project.

Finally, about $2,000 of the funds raised will cover the rent at Nimby, a creative DIY space in East Oakland where we’ll be building the tiny home. 

To re-cap, the three main allotments funds will go to:

1.  Compensating skilled crafts-people from within the community

2.  Feeding volunteers, covering their transportation costs

3.  Covering rent of the build-site

Any remaining funds will be set aside to cover the cost of any unexpected expenses.

***In case you're wondering about the cost of materials, I've managed to save about $11k to cover those expenses.***

Don't forget to check out the "Perks" section to learn what you can recieve in return for your gift to this campaign.  Here  are some pics of what you'll get from these "perks"


The Impact

Upon the completion of this tiny home project I have two further goals which have to do with giving back to local communities. 

The first initiative is to find and reclaim vacant lots in East and West Oakland for the purpose of starting urban agriculture programs. My hope is to bring community empowerment via access to fresh produce to communities that I feel are often overlooked unless they're being cited as hubs of violence and crime. 

The second initiative is to set a precedent for communities of tiny home-dwellers to exist in urban settings. Again, this looks like utilizing unused land to support alternative living styles crafted around the values of sustainability and self-sufficiency.

With both initiatives, my focus is on queer communities and communities of color because that's where I come from.

I also look forward to being able to set up shop, so to speak, in different neighborhoods and offer my skills and services as a sound healer/practitioner.

Risks & Challenges

In the event that this fundraising campaign is not 100% successful, the lack of these funds would greatly impede the smooth and timely progress of this endeavor, especially since majority of these funds are intended to compensate and support the people helping me. 
If we fall too short of our goal, it might mean needing to postpone the build until I can save enough to move forward again. 
Other than that, I have confidence that we can pull of this build within 3-5months of our first official day. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you aren't able to contribute, it doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Please spread the word and help me make some noise about this campaign.
  • Once the build is underway I'll be needing folks to volunteer in a variety of ways.
  • Please reach out if you'd be able to help haul and transport materials, lend us tools, or want to do some hands-on work.
  • Also, once the home is complete my next task is to find a place to park it. I'm open to your leads and suggestions.

Thanks so much for taking the time to visit my page and watch this video. Please know that any amount you can give is helpful and deeply appreciated.  Also, check back from time to time for updates and to see how the campaign is progressing.

Lastly, I’ve started a blog on Tumblr to document the process of the build so that it may serve as a resource for others looking to do something similar. The link will be posted somewhere below.

Peace & love!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Adrian, I moved from New York to S. Florida five years ago. As a hobby and a way to make new friends, I started running unique and creative group events in S. Florida to get out of the bored rut. After a while it took on a life of its own. Once I started our first few events and saw how much fun it was bringing strangers together, it fueled my obsession of doing this on a much broader scale. It brings me great joy when members rave about how much fun they had, or how they met a new friend at one of our events. See testimonials below. This funding will help me start a massive marketing campaign. Thus allowing for many new members in your area and expanding into several new cities. Look for us in your city soon.

You can see pictures and types of events at www.MeetMeThereEvents.com

Before moving I owned an event planning business in NYC for over 18 years. Having worked for clients who were planning such important private events, I became highly skilled in being detailed oriented, diligent, resourceful and creative. After exiting the private party world, I went on to become a Licensed Realtor for RE/MAX. But, they say, "Do what you love and you'll love what you do". Well, I love running this group and want to do it full time. I've never had so much fun in my life creating fun for other people.

Your contributions are actually not for me. They are for the members. As they are the recipients of this service. Life is filled with work, families, stress, bills and plenty of adult seriousness. Members need our group as an outlet to express their inner kid and to have more laughter and enjoyment in their lives. Because we do these as group events, they benefit by meeting many new friends that they wouldn't normally meet in their daily lives.

What We Need & What You Get

$25,000 is what it would take to get it started. I have been out of pocket for all costs associated with running this group. However, I have devised a very affordable member fee that helps in the cost of running the group. It's extremely affordable with no pressure to participate if they can't. Unlike a similar group who charges over 100 times what we do. Plus, they limit the membership to a year. Once our members pay very affordable annual fee.

A small portion would be for legal fees. Incorporation fees, liability agreement, a few web page enhancements etc.. The Majority, approximately $20,000, would be used to run radio spots for approximately 8 - 10 months consistently. It would not be spent all at once. Between, $1,500 and $2,000 a month would be spent on this marketing. This would allow for consistency and more importantly, letting me see the conversion rate after 90 days. The marketing will drive traffic to our web site and increase membership.

If the goal is not met, I will still use the funds in the same manner and begin marketing. I will work hard as continuing to raise the balance from angels and out of pocket myself.

One perk offered to any contributor would be a complimentary membership.

The Impact

Not only do we plan events for our members but, we post information about charities, community events and encourage them to get involved. From time to time we actually plan an outing that brings our members to a charity event such as when we did the "Walk for MS", or "beach cleanup". Part of my plan is to be able to grow the membership and have recurring community events that we can actively participate in on a regular basis. Part of our blog is dedicated to allowing members to post information about charitable events or non profits. This gives them an outlet to share with other members. My goal is to be a bigger part of the community.

My success is the fact that I have planned over 200 events and brought many new friendships to life. Your contribution will allow people who are looking for more social interaction, the ability to do so more frequently without costing and arm and a leg. Plainly put, I am a people person. I work hard at fulfilling my members needs and wants and put them first before mine. I have dozens of unsolicited testimonials from members who have said such great things about how I planned and executed our events.

Here are some unsolicited testimonials from real members

•This was my first meet me there event with this group. Everyone was really fun and made me feel right at home. Great group.   -Scott

•Had a great time. Well organized. Nice people.  -Kate

•Yeaaaaaa! I had fun! and I won money! woo hoo - will post pics later. Thanks Adrian!!  -Abigail 

•"Get out and enjoy these amazing adventures. The flying trapeze class is an incredible experience and the Segway tour was a blast! Don't miss out!! –Mari

•"It was my first event, I will be attending more. Everyone is very friendly ” –Diane

•"Wow lots of events to choose from and great opportunity to meet others.“ –Jean

•"Very impressed with Adrian's event-planning skills. I will be looking for more of his meetups to attend.“ –Melissa

•What a great time had at beach day. We played volleyball, swam, paddle ball, and had some great fun meeting people.  -John

story:
Short Summary

 Dumela bo-mma le bo-rra! (That means “Hello ladies and gentlemen” in Setswana, the language spoken here in Botswana). My name is Tori, and I am an American college student studying abroad. I am part of the CIEE Arts and Sciences Program in Gaborone, Botswana. Currently, I am doing an internship at Kagisano Society Women’s Shelter. This is a shelter working to end gender-based (domestic) violence. It provides counselling among other services, as well as temporary shelter for women and children who have left abusive partners/homes. 

My campaign is working to economically empower women who have suffered gender-based violence. The funds that we raise will go towards helping these women get job skills/training and/or education courses so they can be financially independent. 

This is a particularly pressing issue because when women do not have means to provide for themselves financially after they leave their abusive partners, who tend to be the breadwinners, they may go back to the partners or turn to other ways to support themselves that aren't sustainable. Some even turn to such means as prostitution, putting themselves and their health at risk. With economic stability, these women will be able to provide for themselves and their children and live a fulfilling life free from gender-based violence. 

What We Need 

My goal is to raise $3,000 US dollars, which in Pula (the currency in Botswana) is 29,612.10 Pula. 

The money that you donate will be transmitted directly into the Kagisano Society Women's Shelter's bank account. The money will be allocated to clients on a case by case basis, to pay for things like job training programs and business sessions. 

Even if we do not reach our goal of raising $3,000 US dollars (or 29,612.10 Pula), the money we do raise will still go to Kagisano.  

The Impact

This project is important because essentially, economic independence is freedom. Women who earn their own living no longer have to go back to an abusive partner for money, which would most likely continue the cycle of violence. Furthermore, the self-confidence gained in beginning a career would help these women feel fulfilled and proud. Think about the first time you got a job; the pride and joy you felt is the same way these women can feel. Not only are they finally free from economic dependence/oppression, they are also free from abuse.

Donating to this campaign would allow women at the shelter to be able to pursue economic endeavors such as;

-attend job training courses in various fields 

-attend courses at local technical colleges 

-attend sessions on starting and/or maintaining a business, and then actually having the funds to start the business (typically selling items such as food, clothes, etc.)

-attend agricultural programs (learning to grow crops)

-learn to sew/tailor, and create and sell clothes

These are just some of the options the clients would have; the shelter needs money, however, to pay the fees for these programs and sessions. 

I personally work with clients at the shelter every week, and I am inspired hearing about what they would like to do after they leave the shelter. These women have dreams, whether it be running a cafe or a daycare center or a clothing shop, and they refuse to let the violence in their past stop them from seeing a brighter future ahead. That is why I am asking for these donations; I would like to help them see brighter days.   

Risks & Challenges

When donating to any project/organization, one often wonders where the money is actually going. I completely understand, because I wonder that myself. But this campaign is legitimate; the money will be going to Kagisano Society Women's Shelter. As an intern there, I know the organization well. I trust it to use the funds for the purpose of helping their shelter clients move on to a sustainable life. 

Even when my internship (as a Shelter Interaction Officer) ends in a few months, I intend to follow-up at the shelter and ensure that the funds are being used for the aforementioned purposes. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, and I completely understand. But, that doesn't mean you can't help in other ways:

  • If you could spread the word to others about the campaign, that would be much-appreciated! The more publicity, the better- because more attention also means more awareness for the issues of domestic violence in Botswana and women's empowerment! 
  • Also, you can share this link on Facebook and other social media sites, or send it through email, or just spread it word-of-mouth!   

Thank you so much for your support-it's incredible what the power of generosity can do in this world.
story_txt:
Short Summary 
 Dumela bo-mma le bo-rra! (That means “Hello ladies and gentlemen” in Setswana, the language spoken here in Botswana). My name is Tori, and I am an American college student studying abroad. I am part of the CIEE Arts and Sciences Program in Gaborone, Botswana. Currently, I am doing an internship at Kagisano Society Women’s Shelter. This is a shelter working to end gender-based (domestic) violence. It provides counselling among other services, as well as temporary shelter for women and children who have left abusive partners/homes. 
My campaign is working to economically empower women who have suffered gender-based violence. The funds that we raise will go towards helping these women get job skills/training and/or education courses so they can be financially independent. 
This is a particularly pressing issue because when women do not have means to provide for themselves financially after they leave their abusive partners, who tend to be the breadwinners, they may go back to the partners or turn to other ways to support themselves that aren't sustainable. Some even turn to such means as prostitution, putting themselves and their health at risk. With economic stability, these women will be able to provide for themselves and their children and live a fulfilling life free from gender-based violence. 
   What We Need  My goal is to raise $3,000 US dollars, which in Pula (the currency in Botswana) is 29,612.10 Pula. 
The money that you donate will be transmitted directly into the Kagisano Society Women's Shelter's bank account. The money will be allocated to clients on a case by case basis, to pay for things like job training programs and business sessions. 
Even if we do not reach our goal of raising $3,000 US dollars (or 29,612.10 Pula), the money we do raise will still go to Kagisano.  
    The Impact This project is important because essentially, economic independence is freedom. Women who earn their own living no longer have to go back to an abusive partner for money, which would most likely continue the cycle of violence. Furthermore, the self-confidence gained in beginning a career would help these women feel fulfilled and proud. Think about the first time you got a job; the pride and joy you felt is the same way these women can feel. Not only are they finally free from economic dependence/oppression, they are also free from abuse.

-attend courses at local technical colleges

-attend agricultural programs (learning to grow crops)
-learn to sew/tailor, and create and sell clothes
These are just some of the options the clients would have; the shelter needs money, however, to pay the fees for these programs and sessions. 
I personally work with clients at the shelter every week, and I am inspired hearing about what they would like to do after they leave the shelter. These women have dreams, whether it be running a cafe or a daycare center or a clothing shop, and they refuse to let the violence in their past stop them from seeing a brighter future ahead. That is why I am asking for these donations; I would like to help them see brighter days.

But this campaign is legitimate; the money will be going to Kagisano Society Women's Shelter. As an intern there, I know the organization well. I trust it to use the funds for the purpose of helping their shelter clients move on to a sustainable life. 
Even when my internship (as a Shelter Interaction Officer) ends in a few months, I intend to follow-up at the shelter and ensure that the funds are being used for the aforementioned purposes. 
    Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, and I completely understand. But, that doesn't mean you can't help in other ways:  If you could spread the word to others about the campaign, that would be much-appreciated! The more publicity, the better- because more attention also means more awareness for the issues of domestic violence in Botswana and women's empowerment!  Also, you can share this link on Facebook and other social media sites, or send it through email, or just spread it word-of-mouth!      Thank you so much for your support-it's incredible what the power of generosity can do in this world.

story:
What Is Locallective?

Locallective is a rotating 5,000-square-foot private event venue featuring local Chicago artists with concentrations in the finest art, music, fashion, food and drink. Locallective Loft accommodates eclectic urban happenings in a uniquely converted gallery space. The space is ideal for fashion shows, retail pop-ups, artist exhibitions, workshops, film screenings, underground dining, corporate gatherings and more.


Why Restoration?

Finding a permanent home to bring Locallective to fruition was just the tip of the iceberg. With 126 years of charm and plenty of square-footage, we have found ourselves a hidden gem in Wicker Park. The building retains most of its original historic attributes, but decades of studio and workshop use have left quite a mark on the unit.

Beyond aesthetics, we conclude that ‘original’ does not necessarily mean functional. Addressing cloth wire electric, corroding plumbing, crumbling floors, and lightless ceilings has been just the beginning of the last 7 months of restoration.  

In order to continue growing, we have some critical projects to finalize before we can obtain the next level of licensing and permits in Cook County. These upgrades will require the help of professionals to fully equip us with a solid foundation to flourish.


What Projects are on the Docket?

  1. Install HVAC | Tune-up furnace
  2. Install permanent LED lighting
  3. Install overhead hood for stove
  4. Install storefront door for optimal visibility
  5. Address electrical code work for compliance
  6. Repair bathroom for permits and licensing
  7. Purchase security system and surveillance cameras
  8. Repair bar for licensing
  9. Repair kitchen for licensing
  10. Repair entry staircase for safety

Why Do We Need Your Help?

We've managed to bootstrap the financials thus far, but the evolution of Locallective has happened quicker than we ever could have imagined! Our team has hit a monetary threshold, and in order to meet the demands of Chicago, we need to hire contractors.

Events fund a small percentage of our scale of services and ability to give artists a fresh unparalleled environment to grow within. Every dollar goes directly into the space, so we're able to be a more accommodating venue.


Other Ways to Contribute!

We are a team of artists, if money is tight - we totally get it.  We hope you feel inspired to join us, even if you don't have the dollars to donate there are other ways to help and stay in touch:

  • Make some noise and get the word out about our campaign!

  • Use the IndieGoGo share tools.

  • Go to the Locallective website and check out our upcoming events.

  • Come visit and say hello, we love visitors!

  • Find us on your favorite social media platform and give us a "like".


Latest Press

Locallective: Bringing Underground Art to the Forefront in Chicago by Free People

A New Cocktail Gallery Shindig in Wicker Park by Thrillist 

50 Options: Here's Your Comprehensive Guide to New Year's Eve by Chicago Eater

Time lapse video of our current exhibition "Day Old Pie" by Walrus Cobbler:

A dancefilm by Outrun the Sunlight and Audiotree captured in our formal gallery:

story:
Venue Viking

Venue Viking,Michael McAleenan, CEO: is an online interactive web application allowing event planners and individuals to navigate, explore and connect events to venues.  The Venue Viking platform capitalizes on users or “Explorers” searching a variety of venues, matching the events exact needs, both quickly and efficiently.  

Why are we asking for your help?

Since the start of Venue Viking we have funded ourselves (bootstrapped) through the entire development phase. We thought we might be able to bootstrap the entire start-up but as time goes on we are realizing pretty quick we need help. Everyday our application gets better and better but it is hard to share our product with the world with little to no money left for advertising.  

Where does your money go?

Your money will help Venue Viking continue to grow and revolutionize the process of finding, planning and booking an event space. Here are some of the items your money will go to:
  • Advertising
  • Venue Data Specialist 
  • Marketing Collateral 
  • Trade Shows

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't worry if you cant help us fund Venue Viking you can help in so many other ways.

  • Communtiy Awareness
  • Telling friends and family members planning an event about Venue Viking
  • Perhaps you work at a facility that host events, share Venue Viking with them. 
  • Or just send us some positive vibes

story:
MY Story:

This video is only a basic prototype set of units for testing the concepts of the transmitting and the repeat processes. These will remove problems like line of sight, foothills, curves, structures and foliage of the alerts and/or communications. When we tested the Motorcycle Group Alert (MGA) it was then that the idea had merit and will be a big hit among all motorcycle riders. If in a group or solo the product has something for YOU.

From the data plan that enables text messages to your unit that is mounted to your handle bars and to the full color animated radar that when you slide screen one out of the way that is similar to and android or I-Phone to get to the full GPS.

We will also be implementing a little known ability to the GPS that will allow you to see not only where you are but your group will also show up on your GPS screen. If a member sends an alert then they will show up as the one who activated the alert system to all the riders that are equipped with this device with a red dot on top of there image on everyone's GPS.

The Roanoke Police Department has shown some real interest in this product and could be a whole new target for R&D.

I have 6 years in the design and process of getting this completed and is a great dream of mine.

Any investor that helps with this funding will also be considered one of the family and invited to events that will occur.

Information:

Since 2009, Terry Tedford discovered a need for a device that can improve the communication within motorcycle riding groups and with improved communication, improve safety. Through a series of events that were witnessed while out on rides, it became clear that a need exists but there is no solution. T.L. Tedford Enterprises, Inc. has developed that solution through Motorcycle Group Alert™. Motorcycle Group Alert™ is a patent pending touchscreen electronic device, which once mounted on the handlebars of every bike in the group, will allow every group member to visually receive warnings and alerts. This is superior to any current method, but not intrusive. T.L. Tedford Enterprises, Inc. contends that motorcyclists do not want to chat with one another, but they do want to know when there is a pothole up ahead, and they don’t want to be left behind when they break down unexpectedly. This is the function of Motorcycle Group Alert™. Safety is the objective.

The Opportunity and the Strategy

As mentioned above, the opportunity with Motorcycle Group Alert™ is to fulfill a need in safety that exists in the group motorcycle riding market. Since information flows through groups, often at an incredibly quick pace, T.L. Tedford Enterprises, Inc. will use this phenomenon to its advantage. Once the value of the product is recognized by a few individuals in a group, the excitement will spread to other members of the group. Additionally, many riders ride with more than one group. This provides opportunity for cross-group seeding of the idea. Motorcyclists love recommendations from other riders. This phenomenon will not be difficult to propagate.

Motorcyclists congregate many times each year at or as a group at major motorcycle rallies. These present T.L. Tedford Enterprises, Inc. an opportunity to educate bikers about the product, and demonstrate the benefits as well. Since initial sales of Motorcycle Group Alert™ will be online via a well-known motorcycle accessory website, the exposure will be international immediately. Through marketing campaigns aligned with this website, and other online presences, knowledge of the product will be disseminated. At the bike rallies customers will have an opportunity to put their hands on the product and run it through its paces. They will also have an opportunity to purchase the unit at the rally.

Trade shows are historically a good venue for information dissemination. T.L. Tedford Enterprises, Inc. will take advantage of numerous opportunities to attend such shows. With good educational materials onsite, this will provide excellent exposure of Motorcycle Group Alert™.

The Target Market and Projections

The target market is all motorcyclists that participate in group rides. As of 2010 this segment made up 15 percent of the total motorcycle riding market with a historical trend of 6.6 percent annual increase. Projecting the numbers along the trend line provides an estimate of 1.4 million riders in our segment (9.3 million in the total motorcycle market) in 2012. With rising fuel cost and consumers’ drive to improve their fuel economy, the trend on the total market is expected to continue its annual increase of 6.6 percent. We find, however, the target market will not increase at the same rate because there is no affirmable correlation between purchasing a motorcycle for fuel efficiency and riding in group rides. But, some new market entrants are likely to enter our target market as they adopt their new lifestyle of riding on two wheels.

The Competitive Advantages

The competitive advantage of Motorcycle Group Alert™ is the focus and improvement on safety. There are many motorcycle accessories available to consumers, and there are many accessories that claim they improve safety. However, none use an active communication process employed by our product. This is not a communication device for leisure communications, such as a VHF headset, or cell phone. This is an alert device that provides user defined safety alerts to everyone in a group. Bikers do not want to be intrusively interrupted from their communion with the open road. They do, however, want to know when there is trouble ahead, or a member of the group is having trouble behind. Motorcycle Group Alert™ is not intrusive – it is safety!

story:
Our Story

Two great minds from two different industries have joined forces and become one.  I, Raven and my best friend Ashley have become the faces Studio Chic, a place designed to be every woman's one stop shop for both fashion and beauty.  Ashley is the face of the Studio Chic Design Studio where custom designs are created to fit every woman personality, and Raven is the face of the Studio Chic Salon, the place where individuals come to receive the latest hair trends with a hint of chic.
How You Can Help                                                                                                                                       
By helping Studio Chic with its startup, you are supporting a small independent business step out into a world where future possibilities are limitless, and in return, Studio Chic will provide you a relaxing atmosphere that cultivates beauty, fashion, and artistic passion.
What Is Needed                                                                                                                    
Studio Chic is a small business that is starting out with no business loans nor investors.  This is where we ask for you to pitch in.  Studio Chic's location is in desperate need of a makeover that will not only reflect its owners, but will be appealing to current and future clients, as well as in need of equipment before its launch in June!  You donations will help with the cost of salon furniture and equipment, professional retail products (hair,skin, makeup, clothing, etc), online booking and POS system, shelving and display units, sewing equipment, and dress forms.  Every dollar that is donated will be used in the renovation process and the beautification of Studio Chic, Where Beauty Meets Fashion...  In return, Studio Chic will provide our donators with a discounted service of their choice as well as a mystery gift.  Our goal is that everyone feels that they are a part of Studio Chic.
You Can Also Help By                                                                                                            
SPREADING THE WORD by posting this campaign to your Facebook,Twitter, Instagram, or any other social networking site!  The closer we are able to meet our goal, the faster we will be able to open our doors in the summer of 2015.  Thank you so much for your support!
