story: We apologize for the  incorrect campaign amount of (''$1,000,000,000.00''), that was posted above.  Our goal is to raise (''$1,000,000.00''), together, I do believe that this can be accomplished.   If only 1,000,000 people were to donate $1.00 each, we will reach our first goal.  Once our first goal is completed, we will be on our way towards success.  We are going to start a legal non-profit 501(c)(3) business, of which is a federal number assigned to non-profit organizations.  Initially, I am hoping to establish at least 5-10 successful minority owned businesses, that will eventually attract more .  Professional instructors will be employed to train, and   provide guidance throughout the process.  We will require each recipient to complete business classes in order to develop, and achieve a well prepared business plan ("free of charge").  Upon completion, there will be a written agreement that each individual business will be required to sign to pay back the total funds distributed among them in order for the National Minority Business Fund to benefit future additional businesses for many years to come.  We are asking for support from our friends, family, community, and other diversified professional businesses to contribute to our campaign cause.  Service veteran, Mr. Roderick L. Presley, founder of The National Minority Business Fund, whom was honorably discharged from The United States Air Force, and was assigned to The 308th. Tactical Air Command Squadron as an Aircrew Life Support Specialist, based in Homestead, Fl.  U.S.A.F..  He has a solid belief, ("that your attitude determines your altitude")!  Thank you for your interest, time, and consideration in joining our professional team.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      The National Minority Business Fund                                                                                            Mr. Roderick L. Presley,  C.E.O./founder

story:
Here's the Scoop...

"Our popular culture reinforces the idea that dealing with pet waste is a pain in the butt, no pun intended. We're out to change that fallacious idea one pickup at a time! Help us establish our program to serve people in need of some pet waste assistance.

Let's face it, picking up dog waste is cumbersome. To many American's it's the worst thing about having a dog, that will all change with the development of our "PoopSter app" Within a few clicks on your Android or IOS device, you'll be on the way to a cleaner yard for your four legged friends and family.

More about the Project

We are a veteran owned and operated business start-up in Michigan. We provide pet waste removal service currently too Macomb, St.Clair, Sanilac and parts of Oakland county.We are hoping to expand this year with your help and launch our  PoopSter app to go Nationwide. For as long as the dog has been man's best friend, dog waste has posed a menace to man's nose and foot. Now science has revealed a more unsavory truth: It's an environmental pollutant.– This fact prompted us to dig deeper into a solution.  This is where we started to envision “PoopSter” and all the possible benefits we could bring to people and their pets:

  •  Stormwater carries pet waste and other pollutants directly into waterways.

  • Animal waste may contain harmful organisms such as Giardia, Salmonella and E. coli that can be transmitted to humans and other animals by ingesting contaminated water.

  • Roundworms and hookworms deposited by infected animals can live in the soil for long periods of time and be transmitted to other animals and humans.

  • It’s the law! Many urban and suburban areas require you to pick up after your pet. Even if there is no restriction, cleaning up after your pet is always the right thing to do.

  • No one likes to step in pet waste and spread it into homes, cars and businesses.

When reviewing these benefits and much more, it inspired and assured us that this is a business that needs to be re-invented.  This paired with attention to detail and quality service will make us the leader in our industry. Our mission is to take care of every customer and staff member with the upmost respect and care while providing an efficient, on demand poo pickup and removal service.  We feel this will differentiate us from other services in our industry. Our client's will never have to worry about cleaning up after fido again!

About Us

Our company is passionate with creating an unmatched pet waste removal company that is customer service driven and extremely sanitary. Unfortunately, we have noticed when companies design new concepts they contain preliminary flaws but our goal is to stay dedicated to quality because we know your health and cleanliness is at stake! We have engineered a unique method and user-friendly results that is second to none. Not only that, but they are more affordable so do not have to worry about it being price prohibitive. Help us make this a reality and let’s get the poop removed for less!

How You Can Help

For us to bring the “PoopSter app” to life, we need your support!

Your generous funding will help us get things started in order to move us forward with our concept. It will assist us with the cost app development, marketing and production of locations.   We will also use our funding to test our concept in multipule area's this Summer as part of our pilot beta. We are in the process of choosing two or three cities for our R&D and test lauch.

The “PoopSter Project” needs pledging but above all it needs your attention and interest! If you love this idea as much as we do then please take a moment to click on one of our social media buttons (Facebook, Twitter and YouTube at the bottom of the page). Help us spread the word and get things started!

How We'll Use the Funds

We need about $65,000 in order to get things started. About half of this amount is going towards app development. The other half is going towards many things including marketing, materials, labor and related expenses for start-up growth. 

A vision for our future:

Hopefully we can grow and develop other ways to help out and here is something we are thinking about: Being Green. In our near future we would like to work with a renewable energy company and recycle the waste. Poo is a great way to create Methane. Methane can be used in many different renewable energy projects:)

Final Thank You and Links

We feel so grateful to everyone who has taken the time to read out campaign and for those who contributed what they could to make a difference and helping us spread the word.  We have spent the last few months working hard to bring our vision to life in this campaign and it was worth every minute thanks to all our generous supporters.  Please know your efforts, even the smallest, don’t go unnoticed.  We will continue to keep you posted on what your donation helped us achieve.  You are part of our “PoopSter” family.

If you cannot donate but you are interested in helping, please contact us so we can set you up with a referral program! You might even be able to earn perks, just by spreading the word!

If you wish to contact us:

Website: www.thepoodude.com

Our Social Media Connections:

  • Twitter: @PoopSter_MI

  • Facebook: www.facebook.com/thepoodude

  • YouTube: Click here to be brought to our PoopSter Video on Youtube.

If you have thoughts or would like to discuss a collaboration or sponsorship, we would love to hear from you, please feel free to contact us at dan@thepoodude.com

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.m

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
About #RedDotCampaign

Hello! Our names are Jewel Addy and Eva Woolridge, and we are 2015 graduates of the University of Maryland! 

Over what acted as our last college winter break, we came across a Huffington Post article by Eleanor Goldberg titled For Homeless Women, Getting their Period is One of the Most Difficult Challenges. It explained the lack of awareness and donations for women's health products (i.e. tampons and pads) to shelters. In turn, due to the lack of sanitary products, women in need may be subjected to high-risk health situations for the duration of their periods.

After reading the article and entering the  doorway of Eva's house in our New Jersey hometown, we thought about how we couldn't imagine being on our periods and not having the necessary supplies to aid it. How could someone else have to endure this? We often shower twice a day when on our period. How is this fair? These questions and thoughts birthed what we now call the #RedDotCampaign.

With planning kicking off on that January afternoon, we painted collection boxes, wrote proposals and emailed targeted University of Maryland organizations in February. By March 1, we had distributed boxes to our stellar participants and the #RedDotCampaign was entering full-swing.

Then it was April and we had about 15 organizations united in our cause. (*See below for list of participants.) Our collections were about 3,000 strong, but 7,000 shy of our goal of 10,000 individual collected products. We needed to generate more donations, so we gave Terrapin's Turf, a favored College Park bar, a call. Together with management, we planned a bar night with promotions to generate attendance and tampon/pad donations. One package of tampons or products got you free cover. We even convinced a group of guys, who were ready to pay the $5 cover, to get out of line and purchase tampons/pads so their money would go to a good cause. They came back with products in hand!

That night, we collected about 870+ items! Our collections had just received a little more steam. As April continued, we invited a few more groups to join the #RedDotCampaign. One of those organizations was the Delta Gamma Sorority at UMD. 

On a weekday evening, we drove to their sorority house and gave our first presentation on the #RedDotCampaign. It was filled with giggles regarding the menstrual cost of owning a vagina and concern knowing what women and trans men in need potentially endured. By the way, the average woman will use about 11,000 tampons/pads in her lifetime!

For us, this presentation marked the true adoption of our second campaign goal of embracing the period. It was important for people to remember the period was more than just a monthly burden or gift from the higher ups showing a person they're not pregnant. Isn't the first question asked to any woman or individual in transition: "what was the first day of your last menstrual cycle?" Periods symbolize a healthy reproductive system and the ability to add to the human race! They're like mini superwomen. 

So help us, help these mini superwomen and their partners in need. Donate to our #RedDotCampaign! We promise your funds will be used to start the eradication of individuals in need of tampons and pads while experiencing homelessness! 

Currently, the #RedDotCampaign  possesses 9,000+ products! Unfortunately, that still doesn't cover the 11,000 used by a single, average woman in her lifetime. It also doesn't satisfy our goal of 10,000. Help women in need. Help embrace the period. Donate to the #RedDotCampaign!

*Our Stellar UMD Participants:

UMD Black Student Union
A Woman’s Worth
Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Inc.
Delta Sigma Theta Sorority, Inc.
Alpha Xi Delta 
Lambda Theta Alpha Sorority, Inc.
Community Roots
UMD National Pan-Hellenic Council
UMD Feminists 
Alpha Phi Alpha Fraternity, Inc.
School of Public Health (Family Science Dept.)
UMD Vagina Monologues
Bedsider
UMD Latino Student Union
Lambda Upsilon Lambda Fraternity, Inc.
UMD Sex Week Delta Gamma
Alpha Phi Omega Service Fraternity

What We Need From You

We're asking you to help us reach a financial goal of $5,000. Although we've nearly reached our collection goal of 10,000 collected products, we felt there was still work to be done. The #RedDotCampaign didn't have to end with our becoming alumnas of the University of Maryland. 

With $5,000, we can purchase bulk, discounted tampons and pads to aid women in need in our nation's capital. We will also be donating a percentage of the collections to Baltimore to aid the unrest. 

Every penny counts and every donation is appreciated. Whether we reach this goal or not, your funds will be used for the period's greater good. But obviously we'd love to reach this goal!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our flyers, pictures and especially video with "#RedDotCampaign." A share could be a donation! Also please @BroadCity as it inspired our video and @AmyPoehlerSmartGirls because always embrace the period.

story:
Update:

We got our court date assigned: August 23rd!  It is much later than we had hoped, but we are thrilled regardless.  We will travel to Uganda around August 10th, then stay for however long it takes: probably 1 1/2 to 2 months.  

Who are these beautiful children?

Rolivin and Roseline are our adoptive daughters.  We are expecting to travel to Uganda to bring them home in August.  We have already paid over $20,000 towards their adoption costs, but still have A LOT more to go, including over $10,000 in travel costs.

These girls have already been through so much: the loss of both of their parents, having to leave the town they were born and raised in to live in an orphanage, and almost losing each other.  We hope you feel the way we do, and want to do everything in your power to help them find the happiness they deserve. 

Who are we?

We, Graeme and Bethany, are middle school teachers: a career that pays well in the personal fulfillment category, but not as much in the financial category.  We knew from the start of our relationship that we wanted to have children, but having them biologically wasn't important to us.  The decision to adopt was an easy one, but our original plan was to adopt only one child.  When we encountered Rolivin and Roseline, we knew they were waiting for us, but it was a financially difficult decision.  The whole process will end of costing over $50,000.  We ultimately decided that we would do anything we had to (including selling our personal possessions) for these wondrous children.  So that's (sort of) what we are doing here...

What's in it for you (besides feeling really good about yourself)?

In exchange for your donations, you will get a little piece of happiness back!  I am an avid creature-maker and will share my craft with you, when you donate to our fund.   For a $200 donation, you will get a large (child-size) friend.  Please see the picture I posted to get an idea of the little buddies I make.  They are all unique, so be ready for an exciting surprise.

So that's (sort of) what we are doing here...What's in it for you (besides feeling really good about yourself)?
In exchange for your donations, you will get a little piece
of happiness back!  I am an avid
creature-maker and will share my craft with you, when you donate to our
fund.   For a $200
donation, you will get a large (child-size) friend.  Please see the picture I posted to get an
idea of the little buddies I make.  They
are all unique, so be ready for an exciting surprise.

story:
I moved to Two Sisters farm six years ago. It was an aging dairy farm that had seen better days.  On the farm there is a huge hay barn. Underneath all the dirt and 100 years of dust, I could see a barn that wanted to shine again.  Thus began a journey I couldn't have imagined.  From our first Halloween party with 200 people, to friends birthday parties and eventually my daughter's wedding, the idea was born to make this a place for others in the community to enjoy too.

It was my daughter's wedding that triggered the ongoing transformation of the barn. Since that day 3 years ago, friends and friends of friends have gotten married in this special space. I have hosted graduation parties, farm to table fundraisers, school barn dances,movie shoots and many birthday parties, the most poignant being an 80th celebration for a man who grew up on the farm but hadn't been back in 60 years (See the whole story of why, in my history section below).


As a result of those events, the barns fame started to have a life of its own. People telling people about their experiences here. Friends kept telling me I should start a business because it was such a fantastic space and people loved it so much. At first I was hesitant, but then I saw that by doing that, it would create an income for me right here at home, and believe me, when you're a single mother and managing  120 acres and raising a daughter you need to be here!

I decided to go for it! I thought it would be pretty easy(how naive I was), and starting talking to the County about what I need to do to get permitted. The more I discussed with them what I was trying to achieve the more levels and hoops I had to jump through. After 3 years of incredibly baffling, frustrating, and sometimes exhilarating (when I'd pass another level of their requirements) I now have an approved Conditional Use Permit with Whatcom County Building and Codes.  Which means I can now apply for my building permits.The costs have gone from a projected $35,000 which I could handle, to $70,000 at which I was gritting my teeth and not sleeping, but still able to do, to $120,000 which is where I need help!

I almost bailed a few times as the costs mounted but something kept pushing me on. I  wondered to myself,why am I still moving forward with this project? One of the main reasons is that I get phone calls, and people coming down my driveway looking for 'that barn where my friend got married' all the time. I show them the barn and they get all ooh and aahhh. I've never encountered anyone who doesn't appreciate the barn.  It seems to be one of those field of dreams situations….build it and they will come. From my experience our community really loves this old barn and our farm. I feel motivated knowing that.


We've already spent a lot of time and our own money to revive the barn,  Check out the pictures below to see some of the work that's been done.  

In order to bring the barn up to code we've had to hire a lot of professionals to make sure its all done right and satisfy the county.  We've brought in a structural engineer, architect, fire flow engineer, archeologist, critical area/wetlands specialist, fish and wildlife Dept. and the army corps of engineers,  not to mention all the contractors to do the work!  A lot of money has already been spent, we just need a little more to finish the job.



The remaining two big pieces to get this project done are the fire line and the sprinkler system. We've already had the engineers out here, we've got the plans drawn up, we've got bids on the work and people ready to go, we just need the money to make it happen.  

Once your donations have been received we will be able to move forward quickly and get the barn ready to host events.  We are so excited to see the community get behind this project and help us bring the barn up to code so it can be a space for great gatherings.

Some comments from friends who've had their special celebrations at the barn:





In case you want to know the whole story of how this all started, here it is:

I moved to 2 sisters farm 6 years ago. It was an aging dairy farm that had seen better days. Some work had been done on the farm before I moved in but there was still a long way to go. Imagine truck loads of old farm equipment, tires, junk, out buildings that hadn't been painted in 30 years or more, over grown black berries, broken fences.….but under all that mess was this farm that wanted to shine again. Especially a big fantastic hay barn. Since we weren't going to be storing hay for 100 head of cattle, I could see what a wonderful space it would be for family and friends to play in. As soon as I got settled in my house, I started cleaning it out(manure!) and cleaning(80 years of dust and spider webs). The cleaner it got I started thinking how cool it would be to have a summer bedroom up in the loft. You know..vintage furniture against beautiful old barn boards.  I love to collect cool old treasure so I rounded up what I thought would be awesome for an exotic sleeping space.  It looks like a movie set and it's a fantastic place to sleep. You feel like you are in some kind of fairy tale!

Next we started having grand scale Halloween parties. The kind people talk about for days. The kind where you say 'that was the best Halloween party I've ever been to'. For our first party my friends Deb and Claudia and I made an 18ft flying goddess with the body of a mermaid and long fabrics streamers for wings. We hung her so she would fly over the party. She was a sight to behold floating over our heads. Having big parties gives you the opportunity to think up amazing things to create! The party was a big success with over 200 people attending….

What happened next really sealed the fate of the barn. My daughter came to me and said she wanted to get married at the farm. Of course I said, thinking how wonderful!… and also thinking oh boy, here comes another round of cleaning- like 45ft up to the top ridge line with an articulating lift and pressure washing down a 100 years of dirt kind of cleaning! That was such an intense experience because by this time I had a lot of furniture in the barn and had to keep moving it all around with tarps for 3 days so it wouldn't get wet. And wet the barn did get! Ugh!

One day while discussing the details of how the wedding would go we started talking  about music for her  celebration. She mentioned a 9 piece funk band…hhmmm I said, thats going to require a dance floor.  Her fiancé stepped up and enlisted the help of his step father and best friend and voila, 700 sq ft of surface gravel was removed and a dance floor was born. This act triggered the ongoing transformation of the barn. Friends and friends of friends have gotten married in this special space. I have hosted graduation parties, farm to table fundraisers, school barn dances,movie shoots and many birthday parties,the most poignant being an 80th celebration for a man who grew up on the farm but hadn't been back in 60 years due his brothers wife who didn't like anybody, ( she was a mail order bride from Switzerland btw). But things change and his brother and his wife had passed on, so on the day of his birthday his friends cooked up a plan and picked him up for a test ride in a 1965 fire truck they had been restoring. He had no idea what was going on as his friend turned into the long farm driveway with the siren on. All his family was here to surprise him with a big party. He was astounded and so pleased. Many tears of joy were shared that day! 

One of my top pleasures in life is collecting treasure and creating space. Now I've done it to the barn. It is a wonderful place for people to relax, have fun, create beautiful memories and spend time with their families and friends. I enjoy knowing that this historic barn that holds all the special days for people will move into the future and be around for another 100 years. I hope you will consider supporting me so I can continue to support our community.

Thank you most sincerely,

Rebecca Miller

 I've given a lot of thought to the 'perk' system. I prefer thinking about as giving back. How I can I give back to you for helping me finish my vision. In thinking about this I knew I wanted to make some things with my own hands, to give back in a meaningful way. I am a former clothing designer so I knew I could create some gorgeous skirts. Check them out, I call them my sweater skirts. They are kind of a uniform of mine. A beautiful skirt and a wool sweater and boots. It's easy to make a fancy skirt more casual that way. I also made velvet pillowcases. I love sleeping on these and have for years. They can go right through the washer and dryer! Instead of ordering bulk tote bags made who knows where, I upcycled some canvas and made my own! I love photography and chose 8 images from this last year to make notecards out of. Isn't it nice to get a card in the mail? I'll also work my tail off hosting events for you! And last but not least ,I had 3 different friends offer up perks  too. An overnight in an airbnb, handmade linen totes, and an intention setting felted wool pouch making workshop. I hope something will catch eye in my offerings. Be sure to email me with any questions.








In any new adventure there are always risks and challenges. As I explained above, I have already faced numerous challenges and have worked my way through them. I have no doubt  there will be more and knowing that the community is supporting my project  I will get through them as well.

 Each step along the way, the right people have turned up at the right time. It has given me the opportunity to meet more folks that I wouldn't have had cause to meet before. Not only is this enriching for my life, it also gives the barn an even broader base of people who can enjoy our farm.


1. What exactly are you raising funds for?

We are raising funds specifically to contribute to the fire line, hydrant and sprinkler system. The total is approximately $70,000.

2. Whats happens if you don't meet your funding goal?

The barn will still be finished, but it will take a lot longer! 

3. What happens if you exceed your goal?

I'll be able to able to purchase more tables and chairs so people don't have to rent them. I  would also be able to donate more events. A big reason I'm doing this project is so that the community can have a fun place to gather. We're in the country. Barn dances are a must!

3.What is the estimated cost of the total project?

The total estimated cost of the entire project is $120,000. The cost of the sprinkler system and fire line is $70,000

4.How old is the barn? 

We reckon it was built somewhere in the 1920's

5.What makes your barn and farm unique that people want to have events there?

Our farm is situated on 120 acres. It looks straight out on an unobstructed view of Mount Baker. It is well off the road and provides complete privacy. The barn has a capacity of 250 people, is grand and majestic and big! 4200 square feet with 45' tall ceiling. We put in a 700 sq ft. dance floor and a very cool bar using reclaimed lumber and vintage ceiling tile, so it's ready to go.

6.When will you be open?

We will be open seasonally from May to October.

7.How many events do you expect to have per season?

We approximate around 38

8.Do you ever donate the barn?

Yes, we do. Our goal is to donate 2 events per year for non-profits that are raising money to support local farmers and agriculture education. Also to non-profits that are raising money for children related activities.

story:
WE ARE: Friends of Trillium! ARE YOU?

Trillium Waterbirth Center is struggling to make ends meet as the Oregon Health Plan continues to delay approval of healthy low-risk women. In fact Trillium midwives have delivered multiple babies in the last 2 months whose mothers still haven’t been approved despite being healthy and low risk. Help us bridge the gap between very reduced and often no reimbursement at all from OHP, so they can continue to offer the choice for holistic prenatal care to the community, regardless of income level. Help us in the fight in freedom of medical care. Freedom to birth in a more supportive and peaceful environment.

‘Friends of Trillium’ is a non-profit organization started and run by the Southern Oregon Birth Advocacy Council. SOBAC is an outreach advocacy group lead by consumers in southern Oregon and works to protect families in the childbearing year by empowering them to explore their choices for care, ensuring all choices are available for all families (regardless of income level) and striving to create bridges to integrate different care models within this community, so that safety is the top priority in any care location. Friends of Trillium are a group of mamas and papas who have utilized the services of the Trillium Waterbirth Center during their pregnancy, birth, or postpartum recovery. They are a passionatly supportive group of families who understand how valuable it is to have access to the model of care they find most comfortable and the right to choose it for themselves. They hope that this option will become part of the mainstream medical word, a normal choice that is openly and widely available to ALL women in ALL communities. That the choice be put into the hands of the people, not having our medical options dictated for us by our insurance companies or the medicaid payer system.

The History (Herstory)

The Trillium Waterbirth center was opened on Crater Lake Ave Jan 2011 and on Redwood Circle in Jan 2013.  Combined they have served hundreds of families in a three state radius with excellent care statistics.  Trillium midwives deliver 3.2 % of the babies born in Jackson and Josephine Co’s and boost a 5.6% c-section rate as opposed to our state average of 27% and our regional average of 30%!


Trillium Waterbirth Center is a Sacred Space

  • The ONLY center of its kind from Sacramento, California to Eugene, Oregon
  • Serves clients and families within a 4 hour radius from CA, OR & NV
  • Creates a hub of resources for our community to flourish
  • Enables our community to choose options outside of mainstream medical care
  • Is a sanctuary from babies and mamas and papas 
  • Has a knowledgeable, caring staff providing holistic care
  • Locations in both Medford and Grants Pass

These midwives do amazing work for families in Jackson, Josephine & Douglas Counties.  They are at the forefront of changing maternity care for the better.
Trillium Waterbirth Center already boasts a low intervention and an extremely low C-section rate compared to hospital birth options in southern Oregon.  Join us in saving women from the unnecessary pain, intervention, and surgery of hospital births.  Help us keep the birth center open for years to come! 


What We Need
We need your help!  Because of recent changes in the reimbursements from insurance companies and medicaid under the Affordable Care Act , their hands are tied with very little cash flow right at a time when women need their high-touch, low-tech care even more! 
Inadequate prenatal care is associated with poor birth outcomes. Recognizing barriers to care is necessary to improve results.  In a study in Sacramento, CA published in PubMed,  women reported the inability to find a provider willing to accept them as the single largest barrier to obtaining care, cited by 64% of women overall and 96% of those who tried but were unable to obtain care. The difficulty finding any providers willing to take them indicates that these women need the special services that Trillium Waterbirth Center provides to ensure adequate care during pregnancy.  Making midwifery care available to the critically low-income area of southern Oregon and allowing women to get care in their own homes is the solution to reducing poor birth outcomes.  Trillium serves over a hundred families every year, we can’t loose this resource in the community!


Trillium needs  a bridge to cover the gap in reimbursements:
·  Total minimum cost per client $3998 
·  OHP reimburses a maximum payment of $2979 (when they pay)
·  Please help with the $1019+ difference for each OHP client


What You Get
Aside from the satisfaction of helping provide a valuable and much needed program  to vulnerable new mothers and infants; we also want to offer some incentive.

Donate $35 during our first week of this campaign and we invite you to experience an hour-long massage with one of our therapists at half price. 

Contribute over $100 and we will invite you to a private dinner catered by Trillium Waterbirth Center's, Augustine Colebrook, the director, founder, and chef-extraordinaire!

Fund the whole $1019 difference for an OHP client and be invited to join the Southern Oregon Birth Advocacy Council to help shape further political action and advocacy efforts by the Friends of Trillium group


The Impact
The excellent outcomes that The Trillium Waterbirth Center has been able to facilitate are measurable successes in improving not just the medical health for mothers and babies, but also represent improved mental, emotional, and physical health for the whole family.


When you work with Trillium ........
You are treated with dignity and grace.
Your wishes are heard, remembered, and honored.
You are truly supported during one of the most vulnerable times in your life.
Please give today and help us help more women just like you. 


Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please help get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Refer a friend to Trillium Waterbirth Center for their maternity care
  • Write a letter to the members of the House Committee on Health Care on two bills introduced into this legislative session and say:
1. That you think birth centers should be paid more that $600 for a facility care from Oregon Health Plan (our actual costs are over $3000) [HB 3451]

2. How you think that all insurance companies should be required to pay Licensed Midwives at birth centers and midwives should be added to the list of 'women's health care providers' in Oregon [HB 3456]

  • Travel with the midwives of Trillium to Salem on Weds April 8th to testify in front of the Health Care Committee about these two midwifery bills. ( for more information please contact Trillium Directly!)
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and If your were a client of ours, tell everyone:

‘We’re friends of Trillium, ARE YOU?'

What our Friends Have to Say:

Amy Botillier, Medford,OR

"Choosing the midwifery care model during my pregnancy this last year was hands down the best healthcare choice I have ever made for myself. Our nation, and sadly our state greatly undervalue the fantastic quality of care that midwives offer. It is unfortunate that we are moving backward rather than progressing, and I want to see it change."

Angelina and Simon, Scott Valley, CA

"We can't thank you enough for all the love, kindness, and support you have shown us through my pregnancy, labor, delivery, and postpartum.  Having our children in our life is magical and with your help I was able to welcome them into this world peacefully.  Thank you for being part of our lives during this wonderful, beautiful time."

Julie Villegas, Grants Pass,OR

"I am pregnant OHP woman who had a child by OB and by a midwife. It was as different as night and day! The midwife really assisted me through my entire pregnancy and labor, my OB literally came in right as the baby was born to congratulate me. I feel midwifery is the best for the mom and child!" 

Sarah DeLong, Ashland,OR

“OBs are surgeons and as such are trained in how to treat high risk births. They have very little experience with normal births during their internships and residencies. Midwives have to attend hundreds of births before being licensed and allowed to practice on their own. A midwife is the best and safest choice for most pregnant women.”

Amanda Matney, Grants Pass,OR

"I had my son with a midwife and it was the most amazing experience. I felt safe and cared for unlike the hospital setting with doctors that are on a time schedule. Being comfortable with them helped make my labor be stress free, thus reducing complications. People should have a choice in where they birth their babies, even if they are on OHP. "

Tess Castellano, Talent,OR

"I'm a mother who believes in options, and the most comfortable way is having the freedom to choose how I decide to being my children into this world. I want to be able to have the ability to move and birth as I deem fit to my family. I don't want my only option to be your typical experience, on ‘your back with drugs’ birth. My husband and I sit firmly in middle class. We can't afford a lot, but we're comfortable. Midwifery has provided us with a cheaper, more natural experience and we feel no one has the right to tell us how we have to give birth, pushing us into debt for the next 10 years. It also seems to make sense saving hundreds of thousands of dollars yearly for our state budget!"

Shara Baack,Medford,OR

"Women deserve the right to choose where and how their babies are born. It is time that we stop seeing birth as a problem that has to be dealt with and see it for the natural, beautiful entry of a child into the world, and a normal beautiful process for the mother, as opposed to a issue to be dealt with."

Help us bridge the gap between very reduced and often no reimbursement at all from OHP, so they can continue to offer the choice for holistic prenatal care to the community, regardless of income level. Help us in the fight in freedom of medical care. Freedom to birth in a more supportive and peaceful environment.

‘Friends of Trillium’ is a non-profit organization started and run by the Southern Oregon Birth Advocacy Council. SOBAC is an outreach advocacy group lead by consumers in southern Oregon and works to protect families in the childbearing year by empowering them to explore their choices for care, ensuring all choices are available for all families (regardless of income level) and striving to create bridges to integrate different care models within this community, so that safety is the top priority in any care location. Friends of Trillium are a group of mamas and papas who have utilized the services of the Trillium Waterbirth Center during their pregnancy, birth, or postpartum recovery. They are a passionatly supportive group of families who understand how valuable it is to have access to the model of care they find most comfortable and the right to choose it for themselves. They hope that this option will become part of the mainstream medical word, a normal choice that is openly and widely available to ALL women in ALL communities. That the choice be put into the hands of the people, not having our medical options dictated for us by our insurance companies or the medicaid payer system.

The History (Herstory)

The Trillium Waterbirth center was opened on Crater Lake Ave Jan 2011 and on Redwood Circle in Jan 2013.  Combined they have served hundreds of families in a three state radius with excellent care statistics.  Trillium midwives deliver 3.2 % of the babies born in Jackson and Josephine Co’s and boost a 5.6% c-section rate as opposed to our state average of 27% and our regional average of 30%!

Trillium Waterbirth Center is a Sacred Space

The ONLY center of its kind from Sacramento, California to Eugene, Oregon
Serves clients and families within a 4 hour radius from CA, OR & NV
Creates a hub of resources for our community to flourish
Enables our community to choose options outside of mainstream medical care
Is a sanctuary from babies and mamas and papas 
Has a knowledgeable, caring staff providing holistic care
Locations in both Medford and Grants Pass
These midwives do amazing work for families in
Jackson, Josephine & Douglas Counties.  They are at the forefront of
changing maternity care for the better.
Trillium Waterbirth Center already boasts a low intervention and an extremely
low C-section rate compared to hospital birth options in southern Oregon. 
Join us in saving women from the unnecessary pain, intervention, and surgery of
hospital births.  Help us keep the birth center open for years to come! 

What We Need
We need your help! 
Because of recent changes in the reimbursements from insurance companies and medicaid under the Affordable Care Act , their hands are tied with very little cash flow right at a time when women need their high-touch, low-tech care even more! 
Inadequate prenatal care is associated with poor birth outcomes. Recognizing
barriers to care is necessary to improve results.  In a study in
Sacramento, CA published in PubMed,  women reported the inability to find
a provider willing to accept them as the single largest barrier to obtaining
care, cited by 64% of women overall and 96% of those who tried but were unable
to obtain care. The difficulty finding any providers willing to take them
indicates that these women need the special services that Trillium Waterbirth
Center provides to ensure adequate care during pregnancy.  Making
midwifery care available to the critically low-income area of southern Oregon
and allowing women to get care in their own homes is the solution to reducing
poor birth outcomes.  Trillium serves over a hundred families every
year, we can’t loose this resource in the community!

Trillium needs  a bridge to cover
the gap in reimbursements:
·  Total minimum cost per client
$3998 
·  OHP reimburses a maximum payment of $2979 (when
they pay)
·  Please help with the $1019+ difference for each OHP client

What You Get
Aside from the satisfaction of helping provide a valuable and much
needed program  to vulnerable new mothers and infants; we also want to
offer some incentive.
Donate $35 during our first week of this campaign and we invite you to
experience an hour-long massage with one of our therapists at half
price. 
Contribute over $100 and we will invite you to a private dinner catered by
Trillium Waterbirth Center's, Augustine Colebrook, the director, founder, and
chef-extraordinaire!
Fund the whole $1019 difference for an OHP client and be invited to join the
Southern Oregon Birth Advocacy Council to help shape further political action
and advocacy efforts by the Friends of Trillium group

The Impact
The excellent outcomes that The Trillium Waterbirth Center has been able
to facilitate are measurable successes in improving not just the medical health
for mothers and babies, but also represent improved mental, emotional, and
physical health for the whole family.

When you work with Trillium ........
You are treated with dignity and grace.
Your wishes are heard, remembered, and honored.
You are truly supported during one of the most vulnerable times in your life.
Please give today and help us help more women just like you. 

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:


Please help get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
Refer a friend to Trillium Waterbirth Center for their maternity
     care
Write a letter to the members of the House Committee on Health Care on two bills introduced into this legislative session and say:
1. That you think birth centers should be paid more that $600 for a facility care from Oregon Health Plan (our actual costs are over $3000) [HB 3451]
2. How you think that all insurance companies should be required to pay Licensed Midwives at birth centers and midwives should be added to the list of 'women's health care providers' in Oregon [HB 3456]


Travel with the midwives of Trillium to Salem on Weds April 8th to testify in front of the Health Care Committee about these two midwifery bills. ( for more information please contact Trillium Directly!)
Use the Indiegogo share tools and If your were a client of ours,
     tell everyone:

‘We’re
friends of Trillium, ARE YOU?'

What our Friends Have to Say:
Amy Botillier, Medford,OR
"Choosing the midwifery care model during my pregnancy this last year was hands down the best healthcare choice I have ever made for myself. Our nation, and sadly our state greatly undervalue the fantastic quality of care that midwives offer. It is unfortunate that we are moving backward rather than progressing, and I want to see it change."
Angelina and Simon, Scott Valley, CA
"We can't thank you enough for all the love, kindness, and support you have shown us through my pregnancy, labor, delivery, and postpartum.  Having our children in our life is magical and with your help I was able to welcome them into this world peacefully.  Thank you for being part of our lives during this wonderful, beautiful time."
Julie Villegas, Grants Pass,OR
"I am pregnant OHP woman who had a child by OB and by a midwife. It was as different as night and day! The midwife really assisted me through my entire pregnancy and labor, my OB literally came in right as the baby was born to congratulate me. I feel midwifery is the best for the mom and child!" 
Sarah DeLong, Ashland,OR
“OBs are surgeons and as such are trained in how to treat high risk births. They have very little experience with normal births during their internships and residencies. Midwives have to attend hundreds of births before being licensed and allowed to practice on their own. A midwife is the best and safest choice for most pregnant women.”
Amanda Matney, Grants Pass,OR
"I had my son with a midwife and it was the most amazing experience. I felt safe and cared for unlike the hospital setting with doctors that are on a time schedule. Being comfortable with them helped make my labor be stress free, thus reducing complications. People should have a choice in where they birth their babies, even if they are on OHP. "
Tess Castellano, Talent,OR
"I'm a mother who believes in options, and the most comfortable way is having the freedom to choose how I decide to being my children into this world. I want to be able to have the ability to move and birth as I deem fit to my family. I don't want my only option to be your typical experience, on ‘your back with drugs’ birth. My husband and I sit firmly in middle class. We can't afford a lot, but we're comfortable. Midwifery has provided us with a cheaper, more natural experience and we feel no one has the right to tell us how we have to give birth, pushing us into debt for the next 10 years. It also seems to make sense saving hundreds of thousands of dollars yearly for our state budget!"
Shara Baack,Medford,OR
"Women deserve the right to choose where and how their babies are born. It is time that we stop seeing birth as a problem that has to be dealt with and see it for the natural, beautiful entry of a child into the world, and a normal beautiful process for the mother, as opposed to a issue to be dealt with."

story:
Cliquez ici pour la campagne en français.

         Hello, we are Aurélie and Sandrine

 

Version française ici.

We are French-Ivorian vegan twin sisters, starting the wellness revolution in western Africa by opening in Ivory Coast a wellness café! 

What is a wellness café? It's a vegan restaurant that offers:

  • freshly pressed green juices & healthy smoothies, 
  • Vegan dishes: salads, original warm and cold sandwiches, as well as 
  • Dairy free desserts and sweet treats.

The food will be produce using fresh, organic and local ingredients. 

A little more about us...

With a background in business, and work experiences in France, the U.S. and Canada, our lives took a new turn about two years ago, when we sipped our first green juice. We discovered the wonders of a plant-based whole-food diet on our health and overall well-being. Now, we are proud vegan, loving it! We want to dedicate our lives to help people adopt healthier habits and realize our dream to create our own business. 

We believe that eating healthy organic raw food is an important component to a healthy mind and body, and the key to a happy fulfilled life. 

Beautiful Abidjan, the main and biggest city in Ivory Coast


What Is the Funding For?

  • Rent a commercial space for 3 months in downtown Abidjan.
  • Furnish and decorate the space.
  • Buy most the cooking and baking equipment and tools (juicers, blenders,...).
  • Create and print advertising and communication tools (pamphlets, brochures, menus, staff uniforms, posters, mugs, cups, bottles, etc.). 
  • Buy starting inventory (fresh fruits and vegetables, baking supplies, etc.).

Why Help?

  • To bring the wellness revolution to Africa (it's about time, right?)
  • To participate in the prevention and reduction of many illnesses and diseases in Ivory Coast and not long after in all African countries!
  • Check out the perks!!
  • To contribute in a great project that aim to bring health and happiness... 
  • To help us achieve our dream, thus making us really, really, really happy! 

Other Ways You Can Help 

Every contribution, even the smallest is welcome and is deeply appreciated. But we know that money is not always easy to come by, trust us, we know that. That’s why there is other way you can help us reach our goal:

  • Twit our campaign link and help us make it viral!
  • Post our campaign on your Facebook page and help us increase our visibility!
  • Use INDIEGOGO great sharing tools to help us find more donors!
  • E-mail & talk to your family and friends about our campaign, and help us spread the word!
  • You can post the link or our campaign on your blog, google+ page, tumblr, Pinterest,

  • Send us a lot of positive thoughts and prayers to help us!

Thank you so much for believing in our project and participating in making our dream come true! You have our eternal gratitude.

Aurélie & Sandrine

Version française ici.

story:
After being diagnosed with a rare, progressive lung disease called LAM, Melanee Grondahl decided to start a mobile-coffee business called Feather Coffee that gives twenty five cents per cup of coffee to three revolving charities, one always being a rare disease organization. She eventually wants to franchise the business so more funds can be raised. All donations from this campaign will go towards purchasing the first Feather Coffee trailer.

What Problem Can You Help Feather Coffee Solve?-Melanee is one amongst an estimated 300 million people worldwide who are affected by a rare disease. The rare disease community relies on grassroots fundraising efforts. However, without a foundation to represent a disease or a large pool of people with the disease who are raising funds, finding a cure is almost impossible. An annual race or golf tournament isn't enough. A clinical drug trial can cost more than $100 million. According Forbes, the average drug developed for the market by a major pharmaceutical company costs at least $4 billion. The Kakkis EveryLife Foundation reports that 95% of rare diseases have not one single FDA approved drug treatment. The rare disease community desperately needs a large-scale, consistent way to raise money.

What is the Cause Brewing Model?-Feather Coffee might start small, but the cause-brewing model has the potential to grow into a large-scale business that can raise big funds. What is the Cause-Brewing Model? The cause-brewing model is simple, and it is all about giving back.


Twenty-five cents per cup of coffee is donated to three revolving charities. One of these charities is always a rare disease organization. Feather Coffee’s products also support a cause. For example, we've chosen to brew Three Avocados Coffee, a non-profit that gives 100% of its proceeds to water projects in Uganda and education projects in Nicaragua.

What Impact Can Your Donation Make? All donations from this campaign will go towards purchasing the first Feather Coffee trailer. We will then use the trailer to further develop and hone the cause-brewing business model. With the crowd-funding success and proof of a profitable business, we will seek investors and franchise the business.


Your donation will help make stage 1 of our development a reality. However, we are thinking big! Stage 4 involves franchising the business so that more people can make a difference in the fight against rare diseases. Anyone interested in starting a socially-conscious mobile-coffee business can buy a franchise and give back while running a profitable business. No matter who invests in a franchise, the cause-brewing model will be used:  products we use give back and twenty-five cents per cup is donated to three revolving charities, one is always a rare disease organization.  

Why Mobile-Coffee-A mobile-coffee trailer provides an excellent return on investment. Since 2008, speciality coffee sales are increasing by 20% each year. The mobile-food industry revenue increased by 12.4% over the past five years and is expected to keep growing. Mobile-food businesses are reported to have an estimated 50% profit margin. With an initial start-up cost for a mobile-food trailer at $40,000 and the potential for high profit growth, it is a more flexible and affordable option than starting a standing coffee shop.                         

Why Cause-Brewing?-When it comes to successful start-ups, timing is everything. Not only is mobile-food and speciality coffee sales on the rise, but cause-marketing has increased in popularity. Fifty-five percent of consumers worldwide say that when quality and price are equal, the most important factor influencing brand choice is purpose. Feather Coffee's cause-brewing model is an example of what today's consumers are asking for. Consumers already spend billions of dollars on specialty coffee, but they would be more likely to spend those dollars on a cup of Feather Coffee because it has a purpose.  Every cup of our coffee contains not just one but multiple ways a person can give back.

Why Will Feather Coffee Be Successful? We have a lot to learn and that is why we believe in strategic partnerships and mentoring. Three successful mobile-coffee companies: Chasing Morris, Theory Coffee, and Drip Mobile Espresso have offered to mentor us as we grow our business.

The Feather Coffee team is strong. We consist of experts in communication, marketing, film, design, and fundraising. In three months, we have produced a campaign video that beautifully expresses our campaign message, gained a large social media following, developed a website (feathercoffee.com),  branding package, and a short and long-term business plan. We know where we are and where we want to go!

There is a saying: "When you want to succeed as much as you want to breathe, then you will be successful." For Melanee and the Feather Coffee team, this couldn't be truer. Finding a way to raise consistent funds for her rare lung disease is a fight for breath and life. During the campaign, Melanee experienced two lung collapses, but she healed quickly and continued to work on her dream with an even stronger sense of determination. 

Melanee has a track record of successful fundraising and awareness campaigns. She raised almost $11,000 in three months for The LAM Foundation by organizing a letter and email campaign. She also organized a LAM awareness social media campaign. Since the pink feather is the symbol of hope for the LAM Foundation, she asked participants to take pictures of themselves holding a pink feather, include a fact about LAM with the picture, and then post it to social media. The campaign reached thousands of people and was broadcasted on all forms of social media. You can see several pictures from this campaign in our gallery.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       You can read more about Melanee's story here.
                                                                                                                                                              I Donated! What Else Can I Do?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  

Get the Word Out! How? 

  • Share this page via social media platforms or email
  • Know donors? Connect them to this campaign!
  • Questions/Comments: message us at feathercoffee.com or facebook/feathercoffee or tweet us @feathercoffee

                                                                                                                                                              I Donated! What Else Can I Do?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   Get the Word Out! How? 


Share this page via social media platforms or email
Know donors? Connect them to this campaign!
Questions/Comments: message us at feathercoffee.com or facebook/feathercoffee or tweet us @feathercoffee

story:
Tucando.com is a free business and social network that will use geo sat technology to allow  its users to find free money off vouchers anywhere and download them to phones or any device.

When using tucando you will have the option to create a great free business page and submit it to the tucando directory and search engines and edit vouchers for personal users to find

OR

You will be able to create a great looking social page, link to friends, share feeds, choose businesses to get their feeds, search for vouchers and download them and send EMOJI (Emos are cartoon characters, expressing an emotion) to friends.

Once the indiegogo campaign is over we will send contributors an email letting you be the first to try out the new social pages and voucher search system.


Already with no advertising budget, over twenty five thousand business owners have registered. Tucando has over a hundred and forty new businesses signing up a day. Putting their faith in the free tucando project, business owners for example, from the poorest businesses in the poorest countries will be able to interact with potential customers anywhere in the world in no better way before than free, tucando.

How Does It Work?

The business owner signs up creating a new tucando page, showcasing his or her business with images and hundreds of words. He or she can edit the search string how search engines find it, giving more special features than any other free website. The owner can use control panel to edit vouchers, offering a number of those available with an expiry date and a percentage off a product. Any personal member also has the option to follow the business, receiving updates to his or her feeds page.

The personal user signs up and creates a great looking social page including photo and movie albums, free blog options, EMOJI. After inviting friends and family and even business page owners to join his or her network the world becomes a smaller place. Like no network before there will be fun features where members will be able to send each other free EMOJI from a vast selection and also search for downloadable vouchers nearby or anywhere. Voucher locations will be displayed on a maps. Users will be able to use the global business directory and use an advanced filter search that will show the business pages that offer for example: delivery, have a web store, giftwrapping. They can also add a business to their feeds and then receive news, photos and updates from them.

Further enhancing tucando as a great online hub for the household is the voucher search system and people search mode available on any device. The user will be able to search the global database for vouchers nearby or in any location. Downloading for example a 30% off voucher for a dinner in a local restaurant  that night he or she could then switch to people search mode and see a list of online members, nearby.  Using the tucando chat system he can invite a new friend and enjoy a restaurant meal together that night using FREE tucando.com

The Logo was designed by great British illustrator, The logo Smith, Graham Smith and is a play on words, representing the toucan bird it also can be ' two can do'.

A great feature for business page owners and personal users will be the free marketplace. Easily place your item for sale in the genre and category and location of your choice with the comfort that you have nothing to loose as there will be no fees. This will boost trade locally and internationally helping personal users, small businesses  or big businesses.


Translated into most languages it is possible tucando can become a household name from Perth to Peru.

Free Blog:  This free blog will help people share their stories around the world and will be able to share headlines with other members of tucando and enjoy advanced features such as the ability to edit their meta code for search engine optimization.

Who Uses Tucando? young people, old people, business people, travellers, daters, shoppers, entrenpreneurs, Mothers, Fathers, Aunts, Uncles, disabled people. Everybody World Wide
story_txt: Tucando.com is a free business and social network that will use geo sat technology to allow  its users to find free money off vouchers anywhere and download them to phones or any device.When using tucando you will have the option to create a great free business page and submit it to the tucando directory and search engines and edit vouchers for personal users to findORYou will be able to create a great looking social page, link to friends, share feeds, choose businesses to get their feeds, search for vouchers and download them and send EMOJI (Emos are cartoon characters, expressing an emotion) to friends.Once the indiegogo campaign is over we will send contributors an email letting you be the first to try out the new social pages and voucher search system.Already with no advertising budget, over twenty five thousand business owners have registered. Tucando has over a hundred and forty new businesses signing up a day. Putting their faith in the free tucando project, business owners for example, from the poorest businesses in the poorest countries will be able to interact with potential customers anywhere in the world in no better way before than free, tucando.How Does It Work?The business owner signs up creating a new tucando page, showcasing his or her business with images and hundreds of words. He or she can edit the search string how search engines find it, giving more special features than any other free website. The owner can use control panel to edit vouchers, offering a number of those available with an expiry date and a percentage off a product. Any personal member also has the option to follow the business, receiving updates to his or her feeds page.The personal user signs up and creates a great looking social page including photo and movie albums, free blog options, EMOJI. After inviting friends and family and even business page owners to join his or her network the world becomes a smaller place. Like no network before there will be fun features where members will be able to send each other free EMOJI from a vast selection and also search for downloadable vouchers nearby or anywhere. Voucher locations will be displayed on a maps. Users will be able to use the global business directory and use an advanced filter search that will show the business pages that offer for example: delivery, have a web store, giftwrapping. They can also add a business to their feeds and then receive news, photos and updates from them.Further enhancing tucando as a great online hub for the household is the voucher search system and people search mode available on any device. The user will be able to search the global database for vouchers nearby or in any location. Downloading for example a 30% off voucher for a dinner in a local restaurant  that night he or she could then switch to people search mode and see a list of online members, nearby.  Using the tucando chat system he can invite a new friend and enjoy a restaurant meal together that night using FREE tucando.comThe Logo was designed by great British illustrator, The logo Smith, Graham Smith and is a play on words, representing the toucan bird it also can be ' two can do'.A great feature for business page owners and personal users will be the free marketplace. Easily place your item for sale in the genre and category and location of your choice with the comfort that you have nothing to loose as there will be no fees. This will boost trade locally and internationally helping personal users, small businesses  or big businesses.Translated into most languages it is possible tucando can become a household name from Perth to Peru.Free Blog:  This free blog will help people share their stories around the world and will be able to share headlines with other members of tucando and enjoy advanced features such as the ability to edit their meta code for search engine optimization.Who Uses Tucando? young people, old people, business people, travellers, daters, shoppers, entrenpreneurs, Mothers, Fathers, Aunts, Uncles, disabled people. Everybody World Wide

story: Hello my name is Logan Lake I am currently in the U.S. Army and I will be transitioning to civilian life here in the next few months.  My wife Rachel and I are in the process of chasing our dreams to create our own business.  We have been married for 4 years and have two beautiful little girls.  Ithas been a very rough few years for myself and my family financially, ever since I was in an IED Blast in Afghanistan back in 2013 things haven’t exactly been easy.  I can’t perform my job to the standards of the army any longer and my body has paid the price for that.  I am being medically discharged in a few months and it would mean so much to my family and myself if you would help us in our journey to pursue our dreams.  With the help of a truly dedicated company we are trying to make those dreams into a reality by opening a franchise in Property Inspections.  Multiple services are provided that make this company stand out from the rest when it comes inspections these include pre-listing and closing inspections for homes, commercial, field service, builder’s warranty, new homes, employee relocation as well as energy audits. The company will give us all the tools we need to hit the ground running to get this business up and a float.  We need your help to get the funds necessary to start our business endeavor!  In case you’re wondering what the funds are going to be used for here is some insight; initial investment to join the company and own a franchise with includes tools for operation of daily tasks, equipment, training and supplies.  It will also cover working capital for the company while we begin our business and get our name out there.  We have exerted all of our time and means into financial endeavors such as getting loans from the banks but have not received any luck.  This is our last chance to still believe there is hope for our family. Thank you so much for taking the time to hear our story and we hope you can help support our cause!

story:
I'm raising funds to rebrand the conscious canopy.  I have found an awesome team to create a logo, a new website and assist with marketing.  I need your help to financially pull this off.

My new website will feature fresh content including a blog and short video tutorials on Kundalini Yoga and Meditation, herbalism, conception, pregnancy, childbirth, postpartum and raising children in the Aquarian Age.  The conscious canopy inspires and uplifts others with cosmic wisdom for longevity.  We activate one soul at a time to elevate our community consciousness for the legacy of our planet.  

Any funds I receive that exceed my marketing goals, I will put into creating a solid foundation for the conscious canopy.  

Please visit my website, facebook and instagram to learn more of my story.  My current website was created in 2008.  Since then the internet has grown quite a bit and I am ready to have a real presence on this forum.  

I currently teach 4 Kundalini Yoga classes in Asheville as well as work with private clients.  If you live in Asheville, come join me for class:

  • Women's Kundalini Yoga and Meditation, Sundays 4-515 pm, West Asheville Yoga (on break May-August 2015)
  • Mama and Babe (Toddlers too) Kundalini Yoga, Mondays 1230-2 pm, The Movement and Learning center above the French Broad Food Co-op
  • Kundalini Yoga and Meditation, Tuesdays 7-830 pm, Veda Studios
  • Kundalini Yoga and Meditation, Wednesdays 1030-1145 am, Asheville Yoga Donation Studios

What the conscious canopy needs & what you receive in exchange

  • I need a total of $4000 to cover the fees for this rebranding project.  In addition I will need to cover any fees charged by Indiegogo.
  • If I don't reach my entire goal, the funds will still go towards this rebranding effort, I will just have to work in layers instead of going for the whole project at once.  
  • In exchange you will receive the recognition for helping me help others, leaving a legacy of making a difference in this world.  I also offer a number of opportunities to work one on one with me to learn about kundalini yoga and meditation and to support families during pregnancy and postpartum.  

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please spread the word about my project and invite your friends to stop by my campaign.  
  • Follow theconsciouscanopy on facebook and instagram.  Share wildly!

story:
47.3% of all licensed cars in the UK are between 6-13 yrs old and an additional 3.72 million cars are 4-6 yrs old. With every tick of the clock, even the new ones get older, to state the obvious.

Our vision is to create a garage that injects new life into cars. We would like to modify cars (new and old alike) in a way that is unique, expressive and extra-ordinary. We would cater for clients who intend to modify their cars to sell them at a better price and for those who want to customise their vehicle for personal enjoyment. We would like to offer our clients services ranging from installing air suspensions in old cars to fitting custom made alloys to new ones (lest the brand new cars feel left out, lol)


This is an example of old BMW E30, which could look like this:

or Audi A4

can be interesting and noticed by everybody


But we cannot do this on our own and that is why we are here, asking for your kind help please.

At the House of Stance, we will aim to give our clients open communication lines and one on one meetings, where necessary, to better understand what they require of us. Each person is unique and our services can be custom made to suit their individual needs. 

If we would be fortunate enough to receive the backing of a car dealership, we would offer the Stanzo Package (Perk that allows the dealership’s customers to get complementary car modifications from our garage)*. This means that their donation would actually be a profitable investment.

We would like to buy old cars and work on them as our own projects and sell them for profit so as to yield additional returns on the investments and maximize profits.

The garage would feature a leisure lounge for clients and for people who take interest in the Stance Culture. It is a culture we would like to promote here in the UK; we are big on recycling and reusing plastics and other materials to save our environment. It’s about time we add cars to that list too.

While we are doing our bit for the environment, sadly there isn't much we can do to alleviate traffic but the least we can do is ensure that you are stuck in it in a car you love and adore.

Our garage will be about the Stance Culture which is more than just reusing and recycling; it’s about options. It’s giving people options to express themselves through cars. Instead of just choosing a color and model from a car retailer; we offer custom made modifications to suit individual needs.

Additionally, the chill lounge will offer lovers of the culture a platform to connect and to network; a platform to share their stories about Stance that will be posted here, on our website and other social media.

We will create events to spread the culture, demographic and to generate the necessary hype for our new undertaking. Videos from events will be uploaded to our social networking sites.

Our first video after attending Blackpool FY cruise on 31 st of January:


We are passionate about this venture and we only hope to have inspired you to give our vision a chance…to improve new cars and revive old ones in an affordable way. 

Perks will be available soon...

*Pictures are taken from "Ladyonwheels" and "Stanceworks" blog

story:
Hello

We are Nobody Move. Our next play Keep Your Coins is being made from stories collected from people experiencing homelessness.

On Thursday 5th February we met a man called Mihai-Damian. Mihai does not speak English.            

We tried communicating non-verbally but that was useless. Then we tried through google translate but it became clear that Mihai has limited reading and writing abilities in his own language, let alone interpreting the mistakes that google translate tends to generate.

After trying to ask some icebreaker questions, and confusing him by telling him about the play we were putting on, we asked one clear question.

How can we help you?

Mihai said he wants to go home.

We want to help him get there.

We’re not going to make an effort to explain why Mihai deserves to go home more than any other person sleeping rough, because we don’t know, or believe that to be the case. What we do know is it was bloody cold when we met, and he doesn’t have a roof over his head.

He has one glove which he gave Ella to wear when 2 hours of sitting in the snow was getting to her bones, he has a childlike face and he keeps what looks like an Argos Value duvet in a bag that he sits on during the day and sleeps under during the night.

If you would like to help us in sending him home then please donate a few pounds by clicking the above and we can get him on a flight back to his family Iasi. £275 will cover a flight to Iasi, travel to the airport, travel to his family when he gets there and a 9% fee on this website if our target isn't reached 

As the minimum target on this website is £500, any additional funds will go to Shelter, the leading homelessness charity       

Thank you,

Nobody Move

story:
The Noor Fund

This benefit was setup for Noor Qurbanali Damani.  “Noor Aunty” as many of us know her, has been working hard for her family in Pakistan.  She has been working hard to support her children and family with whatever money she earns.  Noor has not seen her husband or children for over 15 years. Last year, her husband passed away unexpectedly.  The strong Noor Aunty was unable to attend his funeral and started to cope with her new life without a soul mate.  In February, Noor was diagnosed with stage 3 mouth cancer.  She recently started treatments for this which involved the removal of all her teeth.  Noor is planning on going through an intense 40 days of combined radiation and chemo therapy starting 3/25.  After therapy and God willing, she is planning on heading back home to spend her remaining years with her family.  This fund is to help Noor Aunty for her trip back to Pakistan and unexpected medical expenses which can be very costly.  Please say a prayer for this amazing woman and join us in helping her for this great cause.
