story:
Short Summary

The Highline Bears Baseball Organization is a new expansion team in the Pacific International League. The Pacific International League (PIL) was founded in 1992, the league is considered by many to be the premier Summer Collegiate Baseball league in the Northwest. Sanctioned by the National Baseball Congress (NBC), most PIL players are NCAA eligible and are unpaid in order to maintain their eligibility. The PIL is different from many other summer collegiate baseball leagues in that the league also allows former professionals and college graduates to participate.

In the 1950's, 60's and 70's White Center Stadium (now Steve Cox Memorial Park) was the home of men's semi-professional baseball and professional fast pitch softball teams. Several hundred adults, kids and families would fill the stands and sit along the side fences watching a high level of baseball under the lights on Friday and Saturday nights. The stadium hosted former professional baseball players, college athletes with dreams of making it to the big's and men's fast pitch teams like Pay n' Pak and the King & His Court.

After the original wood stadium burnt down in the late 1970's baseball slowly faded from the Highline area. Today the park has been remodeled, dedicated to fallen community leader & police officer Steve Cox and is home to little leaguers, high school & men's senior leagues but the stand are far from full. The once packed, community centered stadium rarely sees a high level of competitive baseball. The stands of the stadium can still hold over a thousand spectators but haven't seen that type of crowds in decades. The Highline Bears hope to bring a high level of baseball back to the Highline & White Center area.

All contributions made through our IndieGoGo campaign will help fund the teams expenses. We are a sponsorship and donation based organization and we need you help. All contributions will be used for; field rentals, umpire fees, tournament fees, player uniforms, baseball equipment and travel expenses.

What We Need & What You Get

The Highline Bears have a budget of $50,000 that we need to fill by the middle of May. Most other teams that run like ours will run on a budget of $80,000-$150,000. We have limited our travel trips and expenses by having staff members volunteer their time during our first season. Our plan to fill this budget is by attracting local small businesses to sponsor, doing multiple small fund raisers and using our IndieGoGo campaign where we hope to raise at least $20,000.

Perks Of Contributing:

We offer a lot of different perks we offer in return for you contribution to our organization. They include:

-A Personalized Thank You Tweet

-Game Tickets

-Personalized Thank You Team Photo

-Team T-shirts

-Season Tickets

-A Team Plaque

-Team Jersey

-Be on the field for pre-game batting practice

-Being an Honorary Coach

Risks & Challenges

We have a lot of challenges we have already over come. Being a new team and launching our team as late as December this has been a huge project. 

We first had to find players to fill our roster. Most summer teams start recruiting their players in September and have their roster filled by December. We listed over 500 prospects and went down the list contacting everyone we could. We are pleased to say that once we started getting the word out about our team we had a great response. We feel we have filled out a competitive roster with 25 great role models for the community.

Our next challenge was getting access to the stadium, which is managed by our local county parks department. While they were very skeptical of our idea at first we were diligent about making sure we could show them we were serious about our goal. We were able to work and partner with other user groups and have been able to secure 16 times for home games at our stadium.

The final challenge we face is raising enough funds to make this project not only happen but happen in the right way. To bring the community together and be taken seriously we need to put a great product on the field. To do this we need to have funds to help pay for field fees, umpires, team equipment, marketing materials and travel expenses. We need your help to make this possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

We wanted to make sure that anyone could contribute to this project so we made a lot of different perk packages. If you can only contribute $1, great! If you can contribute more, awesome! Ever little bit helps our mission.

Whether you contribute or not we would appreciate you sharing this with as many of your friends and family via Facebook, Twitter, Email and word of mouth.


Thank you for your consideration in helping us reach our goal!

story:
Everyone is attracted to shiny things. Some women like to wear shiny, others like to surround themselves with shiny.

My name is Pat Pitcher and my company is: Saw Something Shiny. We create and sell unique women's apparel, accessories, gifts and home goods...up-cycled, recycled...every item with something shiny: rhinestones, glitter, sequins and sparkle! Every item has an element of original art created by our team, which illustrates themes including nature, phrases, holidays, life events and faith. From jackets, tops and skirts - to tote bags, iPad cases, clutches and pillows, all are created onsite by our team.


Our target customer is women 18-80, all who have a love of shiny things and the market is enormous! Women are attracted by shiny things! They have been wearing gems on their dresses and robes for millennia so we are certain it is not a trend that will end anytime soon.

Saw Something shiny was started when we heard a local sports licensed, women's fashion apparel company was going out of business and liquidating their inventory...all high quality women's apparel with broad appeal. They custom embellished apparel with rhinestone and glitter logos. The logos were headed to the landfill...100,000 logos, tens of millions of rhinestones and thousands of pounds of plastic! The idea of up-cycling immediately became our focus...we'll turn them into something new!


We bought 5000 pieces of the apparel, the raw materials and some of the equipment. We also brought on board 3 key people who had been instrumental in building it to a $3 million business before the collapse. This really gave us a jump start in starting our new business...up-cycling, recycling, saving jobs...I Saw Something Shiny.

Our company is located in Sandpoint, Idaho, in a 2500 square foot building. Our products are competitively priced and are sold via our website: ISawSomethingShiny.comAmazon Seller, our EBay Store: stores.ebay.com/ISawSomethingShiny, and our new Etsy Store: Etsy.com/shop/ISawShinyThings. In just a few short months, we have become a "Top Seller" with a 100% positive review ranking on EBay! And while our focus is "direct to consumer", we produce wholesale orders as well for special events which include company events, festivals and reunions. All of our creations are produced under the I Saw Something Shiny label and our market is endless! Whether a 10 piece bridal order or a 100 piece order for a sorority, we design, create and ship with a very short turn-around time from our own location.


Our team has 30 years experience collectively in sourcing, hard and soft goods manufacturing, marketing, e-commerce and fulfillment. The business model allows us to test new designs on our blank inventory without investing in new inventory until we see what is trending. Our in house graphics and photography allow us to add new designs and items every day. When we add new apparel items we will source domestically but have identified near shore manufacturers to handle product with high demand. We are ready for growth!


Q1 2015 exceeded our expectations with Mardi Gras and St. Patrick's Day generating great results. Mother's Day, graduation, weddings and reunions are leading to a very promising Q2. With such positive early results, we believe the fall holidays and Christmas season will provide Saw Something Shiny with a significant opportunity for growth and a very profitable Q3 and Q4. Do you see the Shiny opportunity? We'll need your help!


We are raising $20,000 for marketing, web development and customization, product development, inventory for the fall/holiday season and general operating expenses, which are modest with a very low burn rate and high profit margins.

The team has played a part in the building small brands as well as big brands in the women's apparel industry, generating revenues from $3 million to $1 billion. We know what it takes to create a brand that women fall in love with!

Our accomplishments to date have been achieved with our own hard work and support from family and friends. But we need the help of great partners like you to get to the next level. This dedicated, passionate team has proven, "where there is a will, there is a way". Won't you join us?


We are hopeful we will be successful in reaching our campaign goals in order to achieve our plans for expansion and preparing for a stellar holiday season. We do know in a very competitive capital market that can be tough. However, if we do not meet our goals, we do have inventory and assets that will allow us to grow at a slower pace.

You can help in several ways...of course a contribution would be great...but please tell your friends and family and help us spread the word. One thing we know for sure, if you do contribute and receive your perks, you won't be able to stop talking about I Saw Something Shiny! Thanks for checking us out!!

Shiny Regards!

Pat

story:
Short Summary

We are Bakersfield Burrito Project

  • We go into the community and feed the hungry and the homeless. We do this without requiring anything of the people we help. No song or dance, just take the food, water or clothing and we ask for nothing in return.
  • Every Sunday afternoon, we meet at Wesley United Methodist Church Community Center, assemble burritos from rice, beans, tortillas, cheese (and whatever else is donated that week).
  • After the burritos are assembled, we go into the community and hand deliver the food to places we know where people need it. The homeless, the down-and-out, the addicted, the helpless.
  • Every Sunday takes about three hours to assemble, and deliver the food we collect through the week.

What We Need & What You Get

Running a non-profit takes more than rice and beans!

  • We have an office as a point of operations. We've tried to give the landlord beans and rice as rent, but he doesn't find that funny. Every month costs money to operate from that office. This is $500
  • We also have liability insurance to purchase to cover us from the possibility that volunteers might get injured while helping. Liability insurance costs $148.
  • There are also additional surprise expenses, like the sudden need for tortillas or a tank of gas in order to deliver food into the community. Every month, we like to have those contingencies covered. The extra $200 usually covers those costs.
  • Anything over and above what we collect helps the Bakersfield Burrito Project grow. For example, the purchases of office equipment, or bins to organize clothing donations.
  • What do you get for your donations? The knowledge your donation helps a little non-profit organization do what we do every Sunday. You know the money stays in a local organization, and doesn't go into bigger pockets elsewhere.
  • No one on Bakersfield Burrito Project staff gets a salary. Everyone, from the CEO to the Board Members, to the individuals with titles, do not get paid for their work. Every red cent put toward the Bakersfield Burrito Project goes directly to organization expenses.

The Impact

Please keep in mind the following:

  • We have worked within the community for over six years. Every Sunday, we hand out over 150 burritos directly to the people who need them. We have received local coverage in the newspaper, the radio, and television. A google search for Bakersfield Burrito Project will show the dozens of news articles showing our work.
  • Please help us reach our goals on rent and liability insurance. Join us!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone can make a financial contribution. But there are lots of other ways you can help!

  • Spread this campaign through the Internet and get it to people who can make a contribution.
  • A bag of dried beans. A bag of dried rice. A dozen burrito sized tortillas. A bag of cheese. A case of water. Bring it to Wesley United Methodist Church, on the corner of Niles and Oswell, and drop it off.
  • Go through your closet and get rid of the old clothes you no longer wear, no longer fit into. Bag them and bring them to our office or Wesley's and watch people gratefully take what you can no longer use.

story:
Furify is a website/community/platform that will let furries easily interact with their fellow furry friends.

Short Summary

Furify is our take on a `social` network for furries. We love the ideas and sites that are already out there, but they're focused on one aspect. Let that be art, events, streaming or interaction with fellow furs. What we would love to see is one intuitive platform that provides all of these features!


Why

So we from Furify are tired of using different kinds of media that are either not very furry-friendly or user-friendly. Example: I want to create a public event for furries? How do I easily do that? Personally I haven't found a great alternative. You either have to create a separate `furry account` on social media that actually prohibits you to do so. Or you have to put it up to 16 forums and maintain all of them.

Or another example: That time that I wanna upload a piece of art I commissioned, my experience with this is horrible. I believe that this should be intuitive and straightforward, but with most art focused websites it can even be quite difficult to do.


What We Need 

  • More developers: Web, iOS, Android and Windows Phone.
  • More server hardware as popularity increases.
  • You!... Yes what are we without you? We need your input and ideas to make Furify even greater!


What You Get

  • A smooth and intuitive website.
  • Performance that is more like today's standards.
  • A more social experience. Find your friends with ease, no more guessing usernames.
  • Keep up to date with statuses and updates from your friends and favourite artists.
  • App: what is a network without an app? Nothing so we're providing one of course with all the functionalities you would expect!
  • Auctions: easily create an auction for your YCH, Fursuit or other art/craft piece. Simple, intuitive and manageable.
  • Events: simple but yet extensive event management for all your public and private events.
  • Art: your art is of course much more important than your regular selfies, so it deserves its own place with different privacy options. Because maybe you do want your art to be publicly visible and your photos just for your friends.
  • Art Theft Protection: a lot of furries struggle with art theft everyday, we wanna try to help out as much as we can by analyzing every image that gets uploaded and give the original owner the options to block or receive an notification on a re-upload.
  • Privacy: we don't want your private information so we don't ask for it. No firstname or lastname just your nickname so your friends can find you.
  • Security: also we love security so we provide multiple options for Two-Factor-Authentication (OTP, email verification code or approve authentication through the app) and provide you with an advanced session-management. And we also hate eavesdropping so we only use strong encryption ciphers.
  • Openness we want to keep you informed on what we are doing, and provide pages that shows the statuses of ours servers and services.
  • A platform that is designed to grow, we can extend, add and upgrade servers without any downtime.


Risks & Challenges

Of course starting a new thing never comes without any risks, because without a user base a community is nothing. Our challenge is to provide you with the tools to create and sustain a great community!


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you haven't any spare money that doesn't mean you can't help! You can help us get our words out there. A like, share, retweet and/or follow can also be of great help!


Advertisements?!?!

Yes advertisements, like you might know most websites serve ads to keep an income to keep the systems running. So yes also we are gonna be serving ads. HOWEVER we are not gonna serve your standard google ads, we will be running our own advertisement-system that will only show ads from our own users. So only furry related ads! Also every ad gets checked by a moderator if it's not too flashy (everyone hates those pesky flashy ads) and get checked if they are SFW or not. (NSFW ads can be enabled in your settings.)

story:
What is After Ebola?

In November of 2014, Emma Middleton and Marlene Paradee attended a talk by Ezekiel Conteh, a Sierra Leonian working with Christian Aid to deliver medical supplies to areas affected by Ebola. What he said inspired us to find a way to do whatever we could to help those impacted by Ebola, and so After Ebola: Agriculture in Sierra Leone was born.

Our goal is to help communities affected by Ebola in Sierra Leone by implementing a program that trains community members to innovatively use resources they have on hand . We will begin in Kenema, a providence outside the capital of Freetown, and one of the worst-hit areas of the country. 

In order to successfully implement our project, we have been collaborating with Shed Jah, the head of WWOOF Sierra Leone and Village Care Initiatives, who has performed similar ventures in the country.

Where does the money go?

All of the money raised by this campaign will go directly towards the project. Depending on the needs of the community, this could include farm equipment, seeds for crops, and animals such as sheep and chickens. Some possible costs include: 

  • Pairs of lambs: 60,000 leones each, or $14
  • Bushels of rice: 10,000 leones each, or $2
  • Gari processing machine: 4,500,000 each, or $1,028
In addition to the funds raised by this campaign, we have been accepted into Clinton Global Initiative University (CGI U) and are being given $10,000 to execute our project. Some of this money is going toward our trip to Miami for the CGI U conference from the 6th-8th of March, as well as the travel costs for our flight to Sierra Leone. The rest will be used to carry out the project once in country. 
We believe that campaigns like this should have a lasting impact not just on their communities but also on the donors. Therefore, all of our perks are centered around engaging you, the donors, after the campaign is over. We are offering perks including email and video updates. For the highest level donors, we will put your name on our to-be-designed website on the donor page. 

Our Impact

For those directly affected by Ebola, whether from experiencing the disease in their communities or from losing a loved one, this is a very difficult time. Having a steady source of income that comes from a project implemented by their community, for their community, will take a large weight off their shoulders. Because our project is entirely rooted in the ideas and resources of the community, it will be self-sustaining and long-term. Our goal is to ensure that communities do not need to rely on outside assistance and have the ability to improve their own situations. 

Risks & Challenges

We really appreciate that you have taken the time to look at our campaign and to like, share, and donate! We understand that not everyone can contribute financially and are therefore asking those of you who cannot donate to please help us to spread the word. 

No one expects an epidemic like Ebola. But when tragedies like this occur, it is up to all of us to step up and do our part. 

Sincerely, 

Emma and Marlene

story:
Bad Ass Beautiful: Inside and Out

We have launched a MINI PREVIEW for you to be able to experience Bad Ass Beauty, before you donate! Remember that we can't do it without you, and a preview is just a preview. Please help us succeed, by becoming part of something wonderful!

Who We Are 

Bad Ass Beauty is not just your average beauty website. We believe in creating our best self—being beautiful on the inside and the outside: from what we eat, to what we put on our skin, to the energy we harness and create. We aim to encourage everyone to look and feel their best: being bad ass, and beautiful.


We believe in magic, glitter, great brows and daily meditation. We want everyone to believe in that too!


What We Offer

Bad Ass Beauty plans to offer—both free and subscription—enriched content, services, and products to achieve our mission: encouraging everyone to be badass beautiful on the inside and out.


Here is a look into what YOU will have access to, as a user of Bad Ass Beauty:
  • Bad Ass Beauty's signature Brow in a Box: a mini brow kit to create your perfect brow. Because a good brow is like a good bra.
  • Meditation in a box: a fun-sized kit to start or boost your very own daily mediation practice. All you need is a comfortable, quiet space!
  • Additionally, our signature Bad Ass Boxes will include: Facial in a Box, Morning Rush Box, and Good Hair Day Box.
  • Our weekly Bad Ass Beauty|Monday Mantra: an affirmation or mantra that you can keep with you in your mind, to repeat throughout the week, especially for ugly days. This is already available for free through my blog.
  • Videos and articles created by industry professionals to give you the best information and guidance in beauty, wellness, hair, makeup, and skin care. I have already begun a great series on my blog: Bad Ass Brows.
  • Our products will be of the highest standards, but with an affordable price tag attached. Our services and guidance will be provided by professionals--meaning the people who do this for a living, not just a random person on Youtube! We want to provide the best  advice, guidance, and products we can offer! 



A Field of Dreams

Bad Ass Beauty was born through a series of my own personal meditation sessions. It kind of happened like the movie, "Field of Dreams," with Kevin Costner, except without the creepy whispering, or ghosts. But seriously, I was meditating one night, and that scene when Kevin Costner hears the whispering out in the cornfield: "If you build it, he will come," came as clear as day into my head, and I hadn't watched the film in years.

I thought,  "Okay, universe, where will you take me?"

Who am I? My name is Crystal Fitzgerald. I'm a licensed esthetician, a makeup artist, and I'm currently studying for my CIDESCO diploma (it's like the master's degree of esthetics). Next I plan on studying nutrition to augment my esthetics education, and I also plan on training as a meditation teacher.

I had been feeling rather let down by a few things in my life... So, I began reading the book, Spirit Junkie by Gabrielle Bernstein. This started my path to meditation as a form of stress relief as well as it's various therapeutic benefits, and I began learning how to see the world with love. Something, that I definitely want to share. 

As I sat down to meditate every evening, I began asking the universe for guidance and answers. Bit by bit, I began building and creating the foundations for Bad Ass Beauty.

Contributions of any amount will receive an invitation to exclusively preview Bad Ass Beauty before it's launch! Check out the mini preview, before you donate!


Where I'm At Now

I have already purchased the domain name, badassbeauty.org, a hosting plan, and have begun working on the preliminary build, with a good friend of mine, Sarah Friedman! I have also launched a mini preview, for your exclusive enjoyment--check out what we have to offer! You will also be able to download a free Bad Ass Beauty Mantra e-sticker pack, very soon!


What I Need

Because online based businesses need to follow the same laws as regular, physical businesses, I need to establish quite a few things with my state and locale. I also need some essentials. Here is a list of what I need right now:

  • Fees for registration and formation of an LLC, retail licensing, and all other appropriate federal, state, and local registration and licensure.

  • Negotiaton of the purchase of the badassbeauty.com domain (as its owner seems to be just sitting on it.)

  • A new computer and printer. Currently, I am working on my 2008 MacBook, which is basically a dinosaur, and barely functional. It would be really great to have a computer that runs current software, and actually supports flash.

  • The purchase and development of our product fills from cosmetic labs, as well as casings (like compacts and tubes). The other option is going with a private label company.

  • Prototype development.

  • Maintain continued hosting with our host of choice.

  • Financial services.


The Timeline

Since I'm working and going to school, things will take some time to gain momentum but here is a relative timeline of my plan:

February - March 2015

Establish LLC

Establishment of social media pages and marketing

Finish initial development of the website

First content completed

Develop prototypes of Meditation|Facial|Brow in a Box!

Begin sampling and testing of products

Build of retail side/shopping cart

Logo design completion

Surveying our preview users


March 2015 - April 2015

Complete preview testing

Complete kit and product development and packaging

Complete apparel and merchandise


April - May 2015

Launch Beauty and the Bay!

Finish fulfillment of perks

Begin hiring of freelancers to establish and create content

Sometimes we have unforeseen chaos in our lives, and this schedule may be changed at any time. However, you will still be updated every step of the way!


Remember... Any startup is a risk in itself, but with the right tools, guidance, and contributions like yours, I believe Bad Ass Beauty will become an amazing success story!


Even if you can't donate, please share the love! Let all your friends know, so they can be a part of the awesome too! Regardless of your participation, I welcome you to follow my progress on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter! Updates will be provided here at IndieGoGo as well!
story_txt:
Bad Ass Beautiful: Inside and OutWe have launched a MINI PREVIEW for you to be able to experience Bad Ass Beauty, before you donate! Remember that we can't do it without you, and a preview is just a preview. Please help us succeed, by becoming part of something wonderful!
Who We Are Bad Ass Beauty is not just your average beauty website. We believe in creating our best self—being beautiful on the inside and the outside: from what we eat, to what we put on our skin, to the energy we harness and create. We aim to encourage everyone to look and feel their best: being bad ass, and beautiful.


We believe in magic, glitter, great brows and daily meditation. We want everyone to believe in that too!What We OfferBad Ass Beauty plans to offer—both free and subscription—enriched content, services, and products to achieve our mission: encouraging everyone to be badass beautiful on the inside and out.


Here is a look into what YOU will have access to, as a user of Bad Ass Beauty:

Bad Ass Beauty's signature Brow in a Box: a mini brow kit to create your perfect brow. Because a good brow is like a good bra.

Meditation in a box: a fun-sized kit to start or boost your very own daily mediation practice. All you need is a comfortable, quiet space!

Additionally, our signature Bad Ass Boxes will include: Facial in a Box, Morning Rush Box, and Good Hair Day Box.

Our weekly Bad Ass Beauty|Monday Mantra: an affirmation or mantra that you can keep with you in your mind, to repeat throughout the week, especially for ugly days. This is already available for free through my blog.

Videos and articles created by industry professionals to give you the best information and guidance in beauty, wellness, hair, makeup, and skin care. I have already begun a great series on my blog: Bad Ass Brows.

Our products will be of the highest standards, but with an affordable price tag attached. Our services and guidance will be provided by professionals--meaning the people who do this for a living, not just a random person on Youtube! We want to provide the best  advice, guidance, and products we can offer! 






A Field of DreamsBad Ass Beauty was born through a series of my own personal meditation sessions. It kind of happened like the movie, "Field of Dreams," with Kevin Costner, except without the creepy whispering, or ghosts. But seriously, I was meditating one night, and that scene when Kevin Costner hears the whispering out in the cornfield: "If you build it, he will come," came as clear as day into my head, and I hadn't watched the film in years.I thought,  "Okay, universe, where will you take me?"Who am I? My name is Crystal Fitzgerald. I'm a licensed esthetician, a makeup artist, and I'm currently studying for my CIDESCO diploma (it's like the master's degree of esthetics). Next I plan on studying nutrition to augment my esthetics education, and I also plan on training as a meditation teacher.I had been feeling rather let down by a few things in my life... So, I began reading the book, Spirit Junkie by Gabrielle Bernstein. This started my path to meditation as a form of stress relief as well as it's various therapeutic benefits, and I began learning how to see the world with love. Something, that I definitely want to share. As I sat down to meditate every evening, I began asking the universe for guidance and answers. Bit by bit, I began building and creating the foundations for Bad Ass Beauty.Contributions of any amount will receive an invitation to exclusively preview Bad Ass Beauty before it's launch! Check out the mini preview, before you donate!Where I'm At NowI have already purchased the domain name, badassbeauty.org, a hosting plan, and have begun working on the preliminary build, with a good friend of mine, Sarah Friedman! I have also launched a mini preview, for your exclusive enjoyment--check out what we have to offer! You will also be able to download a free Bad Ass Beauty Mantra e-sticker pack, very soon!What I NeedBecause online based businesses need to follow the same laws as regular, physical businesses, I need to establish quite a few things with my state and locale. I also need some essentials. Here is a list of what I need right now:
Fees for registration and formation of an LLC, retail licensing, and all other appropriate federal, state, and local registration and licensure.
Negotiaton of the purchase of the badassbeauty.com domain (as its owner seems to be just sitting on it.)
A new computer and printer. Currently, I am working on my 2008 MacBook, which is basically a dinosaur, and barely functional. It would be really great to have a computer that runs current software, and actually supports flash.
The purchase and development of our product fills from cosmetic labs, as well as casings (like compacts and tubes). The other option is going with a private label company.
Prototype development.
Maintain continued hosting with our host of choice.

Financial services.




The TimelineSince I'm working and going to school, things will take some time to gain momentum but here is a relative timeline of my plan:February - March 2015Establish LLCEstablishment of social media pages and marketingFinish initial development of the websiteFirst content completedDevelop prototypes of Meditation|Facial|Brow in a Box!Begin sampling and testing of productsBuild of retail side/shopping cartLogo design completionSurveying our preview usersMarch 2015 - April 2015Complete preview testingComplete kit and product development and packagingComplete apparel and merchandiseApril - May 2015Launch Beauty and the Bay!Finish fulfillment of perksBegin hiring of freelancers to establish and create contentSometimes we have unforeseen chaos in our lives, and this schedule may be changed at any time. However, you will still be updated every step of the way!Remember... Any startup is a risk in itself, but with the right tools, guidance, and contributions like yours, I believe Bad Ass Beauty will become an amazing success story! Even if you can't donate, please share the love! Let all your friends know, so they can be a part of the awesome too! Regardless of your participation, I welcome you to follow my progress on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter! Updates will be provided here at IndieGoGo as well!

story:
Build-A-Future – Overview

All Out Africa Foundation has been a registered charity in Swaziland since 2006. Working alongside our volunteer travel projects our mission is to improve the quality of life of people in need through education and skill development. Swaziland is a unique landlocked culturally vibrant nation, though suffers from the highest HIV prevalence in the world, and extremely high statistics of gender-based violence. This harsh reality leaves thousands of orphaned and vulnerable children & families to fight for the opportunity to attend school, and improve their quality of life. Our programs are holistic in helping communities by helping children grow up in a child friendly caring environment. This is attained through our child sponsorship  and education program, our play and sport development initiatives, and our Build-A-Future program.

Our Build-A-Future program is the foundation for our programs to help break the cycle of poverty in our communities, and disease ridden nation. Working primarily out of six Neighbourhood Care Points; a place where pre-school aged children have the opportunity to attend informal schooling, receive a meal, and be given the opportunity to play and be given care from our voluntary community teachers.

Our NCP structures are the building block for creating a holistic safe community care point. It also here through our NCP’s that our 300 sponsored children know where to find continued support outside of the classroom.

Impact

Our Build-A-Future Campaign is currently seeking funds to help improve the infrastructure of our NCP’s and our sponsored children’s homes. Building classrooms, storerooms, kitchens, toilets and playgrounds, as well as cultivating gardens are just a few of our main priorities. Our NCP’s are designed to be safe spaces for our children thus we need to continue to make them an inviting home for those that don’t receive the care every child deserves at home.

The campaign was started out of need to continue to develop our NCP’s. Nearly 40-60 children are fostered at each NCP on a daily basis thus having welcoming classrooms, clean and safe play structures, hygienic toilets, community kitchens and the capacity to cultivate gardens and have clean drinking water, relies heavily on funds raised through donations. The implementation of these structures is carried out with our local builder, voluntary community members, and international volunteers. As our slogan suggests, “We build for the community, with the community, at the community level.” Thus our actual building tools and techniques don’t use fancy machinery, rather labor intensive local building methods. We have countless voluntary community members to help build the infrastructure, it is only a matter of having the funds to purchase the material.

Build-A-Future Campaign

Our current campaign is aiming to raise $10,000. A classroom for example costs $500; to cultivate six gardens with enough water for maintenance it will cost $3,000. Furthermore, constructing kitchens, storerooms (to store music and sports equipment, books and tools), and playgrounds per NCP will quickly tally to $1000 per NCP. While the amount being raised will contribute to only building material, plumbing and water tanks, our Foundation will continue to source other means to employ our staff, and contribute to vehicle hire and so on. If we don’t raise $10,000 the accumulated funds will still benefit our NCP’s and communities, as we will prioritize the needs of each NCP.

The All Out Africa Foundation prides itself in being highly transparent which can be attested to the invaluable support past volunteers and donors have given. In the last year, nearly 90% of our Build-A-Future program was sustained through direct donations to the Foundation.

If you are currently not able to help financially, you can always contribute by following us through social media, save for a volunteer experience or share our Foundation initiatives with your family and friends through the accessible tools available on Indiegogo.

By the way, did you know gogo is the Siswati word for grandmother? Let’s help our gogo’s by creating positive safe spaces for our children, starting at the community level with our Neighbourhood Care Points.

story:
Project :


to help a very poor Man to get a good used Car and be able to drive to Doctor and more. Never was able to Buy a Car because of Disability Retirement Payment and can hardly Live from Month to Month.

A Prayer will be sent to every Person who makes a Donation 

Information for Donation :

 Please send Donations to Paypal      Don_von_Burkholder@web.de

About me:

I am now a Retired Person 45 % Disabled and 57 years old
I am the last Living Person no more Family or Relatives

2001 I had a Job, Working for a Friend who had a Software Company ,  Feb. 2006 i had a Accident at Work ,  Damages in lower Back ( Spinal Column L2 - L4 and more )  then after 6 Months - OP and more , he Fired me telling me he can´t  afford a Handicapped Person  now i have so many problems, Sitting for more that one Hour,  can´t Walk like a normal Person ,  have to take several Medications every Day.

story:
Short Summary

In April of 2011 Teresa Coles formed a group of hiking photographers who spend time hiking together and shooting photographs around Southern California. She began to post some of her photos to her Facebook page each week. She received emails from people she knew who were in treatments for various illnesses saying that they enjoyed seeing the photos as this was their only chance to see the outdoors due to the effects of the treatments. Teresa realized that not only the patients but their care givers as well could benefit from being able to experience nature through viewing photographs.

Teresa created Shutterheart Stories as a collaborative effort of volunteer photographers to provide a way for patients, family members and caregivers to experience nature in times when they are unable to be outside. We create and provide photo story books made available on our website for patients and their care givers to access during times of treatment or recovery for encouragement and to reduce stress or feelings of isolation.


What We Need & What You Get

We need funds for our start up:

  • Website design and hosting
  • Filing fees to obtain our 501(c)3 status
  • Printed Materials to "Get the Word Out" to treatment centers/hospitals
What can you get?
  • $5.00 - choice of one photo greeting card (blank inside)
  • $10.00 - choice of two photo greeting cards (blank inside)
  • $25.00 - choice of 4 photo greeting cards (blank inside)
  • $30.00 - Get all 6 photo greeting cards (blank inside)
All funds raised will go to fund the project starting with the website costs even if we do not reach the full goal amount. We will post results with how money was spent after campaign ends.

The Impact

One of the challenges faced by people undergoing treatment for various diseases is that they often cannot spend time outside due to the effects of their treatments. They can become depressed or feel isolated and stressed. They often are unable to spend any time outside in nature. Like wise their care givers or family members spend hours in waiting rooms, doctors offices or at home caring for the patients not having time to spend outside.

Our online photo stories bring nature to patients, families and care givers through a website that can be easily accessed via the internet using a tablet, iPad, laptop, or smart phone.

Risks & Challenges

To avoid running out of photos to keep the website fresh and new stories being added on a regular basis we are drawing on our group of Hiking photographers to volunteer to share their photos in whole albums or single pages. These will be voluntary donations at no cost to our organization, in exchange the contributing photographers will receive credit on the album and on a page on the website.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign by sharing our project with your social media connections
  • Post our campaign on Facebook, Twitter
  • Email a link to your friends

story:
About Us:

  • Stamped STL is a new and exciting company created to help you explore St. Louis. We started Stamped STL because of our passion for all things St. Louis. The irony is that neither of the owners were raised within the city limits. However, they both quickly fell in love with the city's charm. Through their own unique experiences, Jonathan and Katharine have discovered that the unique character of each burrow that keeps St. Louis alive throughout each season and brings the city various forms of color and character. Whether you grew up in New York City or Small Town, USA, St. Louis has a home for you, and Stamped STL wants to help you find your own favorites.

    We are currently working to develop a series of publications and blog posts which are designed to help you discover some of the City's greatest treasures. The publications will motivate you to explore St. Louis through the use of monetary savings. Each location that we suggest has generously offered to give the owner of the Stamped STL publication a discount. Furthermore, each business that we highlight or suggest is locally owned. We love St. Louis, and we want to help foster awareness for revitalization of the local St. Louis economy and the preservation of its distinctive urban communities. Please check out the pre-sales for our first publications called the Stamped STL Bar Bible, and keep up-to-date on the progress of our next publication and blog posts by following us on twitter or liking us on Facebook.


Our Team:

  • Jonathan is currently a graduate student at Washington University in St. Louis. He graduated Summa Cum Laude from Southeast Missouri State University in 2010 with a BS in Physics, Engineering Physics, and Mathematics. Originally, he grew up in a small town just south of the MetroEast. 

    His two fondest childhood memories involve listening to the Cardinals on the radio while sitting on the porch with his father and the bet that was made with his parents during the half time show of SuperBowl XXXIV (Rams vs Titans). If the Rams pulled off the win, they would all immediately roll down the snow covered hill in the backyard in their PJs.

    His parents, a coal miner and a beautician, stressed the importance of education, drive, and hard work. These are the attributes that he brings to Stamped STL. Beyond that he also brings a passion for Saint Louis and the organizations, people, and events that make it a great place to live. He even sees the potential for St. Louis as a football city. #KeepTheRamsInStLouis

    Outside of his work with Stamped STL and his schooling, Jonathan loves to play baseball. He plays for the Red Birds andBlaze in the St. Louis Men's Baseball League and O'Fallon in the Mon-Clair Baseball League. He claims that St. Louis has one of the best adult amateur baseball scenes in the Midwest.

  • Katharine is a currently an intensive care nurse at a local hospital. She is a 2012 graduate of Saint Louis University. Katharine frequently made the Dean’s List and has her Bachelors of Science in Nursing with a minor in Philosophy. She is also a proud alumna of the Gamma Tau Chapter of the Gamma Phi Beta Sorority.  Originally, she is from Louisville, KY and is quick to say that her hometown holds a special place in her heart.

    Some of her fondest memories growing up in Kentucky involved participating in community outreach programs and mock government during middle school and high school. She has always been passionate about the environment and about being her best self. She enjoys public speaking, and people consider her to be very personable.

    Katharine’s mother, an academic and real estate entrepreneur, grew up in the inner city Detroit, always stressed the importance of education and perseverance against all odds. Her father, a professor who studied urban development, always emphasized doing things the right way instead of the easy way and instilled in his children the value of hard work. Furthermore, Katharine brings her passion for sustainability in the urban environment and community prosperity. She cares tremendously about preserving the character that makes St. Louis unique.

    When Katharine is not daydreaming about the cool places in St. Louis that she hasn’t explored yet she enjoys reading historical fiction, documentaries, and art. She also enjoys gardening and playing with her dogs, Dexter and Lucy.


We Need Your Support!

  • Our company is offering a new way to explore the urban nightlife through the discovery of local watering holes. Our flagship item is a guide to St. Louis nightlife. Called the "Bar Bible", this compact booklet is designed to easily fit in your back pocket or purse. Inside the "Bar Bible" you will find an extensive list of selected venues that will showcase the different bar districts of St. Louis. At each selected location, an exclusive 2-for-1 drink special may be redeemed by showing your booklet. Your bartender will stamp your "Bar Bible" to indicate the use of your one time offer, but don't worry there will be over 20 "STAMPED STL" destinations* for a combined savings of over $100. The booklet will also include suggested bar crawls and much more. Preorder while supplies last, and remember "Think Local. Drink Local."

    The 2015 Bar Bible includes locations such as: Amsterdam Tavern, Riley's Pub, and Saratoga Lanes.


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. The more people that hear about us the more successful we will be in 2015 and in years to come!
  • Use our Indiegogo share tools and find us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and visit our website www.stampedstl.com

Your bartender will stamp your "Bar Bible" to indicate the use of your one time offer, but don't worry there will be over 20 "STAMPED STL" destinations* for a combined savings of over $100. The booklet will also include suggested bar crawls and much more. Preorder while supplies last, and remember "Think Local. Drink Local."
The 2015 Bar Bible includes locations such as: Amsterdam Tavern, Riley's Pub, and Saratoga Lanes.

Other Ways You Can Help  Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. The more people that hear about us the more successful we will be in 2015 and in years to come! Use our Indiegogo share tools and find us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and visit our website www.stampedstl.com

story:
Short Summary

This is simple, can we get $100,000 just by asking for it? For the price of a cup of coffee, you have a chance to be part of history. Will you help us?

The Impact

There is no saying what we might do with the money, and we aren't going to say what we will do. You can donate and find out if it intrigues you.

Other Ways You Can Help

You'll have the biggest impact if you donate. Once you've done that, spread the word.

story:
Introducing

    

H8Check is a mobile app that will allow its users to report discrimination or mistreatment by any business for any reason, including race, gender identity, sexual orientation or religion.  

Your generous support will allow us to complete the following:

  • Finalize beta testing with our supporters - so that it is the best app it can be! 
  • Get the word out about H8Check - we want to build an army of H8Checkers who desire to keep bigoted businesses in check.
  • Create a companion website where users can share personal stories and learn more about what we're doing.
  • Ongoing management of your app - we are in it for the long haul!
  • It Gets Better!  - we have a lot of great upgrades we want to implement!  

    

We all want to call out discriminatory businesses.  We all want valuable information to help make smart decisions about who we are supporting.  More importantly, we all want to feel SAFE when we enter a place of business.

Regardless of what legislation is passed, good or bad, we all know: Haters will hate, and bigots will still be bigots.

Social injustice is nothing new in America, and with the recent HUGE legal gains for equality, some are digging in their heals and making it known they do not agree.  

Agree or not - there is no excuse for bigotry in business.

Old School Attitudes            +       Today's Agendas         =        Same Old Bigotry       

         

     +          =        

In this time of progress, “Religious Freedom Bills" are being created (and passed), supposedly to protect Christian values, when all they really do is protect the rights of bigoted business owners who choose to remain intolerant and desire to discriminate against entire groups and classes of people. They are certainly not based in love, respect, or equality, which we believe is exactly what Jesus represented.  

Let’s work together to end discrimination and prejudice by business owners.

While the public outcry is largely a result of anti-gay sentiments, religious freedom bills open the door for all kinds of discrimination-- even against fundamentalist Christians.  


The H8Check mobile app will provide a user-assessed equality rating. It's your app; you get to tell the world how you’ve been treated—good or bad! You can also report any mistreatment you witness then upload and share the images to prove it. 

Just like equality, this app is for everyone. We’ve all witnessed discrimination at some point, many of us first-hand. It's time to report it.

H8Check will also allow POSITIVE reporting of businesses that are accepting and treat everyone equally. We want to call attention to places that are fair, tolerant and promote equality.  

We've been here before - "whites only" lunch counters, segregated schools, unfair housing practices, laws against interracial marriage... these are things our parents dealt with and fought against. Is their struggle all in vain?  We want to believe it is not.  

(One example?  A matter of life and death:  The Michigan House of Representatives has passed a religious freedom bill that might potentially allow emergency medical personnel to exercise religious objections to treating gay patients.)

Equality. It's time. Together, we can demand businesses CHECK THEIR HATE at the door.

story:
The Rogue Story

Rogue Remedies is a little company that I started at the end of 2015 to provide  100% natural and non-toxic solutions to everyday challenges  that can affect your quality of life, like difficulty in getting to sleep ....or bugs (we have not gotten to bed bugs yet - but it's on our list).


Rogue Remedies believes there can be solutions that are toxin-free, and are sustainable.    If the solution comes in a nice package - all the better.   Your bug spray should be something that compliments your daily life.


The Tick Mix

 In the Eastern Townships of Quebec Canada, we are seeing more and more ticks.  Because of global warming - they are now surviving our winters and they are carrying Lyme disease.  This is a big worry because Lyme disease is not easy to detect and often misdiagnosed. 

Our doctors and hospitals have not been quick to diagnose or treat for Lyme disease or the potential of it and so the only good solution was to find a way to keep the ticks from biting (because who wants to stay indoors when you're in the country).   I wanted to find a solution that was  100% natural and toxin free so one can use it everyday and feel good about themselves and the environment.... and thus the The Tick Mix was born. 


How it works

Ticks find their hosts by sitting on the tips of plants "questing" with their front legs to detect smell, temperature change and movement.  The idea behind The Tick Mix is to put them off your scent with a scent they do not like.  I have experimented with many mixes on ticks generously donated by the veterinarian and I have found there is not much a tick does not like (I have seen a tick cuddle up to a raw piece of garlic).  The key is Rose Geranium oil, and how it is mixed.  If it is mixed with too many other scents - it does not put the tick off.



The Rogue Dream

  • This is a company that inspires its client's to go out and have fun through its blog, instagram and products.
  • Summer parties with Rogue Remedies' DEFEND: Moskeet Mix sitting out for guests to use throughout the night.
  • A bottle of  DEFEND: The Tic Mix is in every country home right next to the front  door ready to use for whenever the kids, dog, or yourself are going out.
  • A bottle of The Tick Mix and Moskeet Mix right next to the cash register in General Stores all over the country side and people making sure they have their bottle for the season.
  • People love the sleep mist and can't live without it..........its divine.
  • A recycling program in all those General Stores where people can return their bottle and get their deposit back. We come and pick up those bottles for re-use.
  • Building a fantastic Rogue Team full of talented people.
  • More solutions to life's little challenges like.... the perfect anti itch cream (that really works!), a lice repellent hairspray for kids, a flea powder that kills fleas on your pets, a  powder that kills bed bugs - all of which are natural and non-toxic.
  • A mischievous, fun product for next Valentines...I can't say anything more then that....its a surprise.
  • A dog friendly office with lots of sunlight and the coolest lab for mixing and bottling.
But first we have to start with just getting the product onto shelves and getting to know our peeps!


Your Help

 The funds we are asking for is to get the business off the ground and The Tick Mix on to store shelves.   Rogue Remedies has been creating The Tick Mix for friends and family but the goal is to get it in every general store ( wherever the ticks may be). 



What you get

We offer you not only The Tick Mix, but also our Moskeet Mix (Mosquito Repellent) - coming out this summer, and the GoodEve Sleep Mist - a linen spray that lays a foundation for the best sleep. 





And...... Awesome T-Shirts

Plus we have created Go Rogue T-shirts for this campaign..........Go Rogue is not only about Rogue Remedies it also speaks to the times, as Bob Dylan once sang, they are a changin  and we need to get with a vision that is not so mainstream but more environmentally friendly and accountable (Go Smart wasn't as catchy). These t-shirts  will come in Men's, Women's and youth sizes.



Risks & Challenges

  • Finding a preservative that maintains a long term shelf life.
  • Getting the Perks out on time. 
  • Actually getting the product onto shelves - although there are already some shops interested so that is a good sign. 
  • Improvement, improvement, improvement - I could keep tinkering with the product until the cows come home.



Other Ways You Can Help

Please get the word out - I think an all natural Anti Tick Spray is needed and the goal is for people to have access to it.  

Thank you for listening.

    Other Ways You Can Help Please get the word out - I think an all natural Anti Tick Spray is needed and the goal is for people to have access to it.  
   Thank you for listening.

story:
Thank you for your interest in Manuscript Across America!

This April, I'll be embarking on an odyssey of cultural exploration unlike anything I've ever taken on before. Traveling with a small team of friends and filmmakers in my VW Eurovan (say a prayer for her!), I'll be driving from California to the East Coast and back again with a 1,000-foot long scroll of paper, stopping at a diverse set of locations along the way and inviting the public to write on the scroll. While people will be free to write whatever they feel inspired to share, the primary focus will be centered around reflecting on who we are, what we'd like to become and how we're going to get there. Prompts will include questions like, "What are the biggest challenges facing you, your community, your country and the environment and how do you propose we most effectively address these issues?" The written contributions will be interconnected on a single scroll of paper to create a rich mosaic of our nation, straight from the source. In addition, we'll be filming a documentary of the entire journey in order to get an intimate perspective of the hearts and minds of America's citizens, directly engaging with the people who make up our wealthiest suburbs, most impoverished neighborhoods, biggest cities and smallest rural towns. Manuscript Across America will bring together the wisdom from a full spectrum of backgrounds, enabling us to examine the essence of who we are at a specific point in time and begin taking steps towards more harmonious tomorrows.  

Why donate?

You've probably noticed that humanity has strayed pretty far up poop creek without a paddle. Wars rage. Greed abounds. The Earth moans. Manuscript Across America is my effort to at least get a paddle back in our hands and start rowing back towards the clean rivers from whence we came. But I can't do it alone. In fact, the entire premise of the project is collaboration: working together to brainstorm for better. While traveling across the country will no doubt be an enriching experience for me personally, it will also present a wide range of challenges - both anticipated and unforeseen. First and foremost, the journey of more than 10,000 driving miles will cost money. Food, gas and occasional accommodations (we'll sleep in my van whenever possible!) will be the biggest expenses. Funding the filming, editing and production of the documentary will also come at a significant cost. Finally, incidentals like van maintenance and event admission fees will also be a part of the budget. When you donate $100 or more, you're guaranteed to receive a DVD copy of the official Manuscript Across America documentary and  the satisfaction of knowing that you helped give America a good, healthy kick in the butt - in the right direction of course.   

Spread the Word

Thank you! Your contributions and support are the driving force behind Manuscript Across America. I believe that there is hope for humanity, but I also know that if we don't all take a close look at our relationships with each other and the planet, our future is bleak. If you are unable to make a financial donation, you can still be of great assistance by spreading the word. Tell your friends and family about Manuscript Across America and help promote the project by using the Indiegogo share tools and social media. Also check out www.manuscriptacrossamerica.com for more information as well as updates from the road. Write on...

story:
What do we want to Establish?


An Immigrants Helpdesk:

An international, cross-border, altruistic support platform to organize help in the context of the current refugee crisis. Through building a transferable and integrated social media platform (with enhanced additional functionality) to support Refugees and those agencies and volunteers who support them, this initiative will:

  • Allow for the management and co-ordination of volunteers and helpers at microsystem/local level;
  • Provide a social networking function to facilitate virtual social support communities amongst and between refugees, helpers and volunteers
  • Provide and create access to (intercultural) information about the hosting country/region in order to support the refugees and to enhance integration.
  • Deliver and share management tools to enhance a decentralised accommodation of refugees (incl. a mentoring system in order to help Refugees get started in a new environment);
  • This platform will facilitate data capture on its activities, creating an evidence base of reliable data to improve the management and actions of administrative and political bodies in relation to Refugee support and settlement. This data will include qualitative, anonymised Refugee experience feedback;
  • Support the provision and co-ordination of  language training, where regular classes are not available;

Who is behind the project?

My name is Sven Henrik Häseker and this project is my response to the need for a multipurpose ICT and Social Networking platform to assist with the biggest refugee crisis seen in Europe and surrounding countries since the end of World War II.  In putting together this project I have combined extensive business client support and project management experience with the twin personal experiences of a migrant background and extensive engagement on integration policy issues. When last year the "refugee crisis" struck Europe, I got in touch with friends, colleagues and partner companies and we thought hard about how we could help. We developed a concept for a collaborative social media community to bring together the needs of refugees, volunteers, agencies and administrative authorities in working together to cope with the situation. So far we have invested around $70,000 in the project, e.g. for developing a messaging app for refugees and volunteers to communicate with each other. In between we worked with five companies from three different states on the project.

But we need additional support to bring the overall project to fruition. 

We are currently working in partnership with the Association of European Border Regions (AEBR) – the oldest NGO in the area of regional/cross-border cooperation (established 1972) – and the Assembly of European Regions (AER)  to promote interest in our proposal, highlighting the benefits it can bring to all stakeholders who are currently struggling to respond to the needs of Refugees. 

The Platform we want to build will allow for easier co-ordination of efforts between different players on the ground across Europe, and it will make it possible to address the social isolation experienced by so many refugees, particularly those in reception accommodation, as a result of little or no contact with the local community.  This platform will allow for civil society in any area to link with and support refugees locally. It is our contribution to providing a means to respond more quickly and more effectively to the needs of Refugees, avoiding long delays.  A few months is a long time in the life of a young child, and a long time in the life of adults and children who need shelter, stability, access to basic healthcare, support for recovery from trauma and a chance to get on with rebuilding their lives. This is our offering.  Will you join us?


What will the project involve?

We want to create a digital platform consisting of up to five modules. This "Platform" will comprise a complex system of webinterfaces, a smartphone app, multilingual media materials, and individual software apps, e.g. for supporting decentralised accommodation and running a mentoring programme for those refugees being decentrally accommodated. 


Module 1 - Electronic Platform to establish relationships between refugees and the people of the hosting country, as well as to support and coordinate volunteers/helpers

This module will provide social networking and co-ordination tools for connecting refugees with local supports within the area and community they are living in; it will also allow people to offer help locally.


Module 2 - Intercultural Information/Communication

This module should enhance an intercultural information flow through providing short films delivering specific intercultural training. This will aim to decrease potential conflicts between migrants and people of the hosting country arising from a lack of knowledge and information.


Module 3 - Support of decentralized accomodation

This module of the project will adapt existing digital accommodation management software for application to the management of decentralised and dispersed refugee accommodation. This system will be secure and will integrate with the area-based supports and communication/co-ordination tools of Module 1 so that refugees can be accommodated in places where they have links to the local supports and social/community contact that they need. 


Module 4 – Refugee Experience and Information Service:

This module will provide a platform for the broadcasting and dissemination of accurate information on the experiences and access/entitlements of refugees in different countries and will provide a source of reliable information for prospective refugees about what to expect on arrival. This will assist with planning and decision making for families and individuals. It will also act as an alternative information source to the inaccurate and misleading information promoted by traffickers.


What do we need the money for?

The companies involved so far already spend around 70.000 Dollars into the preparation of the project. This includes the concept development, project management and the programming of a messenger service. With the money from this campaign we would like to significantly boost the project. The money shall be invested in the following order:


Module 1: USD 79.000 (incl. the initial setup of the system)

Programming and launch of the system (incl. the web platform, the smartphone app and the finishing of the messenger service). 


Module 2: USD 82.000

Production and translation of video courtesy as a kind of virtual mentoring programme (available in at least 4 languages).


Module 3: USD 120.000

Adaptation of a touristic software module (original investment around 350k) to the needs of this project, incl. marketing and training for volunteers working with the system.


Module 4: USD 29.000

Production of video courtesy (reports, interviews with refugees, etc.). Costs for hosting, traffic and maintenance (until the end of 2016): USD 50.000


After the crowdfunding, the project partners will try to apply also for funds from the European Union. Normaly a co-financing is needed to apply for such funds (20-50 percent). So, even if the goal is not reached immediately, the funds might be used as a leverage and could be doubled or even tripled through a public co-funding. 


Will the project really change anything?

This project has the potential to deliver great change for refugees and the communities who support them.  We know that people in Europe want to help Refugees and we are working to help them make that connection.  We believe that the system we propose can do this.  The refugee crisis has shown that people are willing and able to contribute directly. This project will connect those who need help with those who want to provide it. Will you be a part of it too?  Please share with anyone you think might be interested- a little funding from many people goes a long way. Thank you.  If you are interested in knowing more about the project please contact us.

to bring the overall project to fruition. 
We are currently working in partnership with the Association of
European Border Regions (AEBR) – the oldest NGO in the area of
regional/cross-border cooperation (established 1972) – and the Assembly of European Regions (AER)  to promote interest in
our proposal, highlighting the benefits it can bring to all stakeholders who
are currently struggling to respond to the needs of Refugees. 
The Platform we want to build
will allow for easier co-ordination of efforts between different players on the
ground across Europe, and it will make it possible to address the social
isolation experienced by so many refugees, particularly those in reception
accommodation, as a result of little or no contact with the local
community.  This platform will allow for civil society in any area to link
with and support refugees locally. It is our contribution to providing a means
to respond more quickly and more effectively to the needs of Refugees, avoiding
long delays.  A few months is a long time in the life of a young child,
and a long time in the life of adults and children who need shelter, stability,
access to basic healthcare, support for recovery from trauma and a chance to
get on with rebuilding their lives. This is our offering.  Will you join
us?

What will the project involve?
We want to create a digital
platform consisting of up to five modules. This "Platform" will
comprise a complex system of webinterfaces, a smartphone app, multilingual
media materials, and individual software apps, e.g. for supporting
decentralised accommodation and running a mentoring programme for those
refugees being decentrally accommodated. 
Module 1
- Electronic Platform to establish relationships between refugees and the
people of the hosting country, as well as to support and coordinate
volunteers/helpersThis module will provide social networking and co-ordination tools for
connecting refugees with local supports within the area and community they are
living in; it will also allow people to offer help locally.
Module 2
- Intercultural Information/Communication
This module should enhance an
intercultural information flow through providing short films delivering
specific intercultural training. This will aim to decrease potential conflicts
between migrants and people of the hosting country arising from a lack of
knowledge and information.
Module 3
- Support of decentralized accomodation
This module of the project
will adapt existing digital accommodation management software for application
to the management of decentralised and dispersed refugee accommodation. This
system will be secure and will integrate with the area-based supports and
communication/co-ordination tools of Module 1 so that refugees can be
accommodated in places where they have links to the local supports and
social/community contact that they need. 
Module 4
– Refugee Experience and Information Service:
This module will provide a
platform for the broadcasting and dissemination of accurate information on the
experiences and access/entitlements of refugees in different countries and will
provide a source of reliable information for prospective refugees about what to
expect on arrival. This will assist with planning and decision making for
families and individuals. It will also act as an alternative information source
to the inaccurate and misleading information promoted by traffickers.
What do
we need the money for?
The companies involved so far
already spend around 70.000 Dollars into the preparation of the project. This
includes the concept development, project management and the programming of a
messenger service. With the money from this campaign we would like to
significantly boost the project. The money shall be invested in the following
order:
Module 1: USD 79.000 (incl.
the initial setup of the system)
Programming and launch of the
system (incl. the web platform, the smartphone app and the finishing of the
messenger service). 
Module 2: USD 82.000
Production and translation of
video courtesy as a kind of virtual mentoring programme (available in at least
4 languages).
Module 3: USD 120.000
Adaptation of a touristic
software module (original investment around 350k) to the needs of this project,
incl. marketing and training for volunteers working with the system.
Module 4: USD 29.000
Production of video courtesy (reports, interviews with refugees,
etc.). Costs for hosting, traffic and maintenance (until the end of 2016):
USD 50.000After the crowdfunding, the project partners will try to apply also for funds from the European Union. Normaly a co-financing is needed to apply for such funds (20-50 percent). So, even if the goal is not reached immediately, the funds might be used as a leverage and could be doubled or even tripled through a public co-funding. 
Will the
project really change anything?
This project has the potential to deliver great change
for refugees and the communities who support them.  We know that people in
Europe want to help Refugees and we are working to help them make that
connection.  We believe that the system we propose can do this.  The
refugee crisis has shown that people are willing and able to contribute
directly. This project will connect those who need help with those who want to
provide it. Will you be a part of it too?  Please share with anyone you
think might be interested- a little funding from many people goes a long way.
Thank you.  If you are interested in knowing more about the project please
contact us.

story:
Hello all, 

My name is Michelle Corbin and I am the founder of PinkCompany. This is a brand new business for women, by women. PinkCompany aims to alleviate the non-biological pains of your "monthly visitor." 

 

Being a regular woman, I have the occasional mood swing during my time of the month and nagging significant others, roommates, and family members can exacerbate the issue. I wanted to create something that would make girls feels good during their period, rather than add to the struggle. So I came up with PinkCompany. 

 

PinkCompany is a monthly subscription that sends customers feminine products and personal wipes. Most importantly, these gifts will also INCLUDE AND NOT LIMITED TO comfort items such as healthy recipes, fun facts, chocolate, tech friendly items, vouchers to local businesses, cookies and more! The packages will be timed to align with the woman's monthly schedule to give her something to look forward to during that unfortunate week. 

 

All gifts will be related to the woman's predetermined interests. For example, if the woman is a dog lover, she would receive pet friendly items. Other items might range from gift cards, baby items, or coupons to small businesses. 

 

The mission of PinkCompany is to make women feel their best during their periods and to make women's lives just a little easier. 

 

Please consider funding my new endeavor. Any donation helps get this idea off the ground! 

 

Yours, 

Michelle
