story:
Super Adobe construction is helping to provide emergency and permanent affordable housing to people all over the world, including the United States!
Help us build an adobe dome! Sustainable Life Foundation wants to teach people how to build their own life wherever they want. We are raising money to get the equipment to hold workshops and show people how to build their own domes with only a few people!
The dome on this property will improve the experience at our workshops and gatherings by offering constant refrigeration and a place to store our valuable equipment when it's not being used safely out of the sun! We will be building a power system in this dome and have internet installed so that we can broadcast and communicate from the property anytime! The dome will be fire proof and earthquake proof and a great emergency shelter as well.

The Impact

Completion of these projects will get us closer to making a real difference in people's lives. It often surprises us the impression that people have about technology and what is possible in this age. We want to show people that there are more options out there than you think and that there are ways to use alternative power, building and other living technologies on a low budget. We strive for interested parties to ask us to do projects on their property and we are always looking for qualified volunteers to do these projects. Each time we complete a project we have a real life example to show others what other options there are out there. Join us in helping!

These domes will give people a solid example of a real world day to solve our housing issues both sustainably and reasonably with little cost! Help us to realize this goal. After building this dome we will have enough sand bag roll for three more domes and  all the equipment needed to build more adobe structures besides just these sand bag domes.


Who We Are

Sustainable Life Foundation is a non-profit corporation and was founded in 2011 to help regular people learn to thrive in sustainable ways on remote properties. It is hard for people to survive these days. We strive to teach people that there are all kinds of options for life and that we can live sustainably, responsibly and be a benefit to our world rather than a burden. Not only that we believe we can do it and thrive.

These basic facilities will allow us to continue into a deeper level of research than ever before. We will be able to do long periods of research on the property and our researchers will be able to stay comfortable. The desert winds and sun can be very harsh and we want to be there learning new methods to live and survive!

Unfortunately the property has been robbed several times by desert scavengers. Part of our current projects to secure the property include building a safe storage place for electronics and supplies.


Our Plan

Phase One : Build Dome - “The Power Dome,” is a 12 ft diameter adobe dome with 14 inch thick walls made out of solid fireproof earthquake proof “SuperAdobe” method taught by Cal Earth (calearth.org). Using 18 inch sand bags we have created a base about 4 inch deep in the soil already on Area 51 (see photo below). This circular base was filled with a 10% cement 90% earth mixture. We mix the adobe a little drier than concrete and fill the bag as we lay it in the path.

Continuing this method, we plan to continue to add layers of filled sandbag and build a tall dome where we will be protected from the sun and be able to lock up and protect our power system and expensive equipment that needs to stay out of the sun. This power system will power cooling and communication systems making our research area more livable for the researcher.

We will also build a metal security door into the framing of the dome and dead bolt it. With PVC (6” and 4”) we will form ventilation tubes and pathways to run solar, wind, and generator power into a battery bank which will be kept safe and cool inside the dome. We will install an industrial freezer and a small refrigerator in the dome and a internet modem and router inside the dome and we will install a satellite for internet access on the dome and cameras on the property to provide a constant video feed and security system to prevent theft and trespassing on the property. There will also be leftover space in the dome to secure limited equipment if we are going to be away from the property.
In the future we will build more complex domes at our research facility and other properties who need a reliable sustainable building. This building uses 90% the soil from our land making it highly cost efficient!


What We Need & What You Get

Equipment Needed:

Trailer (2000lb+) ($700)
Pickle Barrels x4 ($23)
Cement Mixer ($200)
Wheel Barrow x2 ($100)
Ladder ($150)
Tampers x3 ($40)
Shovels x4 ($40)
Buckets x5 ($5)
Pullies ($50)
Water tank ($150)

Total for Equipment: $1727

in equipment needed to do project. We will also need the following materials to complete the first dome. 


Materials Needed:

2000lbs Concrete (50 50lb bags @ $6.00 = $300)
Solid Metal Security Door and Frame ($500)
Deadbolt and DoorKnob ($50)
PVC 6” ($20)
PVC 4” ($10)
Sand Bag Roll ($900) - This roll will give us enough material to build four of these domes
Roll of Barbed Wire ($100)
Gas and Volunteer Meals ($400)
Total Materials and Supplies Needed for Project Phase One = $2280


Total Needed to Complete Phase One $4007

For those who donate we will be offering copies of our research project logs and videos and pictures. We will also build custom gifts each project for large contributors. We will also be offering free attendance of our educational workshops.
Special contributors have the option of receiving pickles, a solar oven or their own dome!

If we don't reach our entire goal it's ok. We will get whatever we can done this year and do more next time. This research facility is a work in progress and there are years of activities planned.  Our first goal here is to get this equipment together and build the first example dome. Not only will this equipment allow us to build our first dome but we can do landscaping and build many types of adobe structures like Straw Bale Construction and even custom adobe projects like the Dinoshauer Rex! We will be building adobe construction one many of the properties our members give us access to and we are also reaching out to those in need. We would like everyone to have safe affordable shelters and Adobe Construction is great for that purpose.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate please tell everyone about us. You can also join in our volunteer projects or even join as a member. Go to sustainablelifefoundation.org for more information.
Super Adobe construction is helping to provide emergency and permanent affordable housing to people all over the world, including the United States!

Thank You!

story:
"Deaths from Alzheimer’s increased 68% between 2000 and 2010, while deaths from other major diseases decreased." alzheimers.net


My name is Stathy, founder of the Detach™ brand. 3 years ago when my Father was diagnosed with Alzheimers it was a very sad day for myself and my family. Although I had friends who had experienced first hand this dreadful disease, I never realized just how bad it impacts ones life. It wasn't easy for me to watch my Father deteriorate over time. It also wasn't easy for me to know that although he was physically healthy for his age, a stressful life had only accelerated and worsened his condition. Since his recent passing I've vowed to do my part to raise awareness on preventing and reducing the impact of this disease. A key part of this awareness is supporting an overall healthy lifestyle. Not physically healthy but an overall balance which includes your body, mind and soul.
This campaign will raise funds to increase awareness of Alzheimers and preventative measures, directly sponsor local events on June 20th (The Longest Day) and directly contribute to the Alzheimers Association.

What is    ?

Detach™ at the core is a drive for a more healthy and sustainable lifestyle. It is not just about being physically healthy but being healthy in your heart, mind, body and soul with no-compromises! The Detach™ brand will start with an all organic beverage line with functional benefits for a wide variety of athletic endeavors. A portion of all profits from the beverage brand will be donated to charity.

Today, your contribution will help bootstrap our campaign against Alzheimers. A part of this campaign will include athleisure (clothing) products representing your desire to also support Alzheimers awareness and a more healthy lifestyle. In addition, Detach will sponsor several events in the upcoming year related to Alzheimers and a healthy lifestyle. On "The Longest Day", the Alzheimers awareness day we will sponsor several events in the local Bay Area advocating life, health and the fight against Alzheimers.

So you know your support for this campaign goes directly to helping a great movement and supporting key charitable events as well.

What We Need & What You Get

The $15k goal is an amount to be used to create an athleisure line that will help raise awareness against Alzheimers and support key events over the next year.

More specifically the funds will be used to:

  • Exclusive and early access perks for you! --> Custom Alzheimers awareness athleisure wear.
  • Sponsoring events on June 20th, The Longest Day to raise awareness and fight Alzheimers.
  • Local events sponsoring Alzheimers awareness and healthy living.
  • Direct contribution to Alzheimers Association to help research a cure and improve life dealing with Alzheimers.
  • Early access to Detach™ product, subscription discounts and using your purchases to support ongoing contributions to charities.

The Impact

  • Fight Alzheimers.
  • Fight causes and accelerators of Alzheimers.
  • Promote preventative measures to Alzheimers and negative effects of it.
  • Be a better human :)

Risks & Challenges

  • Perk - Thank You!
    None!     Good Karma which Last we checked this was only a great thing :)

  • Perk - Thank You & Exec Producer:
    Launch Issues & Delays:     There are always inherit risks to launching a food product especially delays and such. Good thing is we'll already have launched the beverage this Summer and be well underway to distributing. To mitigate any risk the funds for this specific perk will be reserved in a special account only used for launching this perk. If for whatever the worst case scenario is met and we can't launch the attribution flavors we will refund our Exec Producers.

  • Perk - Others
    Timing Issues    : There are always risks with shipping delays and clothing production. Fortunately, there should be enough runway to get the products out well in advance of June 20th. Fortunately there are also events throughout the year that you can use to show off your support!

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Participate on The Longest Day -----> Join Longest Day Team

  • 'Like' us on OUR Facebook Event! ----->  Detach - Longest Day Event

  • ADVOCATE. Get involved with one of the many organizations working to end Alzheimers.

  • Share this page to other media channels using hashtag #fkalz ----> Facebook or use links on left column of page.

  • Visit www.drink-detach.com , a portion of all proceeds will go to charity so sign-up for exclusive early access and help spread the word!

Q&A

1) When will the rewards become available / be shipped? The majority of athleisure (sports apparel) will be available before June 20th 2016. Custom commemorative product naming and labels will be slated for the 2017 solstice and Longest Day event.

2) How do I give you my details and preferences (like shirt size)? Once the project has ended, we will email you a survey to ask for all the info we need to make sure you get your perk. That’s when you can give us details like shipping address, and your preferences. We expect to get the survey out to you immediately following the end of the campaign, and we need all of your details by May 13th.

3) What if my address changes? If you move before the perks are shipped out, get in touch with us via your Indiegogo account as soon as you can and we'll do our best to accommodate the change.

4) What if the perk I want it sold out? If a perk is sold out, it's sold out. Sorry! If you miss out, we’ll be adding a few more awesome perks throughout the month, so make sure to follow the campaign and keep checking back often!

5) Can I change my perk? If you decide you’d like to change or upgrade your perk to another one, get in touch with us via the campaign and we’ll see if we can help you out. Or follow this link for instructions: https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles...

6) Can I claim more than one perk? Each contribution made is recorded as a separate contribution with a separate perk. So, if one awesome perk is not enough for you, all you have to do is make separate transactions for as many separate perks as you want!

7) What if I want to pledge/make a contribution for a friend or family member? You make your pledge or contribution out to anyone you want! At the end of the campaign we will send out a survey to collect the information we need to fulfill your perks. In that survey you will be able to specify a name and address for the perks to be made out to.

8) How do I know if my contribution has been successful? If your contribution is successful, an automatic confirmation email will be sent to the email address you provided during the contribution process.

9) I tried to make a contribution but it was unsuccessful. There are a few reasons why your contribution may not have gone through. Check out a list of common contribution errors for a possible solution. If you don’t see your problem there, let us know and we’ll see if we can figure it out.

10) You spelled something wrong / had the wrong link / made a mistake on detail. Thank you! It really does ‘take a village’ to run a campaign like this. Please get in touch with us to let us know about our mistake and help us improve the campaign!

11) I posted a question to the campaign. Will I get a response? We get many questions every day and have some wonderful people monitoring them! You can be sure someone will read your question, and will try to answer as soon as possible. Even if you don’t get a response, please know someone is manning the pumps, and your concern or question is being considered by our team.

12) What is the campaign currency? We are raising all of our funds in USD.

13) How will you use my contact information? We will only use your personal information to contact you for the survey, provide your perk and any of the items or services you've requested, respond to any inquiries from you, to keep you updated on the progress of our Indiegogo campaign and the Detach™ brands updates.

14) Do you get my email address? We do not get any of your contact information until the campaign is completed. During the campaign, we can only contact you through the Indiegogo page itself, and Indiegogo does not give us your address. When the campaign is completed, we are able to get from Indiegogo the email addresses our Backers have provided to Indiegogo.​ We value your privacy, and we will not share any of our Backer’s email addresses with any other party except as needed to fulfill your perk. We will only use the personal information you provide to contact you for the survey, provide your perk and any of the items or services you have requested (including providing subscription access to and updates from the page), respond to any inquiries from you, and to keep you updated on the progress of our Indiegogo campaign and the Detach™ brands updates.

15) I want an AddOn Perk and another Perk. That's easy! You just have to make a separate purchase because indiegogo won't allow you to buy more than one perk per purchase.

3) What if my address changes? If you move before the perks are shipped out, get in touch with us via your Indiegogo account as soon as you can and we'll do our best to accommodate the change.



4) What if the perk I want it sold out? If a perk is sold out, it's sold out. Sorry! If you miss out, we’ll be adding a few more awesome perks throughout the month, so make sure to follow the campaign and keep checking back often!



5) Can I change my perk? If you decide you’d like to change or upgrade your perk to another one, get in touch with us via the campaign and we’ll see if we can help you out. Or follow this link for instructions: https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles...



6) Can I claim more than one perk? Each contribution made is recorded as a separate contribution with a separate perk. So, if one awesome perk is not enough for you, all you have to do is make separate transactions for as many separate perks as you want!



7) What if I want to pledge/make a contribution for a friend or family member? You make your pledge or contribution out to anyone you want! At the end of the campaign we will send out a survey to collect the information we need to fulfill your perks. In that survey you will be able to specify a name and address for the perks to be made out to.



8) How do I know if my contribution has been successful? If your contribution is successful, an automatic confirmation email will be sent to the email address you provided during the contribution process.



9) I tried to make a contribution but it was unsuccessful. There are a few reasons why your contribution may not have gone through. Check out a list of common contribution errors for a possible solution. If you don’t see your problem there, let us know and we’ll see if we can figure it out.



10) You spelled something wrong / had the wrong link / made a mistake on detail. Thank you! It really does ‘take a village’ to run a campaign like this. Please get in touch with us to let us know about our mistake and help us improve the campaign!



11) I posted a question to the campaign. Will I get a response? We get many questions every day and have some wonderful people monitoring them! You can be sure someone will read your question, and will try to answer as soon as possible. Even if you don’t get a response, please know someone is manning the pumps, and your concern or question is being considered by our team.



12) What is the campaign currency? We are raising all of our funds in USD.



13) How will you use my contact information? We will only use your personal information to contact you for the survey, provide your perk and any of the items or services you've requested, respond to any inquiries from you, to keep you updated on the progress of our Indiegogo campaign and the Detach™ brands updates.



14) Do you get my email address? We do not get any of your contact information until the campaign is completed. During the campaign, we can only contact you through the Indiegogo page itself, and Indiegogo does not give us your address. When the campaign is completed, we are able to get from Indiegogo the email addresses our Backers have provided to Indiegogo.​ We value your privacy, and we will not share any of our Backer’s email addresses with any other party except as needed to fulfill your perk. We will only use the personal information you provide to contact you for the survey, provide your perk and any of the items or services you have requested (including providing subscription access to and updates from the page), respond to any inquiries from you, and to keep you updated on the progress of our Indiegogo campaign and the Detach™ brands updates.




15) I want an AddOn Perk and another Perk. That's easy! You just have to make a separate purchase because indiegogo won't allow you to buy more than one perk per purchase.

story:
Welcome to Finger Lakes Foie.  

We aim to produce the finest 

goose products from happy geese, 

using Permaculture strategies and principles

 on a diversified farm.


The Finger Lakes Foie Mission

  • To produce the best goose products, through the most humane means.  
  • To keep alive the tradition of raising and eating geese.
  • To produce high quality Foie Gras without force-feeding using Permaculture principles and strategies. 
  • To nurture healthy and happy geese as part of a resilient and diversified farm, producing geese, pigs, fruits, nuts, and more.  
  • To create a happy and healthy work environment for myself and my employees.
  • To create living-wage jobs.
  • To encourage local production of quality meats.
  • To complement the already established food and wine industry in the Finger Lakes.
  • To establish a new local industry that can grow to include many farms raising geese to be sold under the Finger Lakes Foie brand.

                


Our Products

Pasture raised goose meat and traditional goose products, including:
  • Foie Gras 
  • Confit of Foie Gras 
  • Confit of goose leg/thigh 
  • Pâtés
  • Breasts 
  • Sausage
  • Whole Geese

Our Method

The most ethical way of producing Foie, is also the most ecologically sound, and delicious.  

We use no antibiotics or hormones in our feed, no pesticides or herbicides in our pasture.  Our geese are provided with ample pasture, protection from predators, locally sourced grain, and clean water.  Geese eat mostly grasses and clover, making them ideally suited to pasture.  Slow-growing geese are harvested in summer.

When the weather gets cold, they begin eating heavily, fattening themselves before harvest.   Over time our fruit and nut trees will mature, reducing the need for grain in the fall and enhancing the quality of our goose products.  Pigs are rotated through the pastures before the geese, creating lush pastures, an ideal environment for geese.  The combination of geese and pigs rotating on pasture builds topsoil and fertility year after year.    

Roaming Root's pigs at Lausell Farms 


Pigs were rotated through part of the pasture in 2014 with very positive results.  The picture below shows what the ground looked like before pigs did their work and after.


The Impact

Increased access to gourmet goose products produced in the U.S.A.

Your contributions encourage the shift to sustainable local 

economies and ethical farming practices.  

You'll help create jobs, and increase access to ethical and 

environmentally conscious food grown near you.  


Long Term Vision

Finger Lakes Foie will supply fine goose products to consumers in New York State.  Our fruit and nut plantings will grow in the year's to come, increasing sustainability, product quality, and profits, while transforming the landscape into mixed orchard and pasture.  The topsoil will accumulate every year as the pigs and geese do their work.  As our pasture and methods improve Foie production will increase.  When sales reach a high enough level we'll build a usda approved processing facility allowing for expansion to new pastures and more living-wage jobs in the community.


What We Need

  • $25,000 to establish infrastructure and fund the first season.
  • Funding will go towards a predator-proof goose shelter that can house 300 geese, movable electric fencing system, goslings, a solar water pump sytem, water storage tanks, feed, vital tools, slaughtering and processing equipment and processing labor cost. Contact me if you want to contribute used equipment or materials. I have a full list of needed items. 
  • Your contributions will go towards the production of healthy, high quality poultry, produced from pampered geese raised in an environment that they thrive in.  Your contributions increase the food security of the Finger Lakes by producing food locally.  
  • With full funding to raise 150 geese, it is a sustainable business that can use it's earnings to grow next year.  The land can support 400+ geese, but 100 was the best place to start as it has enough scale to sustain itself,  and allows us to get started, refine our techniques and expand to 300+ geese next year.
  • Exceeding our goal will allow for increased fruit and nut tree planting and a permanent structure for processing and storage.
  • If I don't meet my goal, I can scale back and grow from there.

Other Ways You Can Help


  • Volunteer, meet the geese and learn about the process.
  • Contributing equipment, materials, or labor.
  • Eat goose for the holidays.
  • Get the word out, tell your friends, tell your neighbors.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools.

Risks and Challenges

Predator pressure is a concern, there are coyotes in the area.

  • A well constructed goose shelter will protect the geese while they sleep.
  • Electric fencing deters predators day and night.
  • Large flock and bird size intimidates smaller predators like foxes.
  • Extra protection from birds of prey with net covered area for young goslings.

We need to develop a certified recipe for the confit products

  • Cornell and Syracuse University both offer many helpful resources to help small producers like Finger Lakes Foie.

At present, we cannot sell across state lines.  

  • For now I can sell to hotels, restaurants, institutions, and individuals in NYS under the small poultry producers exemption.
  • In the future we will add a small usda approved processing facility and meat locker onsite, allowing for interstate sales, faster processing, a second flock at another location, more living-wage jobs, and providing poultry processing access and meat storage to the small producers in the area.

Bio

My name is Ian Lausell, I live in the beautiful town of Cayutaville, NY.  At the age of 15 I had the opportunity to travel to the south of France with my father in search of our family roots.  We were in a rural area where goose and duck products were plentiful.  My initial hesitation at eating something new was wiped away by my first taste of Foie Gras, then the confit of goose leg and thigh blew my mind again, I immediately had a new favorite meat.  We also ate potatoes fried in goose fat which put our french fries to shame.  I returned with a newfound love of geese and the products made from them.  In 2008 I took a design course with Finger Lakes Permaculture and later purchased 16 acres of forest and field in Cayutaville.  I worked food related jobs from farm to market to kitchen to table.  When I learned about Pateria de Sousa in Spain and their ability to produce the finest Foie without force-feeding, all the pieces finally fit together.  I can't wait to bring these delicious products to you and share the experience of gourmet goose products in the Finger Lakes. 

   

Chateau Laussel and the Venus of Laussel found in a paleolithic cave beneath the chateau in the Dordogne valley, Perigord, France.


External Links

Articles and Videos

  • Edible Finger Lakes' article about us.
  • Article in Swide about ethical Foie
  • Consider the Goose
  • Livestock Conservancy Toulouse Goose 
  • The Farmer Who Makes Ethical Foie Gras 
  • Eduardo Sousa explains his method
  • Dan Barber: A surprising Foie Gras Parable
Established food related businesses in the Region:

  • Autumn's Harvest
  • Blue Heron Farm
  • Cayuga Pure Organics
  • Farmer Ground Flour
  • Full Plate Collective
  • Good Life Farm
  • High Point Farms
  • Muddy Fingers Farm
  • Ploughbreak Farm
  • Potenza Organics
  • Six Circles
  • Spice of Life
  • Stick and Stone Farm
  • Sweet Land Farm
  • The Piggery
  • West Haven Farm
  • Wide Awake Bakery
Restaurants in the area
  • Stonecat Cafe
  • Hazelnut Kitchen
  • Red Newt Bistro
  • Le Café Cent-Dix
  • The Heights
  • Fine Line Bistro
  • Madelines
  • Coltivare
  • Maxie's Supper Club
  • The Bistro at La Tourelle
  • Mia's Restaurant

Thank you

story:
Short Summary

 As recent transplants from Reading, PA aka "Pretzel Capitol of the World"  the search was on for a true Philly style soft pretzel here in the Old Pueblo. Sad to say between the mediocre frozen pretzels, like those at sporting events and on some food carts, and the dreaded mall pretzel, we didn't find what our tastebuds were accustomed to and craving. So, what to do? "Bake your own she said!"

 After a year and a half of improving upon the old recipe we have nailed it. Our authentic Philly soft pretzels are baked right here in Tucson by a Pennsylvania Dutch baker using only the finest 100% natural ingredients and the traditional German Natronlauge method which produces the signature golden tan crispy shell and a soft chewy inside with a barley malt/caramel finish topped with pretzel salt. There is no butter, sugar, eggs or HFCS in our vegan pretzels.  Currently we sell at local farmers markets and with a constant increase of a loyal customer base this has caused us to outgrow our home based business.

 With over 900 food trucks in Tucson, and not a one selling "fresh baked from scratch right out of the oven" hand rolled & twisted soft pretzels, we have concluded that there is a desire for our healthy treat during this revolution. We will bake our authentic Philly pretzels right on the spot for any event, fundraiser, corporate outing or private party. Our menu will include fresh premium meat sandwiches on our healthy pretzel buns and hopefully in the near future, home-brewed PA Dutch Root Beer! Also keep an eye out for our "Crabby Pretzel" -a soft pretzel topped with crab meat with a secret spice recipe finished with pepper jack cheese.  "Tucson Twist" -soft pretzel served with our signature dipping sauces consisting of real cheddar cheese sauce, and a variety of mustards. And our "Hot Knots!" -just the knots baked with Hatch Chile Peppers and chopped garlic.

 Watching the faces of the little ones as they taste their first real soft pretzel is truly satisfying. Our memories of growing up in a town without a pretzel shortage is a good one and we hope to make the memories of you and your children pleasant ones for a long time to come!

 With your contribution you will be helping more people experience the wholehearted, good old world tradition of the artisan bread that is the soft pretzel. 

 Please visit our website to learn more about us and why you would want to help fund our food trailer/truck. www.oldpueblopretzels.com 

What We Need & What You Get

 Truck and/or trailer with equipment. As can be expected by our unique business of baking fresh on site there is a nonexistent supply of food trucks which meet our baking specifications. We do not have the need for deep fryers or other related appliances found on most trucks, also most layouts will call for a total remodel. We feel this is a waste of money and would like to start from the ground up. We have a reputable dealer of new/used equipment and will utilize their service as much as possible. We hope to purchase a 8.5'x14' dual axel trailer or 14' box truck. 

 Our kitchen will consist of a dough mixer & pretzel warmers which we currently own. Propane oven and tanks for baking. Gas burner for dipping solution of pretzels. Full hood over cooking area with Ansul fire extinguishers. Snack oven for melting cheese on sandwiches. Electric hot dog roller. Sandwich making station. Refrigeration and freezer unit. Rooftop AC/Heating unit. Bakers rack and proofing boards. Stainless steel three bay sink with hand washing basin along with fresh and gray water tanks. Hot water on demand with a 110v pump. Stainless steel prep and serving areas.  RV generator. All appropriate lighting/electrical outlets with 50 amp panel and life line. City water connection fresh water spigot. 4x6' Concession window with drop down serving tray. Cabinets where needed. Awning to keep customers shaded on our hot days. Full graphic logo wrap. 

 If we meet our goal with funding all monies will go towards the designing of trailer/truck and to health department inspections and permits. If we do not meet our goal we will make improvements to our home based bakery (new oven) and continue with possibly a smaller cart in hopes to still have a great start to continue on towards our goal of a trailer/truck.

     

The Impact

We know our pretzels! 

 Old Pueblo Pretzels can't express enough our passion for soft pretzels along with a healthy lifestyle. Bread is and always will be a staple in most everyones diet. We just happen to have a different recipe to offer those who have grown tired of the norm here in the desert. On the East Coast we eat pretzels like others eat bagels and donuts for breakfast, so much so that we love to eat them anytime of the day or night. We love our pretzels and we know you will come to love them as much as we do! There's nothing like a fresh baked hot soft pretzel.

 Our loyal growing customer base can attest to the authenticity of our Philly pretzels. And now you can help spread the word here in Tucson as we offer people a delicious choice when it comes time to healthy snacks.

Risks & Challenges

The obvious challenges are the hoops you're made to jump through by the local city government but all of our research and experience along with our attorney should make this an easy process. Coming from a family full of restaurant and other business owners we have complete faith in our endeavor. 

 All perks will be settled after a 15 day waiting period at the end of the campaign so we can bake accordingly. Any "William Penn Perks" will be settled after we take delivery of the trailer. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute monetarily? No worries, just help us spread the word about our delicious pretzels and campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Help a Creative Community in Cobargo NSW to Grow!

Cobargo in Danger of Abandonment?

Over the past hundred years or so, small towns in rural Australia have been victims of the same advances in transportation, technology and agricultural methods that have brought growth and prosperity to population centres and large farms. As the small farms and graziers suffered, so did the people in the towns and villages who supported them.             

In years past, the far south coast NSW village of Cobargo was a thriving place. Farmers, graziers and their families came to town to buy necessities, to see a blacksmith about repairs, to attend church services or to send off a letter from the new Post Office.  Their children attended the local public school. Dairy products from the town's buttery made their way to Sydney. Local foresters harvested black wattle bark for tanneries up the coast to Sydney and all the way down to Melbourne.                                                             

However, time and progress changed things, and Cobargo at the start of the 21st Century was not the thriving and bustling little town that it had been at the beginning of the previous century.  From the 1980s, extensive periods of drought and the efforts of successive governments to overhaul and modernise the dairy, fishing and forestry industries have combined to test our collective community mettle - economically, socially and philosophically. Like many Bega Valley towns scarred by the contraction in these industries, Cobargo's cultural identity was battered; its social and economic fabric was sorely tried. 

To address the community outcry, governments trumpeted and liberally prescribed Tourism as a panacea for all towns and villages similarly affected by industry realignment and residents were encouraged to reinvent themselves, their livelihoods and their place in order to benefit by tapping into this lucrative income stream. 

But, despite the village's rural charms and the villagers' best efforts, convincing the many tourists who pass through Cobargo, on their way to popular holiday destinations like Bermagui, Tathra, Merimbula, Pambula and Eden, to stop and spend time in the village was difficult.

Cobargo Creators and the Cobargo Creators Centre to the Rescue!

What to do? Well . . . one local, Suzy McKinnon, had an idea. And, if it worked, it might have enough of a positive impact to improve the well-being of the townsfolk and secure the very future of Cobargo itself!

Suzi thought it would be wonderful to create a community association based on creativity, with the first project to be a gallery (in one of the vacant storefronts in town) to showcase the amazing creative skills and talents of townsfolk and other nearby residents. A successful gallery would attract tourists and other passing traffic and provide additional income for local participants.  Of course, the merit of Suzy's idea would be for naught unless the creators in the local area embraced the endeavour.

And many did. There was Suzy, of course, who brought her skills as an innovator and long term experience as a community organiser, along with paintings, textiles, cards and more; Anne Wilson brought her experience with Transition Towns as well as restored furniture and jewellery; Sarah Gardiner brought her writing skills, local knowledge and cows and Richard Lambert brought his administrative nous and stunning photographs. 

With the nucleus of a management committee in place and goals agreed, The Creative Workers & Producers Association of Cobargo (in short, The Cobargo Creators) was born and a new creative vigour came to the town and neighbouring areas. 

The Impact

In the three years since, the Cobargo Creators membership base has grown from the dozen or so founding members to over 100 creators who regularly show (and sell!) their creations in the various spaces known collectively as the Cobargo Creators Centre. In the Centre, the showcase space - Black Wattle Gallery – and Wares Gifts are chock full of amazing artworks and handcrafted household treasures made by its members.

The Association supports young artists with the Sapling Gallery space, also part of the Centre, facilitates a calendar of workshops with various renowned local creators and hosts; rolling 'Feature Artist' exhibitions in the gallery for all interested members and supports all creative ventures in the region by providing information, advice and a communication network As well as an exhibition and display space the Centre is a community space and is available to be used for other purposes, such as performances, poetry readings, launches etc., by arrangement.

To see what's current and what has been created over the past few years visit our Facebook page (https://www.facebook.com/CobargoCreators) . 

Our plans for tomorrow ... with your help!

As we celebrate Cobargo Creators' 3rd birthday and reminisce about where we started and how far we've come, we are also focused on where the Association is heading and what we would like to achieve in the future.

In the short term, we would like to assist young and other local community members to explore and refine their skills by funding workshop places for those who would otherwise not be able to attend.  In the longer term, we would like to be able to support an 'artist in residence' type of program, offer workshops to creators who want to develop their business skills in order to make their art their work, and sponsor awards and scholarships at the local schools and the universities nearest our region.

And this is where YOU come in! Cobargo Creators could use an 'administrative cushion' and would really appreciate your help with creating it.  Having this cushion will ensure we can continue to provide all the opportunities and benefits currently available, develop and make real our big ideas and make sure we continue to get through the dry times by being cushioned against increases in rent, insurance, electricity and other always-rising costs.

We're not looking for a huge pile of money--our goal is just $2450!-- surely you can help us out with a donation of a dollar, or five, or ten?

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't or don't wish to donate money, you can still help us by getting the word out about our campaign.  You could: tell your family and friends, provide a link to our campaign on your blog or Facebook page, and send out a Tweet, a text or an email. 

If you live in our area, drop by and see us and let us know you found us on Indiegogo. If you're a local and like to carve (wood or stone, not roasts) or paint, knit (or create with any of a thousand other things) come in and join up and bring a few things for the gallery.

Or, just come on in and say hello and delight in the creativity of the people who live in our little piece of creative paradise.
story_txt:
Help a Creative Community
in Cobargo NSW to Grow!

Cobargo in Danger of Abandonment?
Over the past hundred years or so, small towns in
rural Australia have been victims of the same advances in transportation,
technology and agricultural methods that have brought growth and prosperity to
population centres and large farms. As the small farms and graziers suffered,
so did the people in the towns and villages who supported them. 
           
In years past, the far south coast NSW village of Cobargo
was a thriving place. Farmers, graziers and their families came to town to buy
necessities, to see a blacksmith about repairs, to attend church services or to
send off a letter from the new Post Office. 
Their children attended the local public school. Dairy products from the
town's buttery made their way to Sydney. Local foresters harvested black wattle
bark for tanneries up the coast to Sydney and all the way down to
Melbourne.             
                   
                     
     
However, time and progress changed things, and
Cobargo at the start of the 21st Century was not the thriving and bustling
little town that it had been at the beginning of the previous century.  From

story:
Short Summary


I, am the Hon. Neville ORiley Livingston OJ, CD pka Bunny Wailer. I am the founding and surviving member of THE WAILERS, also consisting of the Late Hon. Robert Nesta 'Bob' Marley O.M. and the Hon. Winston Hubert McIntosh O.M. pka Peter Tosh.



The historic 'Ganja Bill' was passed into Law in Jamaica , April 15th, 2015. The Rastafari Community has been campaigning for many decades for the recognition of our culture, belief and faith.  This means also the recognition of the Rastafari Sacrament globally, this to include the ceremonial and spiritual medicinal and therapeutic use of Ganja.

THE TIME IS RIGHT - As social awareness of our faith and the Rastafari culture as a whole has advanced, so has the global understanding of the use of Ganja as part of our Sacrament.

THE WAILERS have established Rastafari and Ganja as a Sacrament and are Ambassadors for Legalization Nationally and Internationally.


 The effort is starting to produce results, and we are almost there.  However there are some serious final hurdles legal hurdles to achieve Equal Rights & Justice as we were equally warned by American President Barack Obama who made a historic visit to Jamaica on April 7th, 2015, that we have to protect our socio-economic rights from Big Business.
With the passage of the Ganja Bill in Jamaica historically recognizing our Sacramental Rights in national law, we are now in a position to take the next steps nationally and internationally.


Before the Rastafari Faith is effectively whipped out by opportunistic Ganja Business Interests, it is essential to achieve socio-economic justice for Rastafari all over the World.  The 'Legalize It!' Campaign starts from the Jamaican people who have been persecuted for over 100 Years for defending the Human Rights of their culture and beliefs, as the perfect place to set the standard.

Earlier in my life, I served 18 months imprisonment in 1967 for being in THE WAILERS rehearsal yard in Trench Town, now a heritage site, where Ganja is regularly used in creating the music and messages of Rastafari Faith.  I was still forced to serve this sentence, even though the case was withdrawn for lack of evidence of my involvement.  I was sentenced by prejudiced individuals and not the Law.  This has to be corrected!  I was only able to confirm what I knew as I later toured as Bunny Wailer and challenged by Custom authorities and all of this for practicing my faith and this great Reggae Music.  With the Ganja Bill passage there is a 'Public Smoking' Cigarette Law that has been imposed on Ganja Smokers that has created a new form of criminalization.

Throughout the Rastafari Reggae world I am often asked by people, what they can do to help the 'Legalize It!' cause.  I, nor Peter Tosh's label, Intel Diplo Enterprises, have ever asked for help, as the time was never as right as it is now.  Now Is The Time!
Richard Branson, CEO of Virgin Enterprises and one of the Global Leaders leading the charge for Global Change in Drug Policy at the United Nations General Assembly Special Session in 2016, has spoken of the seminal role Peter Tosh played in his life and his current positions. http://www.virgin.com/richard-branson/cannabis-regulation-in-jamaica-and-alaska#LegalizeIt

'The Voice Of The People' supported by those who have been inspired personally and economically by and through Reggae Music for the past 50 Years is now needed to help in the funding of this campaign.   
 

For Jamaica this can only be achieved through global public support for proper Policy development in Jamaica where a history of abuse of Rastafari has resulted in deep engrained prejudices and where the Commercial branding deals are already capitalizing on the sacrifice of all the Rastafari Community.  All for just personal gain without returning anything to the Community, plainly being in contradiction with the Faith they used to gain value.  The Rastafari Sacramental Rights In The 'Ganja Bill' does not give any Economic Rights to the Rastafari Faith!

What We Need & What You Get

I, Bunny Wailer, have personally funded and supported Legalize It! Ganja Campaigns in Jamaica since the first Ganja March in the world in 1996 up to the latest Ganja March and Rally in Trench Town on April 20th, 2014 in Kingston and will be staging the first Global Ganja March in Jamaica on May 2nd, 2015. The Peter Tosh Estate has collaborated with GreenPeace and Amnesty International to support Legalize It Campaigns globally.  This is your chance to join us all in this massively important task to save all aspects of Rastafarian culture.

Such is the injustice suffered and continuing prejudice to date, that we have to move mountains, as such the level of the funding request is important.  Being the first to take part in raising funds, is your chance to participate directly and impact this matter, for which I and all the Rastafari Community all over the World will thank you in advance.

Establishing the Rastafari Right is a national and international effort that requires exceptional legal representation, intellectual property registration, national and international community company registration, public education and community mobilization.

HOW WILL THE MONEY BE USED

All the money received will be dedicated to servicing the Rastafari Community and principally in securing all the relevant steps 

1.  WAILERS ONE LOVE 'Legalize It!" Campaign For The Protection Of Rastafari Culture And Rights In Ganja and Reggae.   Print, Media, Event Campaign From Trench Town To 5 other Major Urban and Rural Centers throughout Jamaica and through to the Jamaica Diaspora Communities in Miami, New York, Atlanta, London and the legalized states of Washington DC, Colorado, California, Toronto, to gain a people based national and international support for fair and proper regulatory framework in Jamaica. 

2. Securing Identified Lawyers, Strategy Consultants and a  Cultural Valuation Expert and provide for their work and accommodation here in Jamaica to shape a policy and business model that recognizes, strategizes, protects and monetizes Rastafari cultural and international brand value acknowledged as being in the billions. 

3. Support the Rastafari Millennium Council, the leading Rastafari umbrella group advocate for Intellectual Property and Socio-Economic Rights to the Government of Jamaica to develop Capacity, Ganja Seed Banks and Research and to register 25 specific Rastafari Ganja Intellectual Property Titles and Expressions To Drive Franchised National and International Community Business Development . 

4. Support and promote all aspects of the traditional Rastafari Culture and making sure all involved are contributing to the future of the Rastafari Culture to build a strong Union of stakeholder interests to to develop  fair preferential community based provisions for the Elders of the Rastafari Faith, licensing of cultivation facilities, extraction facilities, product manufacturing facilities, research facilities, and retail stores. 

5. Produce Content for Online TV & Radio,  Books, Documentaries, CD'S, APPS & Website required for all to know the actions taken and to be regularly updated.

THERE IS MORE - A BIG THANK YOU

The supporters of this campaign will receive various personalized Perks related to products and services from The Rastafari Community, The Wailers, Bunny Wailer, Peter Tosh and Rastafari Artisans.  All Funding Will Be Administered By The Rastafari Millennium Council Through Solomonic Productions.

The Impact

For the Rastafari Community, Jamaica is the most known country 'Organic State' in the world surrounding the cultural use and expression of Ganja/Cannabis/Marijuana through Rastafari Culture and Reggae Music.  Our Culture has been adopted by Indigenous Communities like the American First Nation Indians.  This has developed the largest international lifestyle industry that has not benefited Jamaica or Rastafari based on the poor human rights, intellectual property and legal rights regimes in Jamaica.  This poor socio-economic pattern must not be incorporated into the developing Ganja Industry.

WANT TO KNOW MORE - HERE IT IS!

As the sole survivor of The Wailers, I have been  defending the Rastafari Culture as a Nyahbinghi Elder for decades through activism and music and the Ganja Rights from I was a young boy, where my father 'Thaddeus Livingston' was a leading trader of Ganja in Western Kingston since the 1930's up to his passing in 1995.

The Legalization Of Ganja in Jamaica is under threat to not benefit the Rastafari Community, traditional farmer and tradesman and woman. This Campaign will favorable impact the Rastafari Community globally, where several international cases for Sacramental Rights are being waged particularly in South Africa.  It will also assist in the Franchising of the Rasta Ganja Brand and  Rastafari Indigenous Village Project as the business model of the Community.

Risks & Challenges

Picture this:  If they get their way, Rastafari who defend the REDEMPTION of all people, may have to carry 'identity cards' to be able to practice his or her Faith.  Jamaican traditional users will be legally forced to become sick, while tourists, hotels and health resorts will have special privileges, a kind of Ganja Apartheid! The risks and challenges is that the legalization of Ganja under medicinal and big business brands like 'Marley Natural'/Privateer Group  will severely impact the Rastafari Community, its philosophy and meaning.  False Narratives and Drug Policy Public Relations that have submerged the true history and value of the Ganja/Cannabis/Marijuana Plant are still being used to stall the development of the local Jamaican industry and to falsely and improperly induce the world consumers of Ganja.

The Rastafari Authenticity and Branding is a known value that is trading globally through festivals, lifestyle brands, tourism and alike.  It has become valuable based on its survival mechanisms against insurmountable odds and has become conversant with the new 'Green Economy' and 'Climate Change' standards of the Millennarian Consumer.  

Legalization of Ganja In Jamaica, properly designed intellectual property rights, can usher in  new social and economic policies around the world particularly in countries like South Africa and Brazil.

 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We have started this campaign for its public education value and funding platform to support proper policy development and fight against culturally appropriation and misuse. 

    People who cant contribute can share the knowledge that is also available on Ganjafutures.com,  Facebook sites as HonoRebel Neville Livingston, GanjaFutures Jamaica, Rastafari Millennium Council, to get the word out about this campaign and use the Indiegogo Share Tools.

story:
Qui sommes nous? 

L‘ association ISA en Inde signifie: informer, soigner, apprendre en Inde. Elle a été créée le 11 Août 2014 par deux étudiantes infirmières de l’IFSI CH d’Arras. 

Le but de ISA en Inde est de nous permettre d’effectuer une mission humanitaire à caractère infirmier dans ce pays dont les besoins dans le domaine de la santé sont critiques. 

 Les objectifs de cette association sont donc l’élaboration du projet étudiant de soin infirmier humanitaire, la récolte des fonds pour financer le projet ainsi que la promotion des actions de récolte de fonds liées au projet.


Ce dont nous avons besoin

Le montant total du projet s'élève à 4000€ ce qui comprend les frais d'inscription à l'association correspondante sur place, le logement, la nourriture, les vaccins, les frais de déplacement et le matériel.
Cette campagne Indiegogo a pour but de financer les 1000€ qui serviront à financer l'achat des billets d'avion.
On est super motivées mais le voyage jusqu'en Inde à pied ne nous tente pas trop =)
Si l'objectif n'était pas atteint, la somme collectée serait tout de même utilisée pour contribuer en partie à l'achat des billets. Un peu, c'est mieux que rien du tout ;)

Nos missions

Une projet de six semaines qui se déroulera sur 4 lieux différents:

  • Orphelinat hébergeant une soixantaine d’enfants.                                                    Nous y sensibiliseront les enfants et les bénévoles sur place sur l’hygiène et son importance. Nous accompagneront les enfants vers un mieux être physique et psychologique.
  • Une équipe mobile de soin.                                                                                              Nous participerons à la lutte contre la malnutrition, à la prévention de l’hygiène, à des campagnes de vaccination, à la promotion de l’éducation à la santé, la distribution de médicaments, la réalisation de soins de base, l’éducation des parents sur le paludisme et une éducation sur le SIDA.
  • Dans un dispensaire.                                                                                                             Lieu où les soins sont donnés gratuitement aux populations le plus démunis, nous y donnerons les premiers soins, effectueront le suivi des patients jusqu'au rétablissement. Sans ces dispensaires, il est évident que des milliers de personnes se retrouveraient sans aucun soin. Leurs existence est donc vitale. 
  • Un hôpital.                                                                                                                                Nous réaliserons des soins infirmiers de base, participerons à la prise en charge des patients et à la distribution des médicaments. Dans ce lieux, nous auront l'occasion d'observer d'autres techniques de soins et d'échanger nos savoirs avec le personnel soignant sur place pour un enrichissement des deux côtés.

Risques et défis

  • Challenge humain
  • Choc culturel

D'autres façons d'aider

Le plus important pour nous est de faire parler du projet. Plus il y a de personnes au courant et qui nous soutiennent, plus on aura de chance de le financer. Alors partagez, likez, parlez de nous autour de vous via:

  • Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/isainde

Nous acceptons également les dons par voie postale, déductible à 66% des impôts =)

  • ISA en Inde, 48 route de Bapaume apt 170 62217 Achicourt
story_txt:
Qui sommes nous? 







L‘ association ISA en Inde signifie: informer, soigner, apprendre en Inde. Elle a été créée le 11
Août 2014 par deux étudiantes infirmières de l’IFSI CH d’Arras. 
Le but de ISA en Inde est de nous permettre d’effectuer une mission humanitaire à caractère infirmier dans ce pays dont les besoins dans le domaine de la santé sont critiques. 
 Les objectifs
de cette association sont donc l’élaboration du projet étudiant de soin infirmier humanitaire, la récolte
des fonds pour financer le projet ainsi que la promotion des actions de récolte de fonds liées au projet.






Ce dont nous avons besoin
Le montant total du projet s'élève à 4000€ ce qui comprend les frais d'inscription à l'association correspondante sur place, le logement, la nourriture, les vaccins, les frais de déplacement et le matériel.

Challenge humain
Choc culturel



D'autres façons d'aider
Le plus important pour nous est de faire parler du projet. Plus il y a de personnes au courant et qui nous soutiennent, plus on aura de chance de le financer. Alors partagez, likez, parlez de nous autour de vous via:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/isainde


Nous acceptons également les dons par voie postale, déductible à 66% des impôts =)ISA en Inde, 48 route de Bapaume apt 170 62217 Achicourt

story:
THE VISION

Hello, my name is Bernd Zikulnig. I'm a 33 year old pilot, a former professional soldier, and I'm the founder of peacebucks - free money!

One day I thought: 
"If money is the reason for war, it is the solution for peace."
This was the exact moment when the idea of peacebucks was born.

Did you know that most wars are primarily conducted, or not conducted, because of financial interests of multi-billion dollar corporations? In contrast to that, the individual human life is nothing worth anymore. 

We're creating a new global currency that will narrow the gap between the financial elite and the world's population - we don't need war for economic growth, we need peacebucks.



"One world, one currency, one peace!"

WHAT IS PEACEBUCKS

It's a new online currency (PBS) using an independent payment system for money transfer through the internet worldwide. Use it to pay online or via mobile. It's easy, it's fast, it's safe! Even more, it's a vision of free money, basic income and peace. It's a unique game changer.

"Technically, it's similar to PayPal, but with its own currency." 


BETTER THAN FOR FREE

With the concept of peacebucks, electronic money (PBS) is generated by every private user automatically, every month. The more that people register, the more capital is generated worldwide. Because of that, companies will join and accept it too; in turn, a new currency is born. In addition, PBS can be bought directly through every account. 


ADVANTAGES

peacebucks combines a free market economy with basic human rights. On the one hand, it's additional free capital for private individuals; while on the other hand, it acts a new sales option for companies. It's a digital complementary currency providing additional value for society.

"The value of money exists only in the imagination of people. I personally prefer carrots." (Luna, peacebucks Marketing and PR dwarf rabbit)


CONVERSION RATE

An algorithm for global currency translation reduces the risk of speculative transactions and ensures a high stability of money. In addition, PBS cannot be changed back to other currencies - PBS stay PBS.

PEACEBUCKS RATE = (USD RATE + EUR RATE) ÷ 2


PRIVATE ACCOUNTS
Have you ever dreamed of earning free money or that money grew on trees?
Let your dreams come true, join peacebucks as private user.

Your benefits
  • Free account
  • 300 PBS monthly
  • Paying with and sending PBS is free
  • Receiving PBS only costs a few PBS


BUSINESS ACCOUNTS

Support the idea of free money, basic income and peace by accepting it for your business. The account is for free as well. The only difference to private accounts is that business accounts will not be credited with PBS for free.
Join peacebucks to generate an additional turnover, to acquire new clients, and to brand your company as global peace player. By the way, you will also make the world a better place.

FUNDING & MORE

Programming a state-of-the-art online payment software, using its own currency, is neither easy nor cheap. Funds are required to develop and improve the software according to the highest technology standards and to host it on a high security server farm. 

"Help us to get started, support the vision of of free money, basic income and peace. "


RISKS & CHALLENGES

Damn it, it would be easier to mention things that are not risky and challenging for this project. Let's keep it simple; this project is absolute crazy.

The probability that my startup will become a multi-million dollar company that is able to affect world peace is indeed not the highest. But damn, I like the idea and I will try my best.

It is very likely that I will take the 300 USD that my grandmother is investing, together with the rest of the generated funds here, probably additional 30 dollar, and buy a few beers and invite my friends over to a party. ;-)

No, seriously. As long as we cannot go online with a fully functional page, it is very difficult to convince people to join peacebucks. Only a huge number of users will attract companies, which will allow concept to start working. To break this cycle, it is important to develop a state of the art peacebucks page as soon as possible. That's why I'm here.


MAKE IT HAPPEN

Help peacebucks to get started:
  • Share it on social media (facebook, twitter etc.)
  • Support it, every Dollar counts 
"Let's make the impossible possible!"


OTHER WAYS TO HELP

Be part of the revolution of electronic money …

JOIN US ON FACEBOOK

LEAVE US YOUR EMAIL AS EARLY BIRD

Share it on social media (facebook, twitter etc.)

"Let's make the impossible possible!"

story:
A Mobile Van Is A Healthcare Game Changer And A Must-Have!!

Greetings from the Kingdom of Buganda in the country of Uganda in East Africa.

                                                

  

With your generous donation, Ggwanga Mujje Boston Chapter, dba Buganda Self- Help Initiative is fundraising to buy a Mobile Van Clinic that will be used to provide health services to people in rural Uganda who have little or no access to primary health services. 


 “Ggwanga Mujje”,  is a Luganda language slogan that literally means “Call to national duty.” It is also the name of the drum beat that the Baganda have sounded over centuries to mobilize the community during disasters and other times of hardship. 


With the attention of the world transfixed on trying to stop the deadly Ebola Virus spreading through parts of Africa, a non-profit organization registered in Boston Massachusetts, seeks your help in trying to take measures to help prevent similar circumstances happening in Uganda.  As it is so often said, “prevention is always better than cure.” According to the United States Government (USG) “Uganda has great potential to become the modern and prosperous nation it aspires to be. Improving the health of the Ugandan people is paramount to realizing this potential and saving the lives of women and newborns is imperative.”


Despite Uganda’s investment in the health care system over the past few years, according to the World Health Organization, Uganda's healthcare performance is still ranked as one of the worst in the world ranking 186th out of 191 nations. Uganda's health and life expectancy is among the lowest across the globe where one in every 200 births ends the mother's life.  The country has approximately 1 million people living with HIV and although malaria accounts for 14% of all deaths, less than 10% of children under five are sleeping under insecticide-treated nets. With a GDP per capita income of $572 a year, Uganda is one of the poorest nations in the world (World Bank 2013).


According to the World Health Organization, Uganda in recent years has experienced outbreaks of diseases such as Marburg, Ebola, HIV, Hepatitis E, Leprosy, and Cholera.  In 2012 as a percentage of GDP , Uganda spent only 9.5% of government expenditures on healthcare.

Where is the Kingdom of Buganda?

The Kingdom Buganda (over 700 years old) is located in the Central region of Uganda. It occupies 25% of the total surface area and home to 30% of Uganda's population.  Winston Churchill once referred to Uganda as the “Pearl of Africa.” Unfortunately,  the dictatorship of Idi Amin and other subsequent disastrous regimes ruined that reputation including the country’s established health infrastructure. At the time, Uganda had one of the best health systems in Africa with a renowned teaching and research hospital in the capital of Kampala.  This hospital came to attention of the world in the late 1950s with the  groundbreaking work of a British Surgeon, Denis Burkitt, who while in Uganda discovered a rare form of childhood cancer (Burkitt's Lymphoma)  later named after him.  
.


Our Needs, Your Perks

Ability to Purchase our first Mobile Van Clinic:

  • It costs approximately $300,000 to purchase a  Mobile clinic. This includes shipping  and handling costs. 
  • We will not be able to invest so much in giving out perks, but we do have some great gifts that you will certainly love! We offer the opportunity to become an honorary member of one of the Baganda Clans.
  • For $1,500, a limited time only, we offer a once in a lifetime chance to get a certificate of participation signed by the Katikkiro or the Prime Minister of Buganda, one of Uganda's most influential and powerful men.  
  • Please see the Perks section for a complete list.


The Impact

Because of you, the realization of this Mobile Van Clinic will provide so many benefits to the hundreds of thousands of people who have little to no access to any type of health care.  This includes children like Isaac who is profiled, walking in the mud, at the beginning of the video. 

 Here are ways your donations will impact their lives:

  • Utilize Mobile Van Clinics to improve access to healthcare.
  • Bring preventive services to beneficiaries who can't travel long distances.
  • Improve health care status of people living in rural Uganda
  • Collaborate with NGO partners, government, and private sector to enhance access to health care for at risk populations.
  • Allow for rapid access to care, treatment and medicines.

                              


Other Ways You Can Help

Ggwanga Mujje is asking every one who can, to donate and if not to share the campaign link widely.

  • Ask everyone you know to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Send them our link: www.igg.me/at/mvc
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools! and let your friends, families and subscribers know about us!

Remember,by donating to a cause that will increase vigilance at the source, you are at the same time protecting the homeland.

story:
OUR STORY

           

            Hello, we are Coryn & Justin: the owners of Roots. Currently, we are a local Cold Pressed Juice company based out of Corpus Christi, Texas. We pride ourselves in creating fresh and wholesome products for our customers. We started Roots January 9, 2017. Our plan is to go from local juicers, to the owners of the first plant-based café in the Coastal Bend! The vision for Roots Café is a positive and warm environment for everyone to relax & enjoy.  This is our dream to spread wellness & delicious food to our little city. 

 

OUR GOAL & YOUR CREATIVE PERKS

 

To start up Roots Café, we will need to raise at least $30,000.  This money will go into restoring the worn location, buying commercial ovens, fridges, coffee machines, flooring, wallpaper, redoing the bathroom, sitting tables, etc. For donating, our perks include eco friendly totes, comfy shirts, & mugs. All of our merch art is locally done as well. It was important for us to provide high quality, & modern merchandise for our amazing doners!  If we don’t reach our full goal, we will have to go cheaper routes with our machinery & décor. 

 

THE REASON

 

Roots Café will make history being Corpus Christi’s’ first fully vegan café & juice bar. Roots will be a modern spot to grab delicious breakfast, lunch, juice, coffee, etc. Our menu is crafted with fresh ingredients with a very unique twist. We are so fiercely dedicated to open a café with healthy options because Corpus Christi is one of the most overweight cities in the nation. Numbers show that 4 in 10 citizens are obese. 76% of residence do not eat enough fruits and vegetables; good thing that’s all our food is consisted of. 

 

RISK & CHALLENGES

           

The main challenge we face is raising enough money. It is very expensive to start up your own business. That’s why we will be eternally grateful for all of the support for anyone donating, sharing and believing in our vision. 

 

HOW TO HELP US MEET OUR GOAL:

 

PROMOTE our Indiegogo directly to friends through social media, emails, or conversation. Indiegogo has some very easy ways to share our campaign directly to FB, Twitter, or direct emails to your friends.

FOLLOW us on our social media accounts @roots.cc! 

Thank you so much for reading- We are Rooting for Your Health!!!

story:
Our Indiegogo campaign has ended, but you can still donate to help us build Hooked Fish Shop here: gofundme.com/hookedfishshop

Two beloved characters from the Boston farmers market community are teaming up to bring fresh, local seafood to the new Bow Market in Somerville’s Union Square. Jimmy Rider and Jason Tucker have partnered to open Hooked at the Bow Market. Hooked will sell Red’s Best seafood and Boston Smoked Fish Company products along with creative, street-inspired ready-to-eats made with top quality seafood.

Jimmy Rider is the owner-operator of Evergreen Delivery . He has been a vendor at local farmers markets, does bicycle delivery for local restaurants and vendors at Boston Public Market, and delivers Christmas trees every December. The Evergreen delivery web store features Reds Best Fish Share , Christmas Tree Delivery and  farmers market products 

Jason Tucker has more than 25 years’ experience in food service ranging from fine hotels to retail and quick service and has a commercial fishing license. Jason is experienced in quality assurance, cost control, and facilities management. His extensive experience in the seafood industry makes him uniquely qualified to lead Hooked to success.

You'll still find Jimmy and Jason at Boston area farmers markets, Bow Market will be a solid addition to the local food scene.

According to NOAA, more than 80% of the seafood consumed in the US is imported. Hooked is dedicated to highlighting the high-quality seafood available locally in New England and making it available directly to consumers. 

We're looking to raise $25,000 to fund the build-out of the retail space at Bow Market. Construction, commercial kitchen equipment, and displays are necessary. Maybe the most significant purchase is an ice machine. We've come up with some fun perks: from gift cards and t-shirts to catered parties and personal tours of the Red's Best operation on the Boston Fish Pier. 

Help bring fresh, local seafood to Union Square by funding the build-out for Hooked Fish Shop. Please share our crowd-funding campaign to help us achieve our goal.
story_txt: Our Indiegogo campaign has ended, but you can still donate to help us build Hooked Fish Shop here: gofundme.com/hookedfishshopTwo beloved characters from the Boston farmers market community are teaming up to bring fresh, local seafood to the new Bow Market in Somerville’s Union Square. Jimmy Rider and Jason Tucker have partnered to open Hooked at the Bow Market. Hooked will sell Red’s Best seafood and Boston Smoked Fish Company products along with creative, street-inspired ready-to-eats made with top quality seafood.Jimmy Rider is the owner-operator of Evergreen Delivery . He has been a vendor at local farmers markets, does bicycle delivery for local restaurants and vendors at Boston Public Market, and delivers Christmas trees every December. The Evergreen delivery web store features Reds Best Fish Share , Christmas Tree Delivery and  farmers market products Jason Tucker has more than 25 years’ experience in food service ranging from fine hotels to retail and quick service and has a commercial fishing license. Jason is experienced in quality assurance, cost control, and facilities management.
