story:
Bookstores are all about cultivating stories. They are the heartbeat of a community, and they reflect the interests, passions, needs and desires of the communities that house them. Thank-you for taking the time to explore my pitch page. My name is Melissa Bourdon-King, and I will be opening Once Upon a Bookstore in the heart of Kelowna's Pandosy Village in July of 2019. As you read a little about me and my vision, it is my sincerest hope you will discover your own desire to be part of the continuing story of Once Upon a Bookstore.

A window into my story

I have been a bookseller for more than twelve years. My passion for the industry began in a high-school classroom in Toronto when, in a mandatory career class, I was asked to think about my dream job. At 15, I hadn't ever really thought about what kind of job I was interested in, but I did know where I loved to be-- Mabel's Fables Children's Bookstore in Toronto. Since the age of 3 my mom had taken me there to find fantastic reads, and it was still the best place to browse around, chat with the amazing staff, and find that next magical something. Sitting in that classroom I thought, "Who wouldn't want to work at a bookstore? I'll pretend to apply there!" Except the application became real. With the help of my mom, I wrote a cover letter, sent in my resume and was hired! I could not have been more thrilled, nor could I have known that working there would shape my identity and set my course: a lifelong passion for books.

It is hard to describe what it is about bookselling that is so intoxicating, but I will tell you that for the two years I wasn't working in a bookstore, I longed for the familiar satisfaction of knowing I'd put the perfect book into someone's hands. When I worked at Mabel's Fables, I planned events, I met authors, I read to children, I played 'can you help me find the book whose title I can't remember?' with customers. I used my creative brain, my management brain, and my community outreach brain. Bookstores house stories, and stories have the power to change lives, and even if they don't dramatically alter someone's path, reading books shapes people. Do you remember some of your favourite books as a child? I do, and they are titles that continue to hold an important place in my memory because I was forever altered by reading them. People remember their favourite books, especially books that moved them as children, and they speak about them with a reverence that is hypnotic.

At the beginning of 2018, I was doing a lot of self-reflection, and I decided to take a leap of faith and attend the Paz and Associates Bookseller Bootcamp in Florida (http://pazbookbiz.com/owning-a-bookstore-the-wo... the conference really opened the floodgates for my creative brain. I was surrounded by like-minded, passionate individuals, and their camaraderie fuelled me. The name and a logo idea for the bookstore popped into my mind, and from there, the ideas just kept coming. I thought about all the community endeavors I wanted to cultivate and support, from bookclubs and private shopping nights, to school bookfairs and parent night fundraisers.  I want to create a safe and welcoming space for local community groups (moms, dads, bookclubs, etc). I would like to provide meeting space to community organizations, like Girl Guides of Canada, and host family-friendly events like board game nights and art classes. 

Deciding to open my own children's bookstore has at times been a scary and daunting prospect. For every exciting idea that I get fired up about, there is usually a financial or administrative hurdle that needs to be overcome. Despite the wealth of experience I have in the industry, I know that the entrepreneurial route is filled with unexpected challenges and obstacles. Yet I consider myself privileged to know that following this path is my passion, and that knowing this is my passion is a gift. Regardless of the challenges, this is something I am doing because I have to-- because it is who I am.

 

Once Upon a Bookstore's Story

In order to open Once Upon a Bookstore,  a total investment of about $140,000 is needed, and more than $70,000 of this cost will be filling the store with inventory- books, toys, games, puzzles, art, etc. The remainder of that money has gone/will go to construction costs, renovating, purchasing furniture and fixtures, legal fees, city and building permits, hardware, software, insurance costs, and prepaid expenses like having a telephone and internet service. 

While finances and financial management are an important part of any healthy business, costs are not what Once Upon a Bookstore is about. My vision for this bookstore is about filling a hole I see in our community, and using my passion and expertise to meet that need. Kelowna is home to more than 24,000 children, and that number more than doubles when considering the Okanagan region. As a parent myself, I volunteer my time on the Parent Advisory Council for my daughter's school and also serve with Girl Guides of Canada. I take my daughter to swimming lessons at Parkinson Rec, and to dance classes around the city. I see how many families there are and I want to foster their ability to be part of something they consider theirs--a store guided by their needs.

Bookstores are a place to buy books, of course, but they can also be so much more. Once Upon a Bookstore will be such a place-- an event space for the community. It will connect local, Canadian and international authors and illustrators with Okanagan readers. It will unite new moms and dads with classes, support systems and safe spaces. It will welcome families of all shapes, sizes, varieties and cultures to feel safe and find their stories on our shelves. It will encourage creativity in all forms through workshops, classes, and discussion groups. It will listen to new ideas and be a base point to launch those new ideas, for young and old. It will give back to the local community through supporting literacy efforts, school groups, and community-minded organizations. In short, Once Upon a Bookstore will grow and evolve based on what its community--you--needs it to be.

 

The Impact

Here is how your dollars will help contribute to Once Upon a Bookstore's story:

  • First of all- THE PERKS! The perks are for you! They are an acknowledgement of your part in our story. We have so many exciting offerings: stickers, bookmarks, magnets, tote bags, recommendation shelves, subscription services, bookstore birthday and cocktail parties! My personal favourite perk is asking you to 'Be My Book Valentine'. Many hours were spent thinking about what perks would best represent my gratitude for your support, and which ones would be the most fun to experience.

 

  • This project is not just for me, it is for our community, our children, our families, our friends. This campaign is about bringing together booklovers, and having them contribute, so what they love being available in a store. So many beloved children's books have shaped people's lives, I want to hear those stories and be able to share those stories with everyone who walks through the door, or who discovers us online. Once Upon a Bookstore is going to be warm and welcoming, where families always feel accepted, and where parents, grandparents, aunts, uncles, cousins, and friends can ask for help finding the perfect book and know they are receiving expert advice from a passionate individual.

  • Bookstores are the heartbeat of local communities. We provide safe spaces and nurture the local market- from hosting events, to promoting local and Canadian authors and illustrators, to being a safe space for the community to meet, whether bookclubs, mom groups, classes for parents and babies, discussion groups, or art classes. These are just a few of the ideas I have to bring together families in Kelowna.

  • For over twelve wonderful years, I worked for, and then managed an independent children's bookstore in Toronto. Some of my favourite memories are hosting author events, both in store and in school classrooms, and watching the magic of an author interacting with a child. It is this magic that I hope to bring to the more-than-24,000 Okanagan school children

  • If you are looking for more information on the value that independent bookstores can bring to a community, this link really encapsulates the goals of Once Upon a  Bookstore:  https://www.strongtowns.org/journal/2019/1/8/lo... 

 

  • Even if this goal is not fully funded, every penny raised will go towards making sure the store is full of stories, so that I can continue to focus on supporting the community and building relationships that will help us all thrive.

 

Risks & Challenges

Let's be honest, there are a lot of risks, and many significant challenges in opening any bookstore, let alone a children's bookstore. Amazon's deep discounting and large warehouses are probably at the forefront of people's minds as being the biggest challenge bookstores face. But there are some really important things online retailing just cannot provide: the most important one being personal service. Check out the link below:

https://www.axios.com/what-amazon-could-learn-f...

Personal service and community-building are the foundations upon which I will build Once Upon a Bookstore. I love children's books, and my endless enthusiasm extends not only to the books themselves, but also to the authors, illustrators and publishers who bring stories to life. Once Upon a Bookstore will play an important role in contributing to the ecosystem of the bookloving community, and we have the strength, resilience, expertise and grace to tackle any challenge that comes our way. Should we feel unsure in the face of a new challenge, we can turn to our bookselling colleagues, whose community always offers each other help and support.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you aren't able to contribute financially, you can still help!

  • Spread the word! Share news about us on your social media accounts, talk to your friends, your colleagues, your dentist/doctor /chiropractor/hairdresser about our store
  • Share this link! Maybe you can't help but you would like to share our campaign with those you know. 
  • Like us on facebook! You can find us at https://www.facebook.com/onceuponabookstorekelowna

Let's build a community of booklovers together. Thank-you so much for your support!

story:
First of all I would like to note that is available for all types of connectors, for the whole world. Once you leave the shipping address, by address we will determine the type that you need and that you will get it!



Magic power strip cube is a unique product, designed to provide you with the space you work better and more modern. Power strips are an indispensable part of every household, and with the magic power strip cube you get what you never could. You can build a extension and design its shape in order to fit it into your home.

Cubes are white, but available in a few other colors. (black, brown, red, blue, yellow, green, purple and gray)

This is now the main product that will experience many more modifications. The plan is cubes with more possibilities.

10.000,00 $ + Cube with USB port for charging mobile devices.

20.000,00 $ + Cube with remote off and on

30.000,00 $ + Cube that will measure the electricity consumption

40.000,00 $ + Cube Timer

I will update you about progress !

Part of the extension cable . Part of the initial cable with the power button It have electricity cut off and finally blend with phase zero and grounding




Socket ( cube ) that have lines on all sides.



Extension separating group socket





" dovetail " that connects the two mutual cubes . Going between the blocks to implement current from the first to the last outlet






The protection that is at stake on each side where a " bare " sheet - to protect against electric shock . For each cube going 4 protection ( 4sides ) .





Why do I present here ?

That's because I need  many orders so I could prosper and develop new products. Also, as more orders I have cheaper production costs, and what I want is to start its production and distribute this product throughout the world. So I hope you recognize the potential of this product and that you will decide to purchase or donate at least $ 1, because then I would be 1$ closer to achieving the goal.

You might be wondering what if I do not collect the full amount?

Do not worry, I'm still satisfied, because I have presented this product worldwide.

Each paid product will be delivered to each customer within max 90 days of purchase if the campaign is not over, or within max 60 days of the end of the campaign. I collect the full amount or not, everyone will get a product.

After the end of the campaign and reaching the target, I will start the production and delivery of ordered products to your address.

I ask that you leave full address after the purchase, so I can choose the right type of connector for you and send you the product purchased.

Risk

The biggest risk of this is that I will not get enough of sleep, because I do not know to stop until I succeed.

Let's face it this is not something that is impossible, this is a product with great potential and it is necessary to every household, and so yours.

Also, regardless of whether you have just purchased or not, I need your help to share this product on social networks so that more people see this product and participate !! Thank you for that in advance. Anyone who share enters the contest where I will share a few packages for free, the number of packets depends on the successful sale!
 


**Anyone who Shares this campaign on FB or tweet this campaign to the followers will get reward, maybe t-shirt, maybe some one package!!

That's only one click for you, and a big help for this project !!

And one reward is yours !!

So dont forget to share, bacause you will be rewarded !!

Thank you again for your support !

story:
Here in Iowa we know how things grow. We know about roots, and just like plants, people have roots.  Historic people and places help keep us rooted, connected, and strong - 

Middle River Brewing Co. is a microbrewery built above the 140 yr old historic Northside Café. Set to open this summer on the town square in Winterset, Iowa.

We are known for:

 ·  Covered Bridges of Madison County

·  Birthplace of John Wayne

·  Birthplace of the Delicious apple

·  George Washington Carver

·  And Monuments Man George L. Stout

We will produce two year-round flagship beers and one flagship soft drink (non-alcoholic) : a traditional Bohemian Pilsner, a traditional American stout, and a historic sarsaparilla. These will be joined by rotating seasonal brews, limited release beers, Iowa native guest beers and tasting room-only experimental beers.

A little about Us

I'm Walter Jahncke and I'm Michele and these are our children - Walter, Barton, Milton, Amelie and Ren. Together we began operating the Historic Northside Café on the town square of Winterset, Iowa nearly four years ago, and now we are opening a brewery.

Our adventure began nearly 8 years ago, when, with no job or real plan we just up and moved - 5 home schooled kids, mom, dad, faith that God would care for us and a dream of a simpler life in the country. We left the city and moved to an acreage about 30 miles southwest of Des Moines in Madison County. We had no idea what would happen next.
No adventure would be complete without a little adversity. By late 2011, with our savings depleted and no clear prospects for a good income in Madison County, we were running out of options. When an opportunity presented itself - we took another leap of faith. The Historic Northside Café was available for sale, right on the square of downtown Winterset. We put up our house as collateral, and took over operations in March of 2012.

Where are we now?

It has not been easy resurrecting a small town café in middle America. The community needed time to get to know us. The building needed a lot more upgrades than we could possibly accomplish all at once. Growth was slower than we had hoped. But as we approach our fourth year of steady growth at the Northside, things have never looked better and we are embracing a new opportunity - opening our own brewery - Middle River Brewing Co.                                                                       

There’s a lot to do when pulling together a brewery, and like the café this needs a lot of upgrades to bring it to code and keep its historic value. We've knocked out almost every wall and taken it down to the original local hardwood frame and our equipment has been delivered. The paper work is coming together and we're starting to hunt for as many locally sourced ingredients as possible.

Where are we headed?

Once open we will be brewing on an electric 3-barrel brew system. Our beer and soft drinks will be available to drink in the café / tap room, to take with you in growlers or limited release 750 ml bottles, and sold in kegs to local festivals, bars and restaurants. 

Why do we need your help?

Opening your own business in a historic building is always expensive and a brewery is no exception. This Indiegogo campaign will help cover expenses of meeting code upgrades, acquiring native materials to keep the building authentic, and finally add a solar powered system. We have never been a family to ask for charity, but a little help from you buying a T-shirt, or beer for life will go a long way toward making the brewery your favorite place to hang out and have a beer and a meal.

What will your money be going toward?

Any money raised through crowdfunding will be split into three areas:

First, acquiring native materials (local milled rough sawn wood, and locally quarried rock) for the build out of the brewery.  Our goal is to use 100% local craftsmen and businesses to support our small town economy.

Second, we will be spending any crowd funding money on adding a solar system to reduce our energy footprint by 40%.

Third, to cover the cost of any code upgrades needed for staying in compliance with the historic status of the building and the square, i.e. a new fire suppression system (man are those expensive!!).

 Across America small towns are dying, and many of their iconic small town businesses are dying with them. The Northside Café has been operating for more than 140 years, and the town square is a Historic Commercial District on the National Historic Register. We want to make sure Middle River Brewing handles our construction with the same respect we have endeavored with the Café.

Anything we raise beyond our goals will go toward an awesome preview party.

How can you help?

First, you can get the word out about Middle River Brewing on social media. Share the link to our Indiegogo page on your Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, and other social media sites.

Second, you can help us reach our pledge goal. Indiegogo works by allowing supporters to pledge money in return for awesome tiered perks. When our campaign is complete pledgers are charged the amount they pledged and perks are distributed.

Steps:

·  Create an Indiegogo account

·  Pledge $1 or more (your card will only be charged when the campaign ends)

·  Share the link to this campaign on social media

·  Repeat!

It’s really that simple and we can’t do it without you!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/middleriverbrewingco
Twitter: https://twitter.com/Middleriverbrew
Pinterest:https://www.pinterest.com/middleriverbrew/

Instagram:https://www.instagram.com/middleriverbrewing/

So this is an invitation to you - to share our opportunity and make it your opportunity too. We have discovered there are other people like us. People who want to make their dreams a reality. Who want to get involved and make a difference. We invite you to have an adventure. This little slice of Americana and all of its history, nestled in the rolling hills of Madison county has so much to offer.

REWARD LEVELS

PLEDGE  $25.00  Share a Slice

Well, our daughters wanted to help with this campaign, so this one is all them. Amelie and Ren will send you a hand written thank you and certificate for a slice of our famous blueberry crisp. But the girls will also have a slice and send you a picture of them eating it with the thank you. So we guess it’s a win-win-win?


PLEDGE  $45.00  Flying Those Colors

Some of you like to show your support by flying the logo. So you will get your choice of either a Northside Café or Middle River Brewing t-shirt and a Northside Café or Middle River Brewing Pint Glass (available for pick-up at the café/brewery, or we can send it for $5.00 S&H), and we will burn your name into the “our roots are strong” wall. This wall will be in our entryway and made of native wood. You will have the burning posted on social media with our thanks.  



PLEDGE  $80.00  TWO for the Party

Grand Opening General Admission – Our grand opening party will be limited to two hundred guests (that includes the fire marshal and police chief who we plan to invite so we don’t get shut down!) and will include: two taster glasses for beer tasting of all our standard and guest beers, unlimited beer samples (or as long as the beer lasts), and the Northside Café’s well known appetizers and desserts paired for the beers being served.


PLEDGE  $100.00  Local and Faithful Drinker

Beer for life! Yes, you read that right. Enjoy one free pint* of beer a month for the rest of your life. Only $100 Dollars! And we will burn your name into the “our roots are strong” wall as a lifetime supporter. This wall will be in our entryway and made of native wood. You will have the burning posted on social media with our thanks.

*guest beers or high gravity beers may be served in 10oz pours


PLEDGE  $150.00  Artistic Supporter

Our limited edition handmade ceramic Growlers are high-fired stoneware pottery, hand thrown on a potter's wheel and signed by our artist. Each is 32oz with our logo, numbered, and with a clear white glaze. (All glazes used are lead free and contain no harmful materials.) This type of growler offers the maximum protection for your brew, as no light can get into break down (or “skunk”) the beer in storage. Since each item is hand-made, growlers may be slightly different than pictured (comes with a certificate for two fills of our standard beers), and we will burn your name into the “our roots are strong” wall as a lifetime supporter. This wall will be in our entryway and made of native wood. You will have the burning posted on social media with our thanks.


PLEDGE  $200.00  Peace, Beer, and Yoga

Be invited out to a special day retreat of Yoga, tranquility, and beer, on the beautiful PepperHarrow Farm nestled  in the rolling hills of the Bridges of Madison County.  Yoga sessions will be lead by the famous and amazing Brooke Larson aka Beeryoga on Instagram. Appetizers will be catered by the Historic Northside Café and beer samples from Iowa native breweries will be on hand for your enjoyment.  32oz. Growler with one of our house beers, limited edition Middle River Brewing t-shirt and we will burn your name into the “our roots are strong” wall. This wall will be in our entryway and made of native Iowa wood. You will have the burning posted on social media with our thanks. 


PLEDGE  $250.00  Artistic Supporter Plus

Handmade ceramic Growlers are high-fired stoneware pottery, hand thrown on a potter's wheel and signed by our artist. Each is 32oz with our logo, numbered, and with a clear white glaze. (All glazes used are lead free and contain no harmful materials.) This type of growler offers the maximum protection for your brew, as no light can get into break down (or “skunk”) the beer in storage. Since each item is hand-made, growlers will be slightly different than pictured .

1 growler fill per month for 24 months, for any tap (even for the taps that we don't normally offer growler fills for!), and we will burn your name into the “our roots are strong” wall as a life time supporter. This wall will be in our entryway and made of Native wood. You will have the burning posted on social media with our thanks. 


PLEDGE  $300.00  Monument Supporter

Get one of our famous 1/2 lb. Monument Burger, made with our own special brisket-chuck blend and a Pint every month for two years (thats over $400 of free food and beer!), and we will burn your name into the “our roots are strong” wall as a life time supporter. This wall will be in our entryway and made of native wood. You will have the burning posted on social media with our thanks. 


PLEDGE  $500.00  Reserved Supporter

Our Reserve Membership – 2 bottles of our limited barrel fermented/aged George Stout beer for 5 years. These very small batch beers will never be distributed outside the brewery. These beers will be auctioned off each year as part of the George Stout Festival and all proceeds going to fund art in schools.  Each beer will be from a single type of local spirit or wine barrel. They will be bottled in the Champagne style and numbered. (no more then 300 bottles per year will be made), two tickets to our grand opening party, and we will burn your name into the “our roots are strong” wall as a life time supporter. This wall will be in our entryway and made of native wood. You will have the burning posted on social media with our thanks.


PLEDGE  $750.00  108 Life Members Club

You receive a limited edition leather Mug with your name + your own numbered 32 oz ceramic growler, Special 108 Mug Club t-shirt, one beer a month for life and special pricing on mug fills at the taproom for life. 1 bottle of our limited barrel fermented/aged George Stout beer for 5 years, two tickets to our grand opening party (and any other party we have), also we'll have your name burnt into the “our roots are strong” wall as a life time supporter. This wall will be in our entryway and made of native wood. You will have the burning posted on social media with our thanks.

We will only ever have 108 of these available


PLEDGE  $2,500.00  Artistic Life Supporter

Life Time Reserve Membership – 2 bottles of our limited barrel fermented/aged George Stout beer for life.  These very small batch beers will never be distributed outside the brewery. These beers will be auctioned off each year as part of the George Stout Festival and all proceeds going to fund art in schools.  Each beer will be from a single type of local spirit or wine barrel. They will be bottled in Champagne style, numbered. (no more then 300 bottles per year will be made), have your name and image forever stitched into the Middle River Family Quilt (8x8 block) which will hang prominently in the historic Northside Café, two tickets to our grand opening party, and we will still burn your name into the “our roots are strong” wall as a life time supporter. This wall will be in our entryway and made of native Iowa wood. You will have the burning posted on social media with our thanks.


PLEDGE  $2,500.00  Named For The Ages Supporter

We'll name a fermenter after you! A special tank label will me made with your name emblazoned on it and applied to one of our fermenters! Two tickets to our grand opening party,  Also includes your name burned into the “our roots are strong” wall as a life time supporter. This wall will be in our entryway and made of native wood. You will have the burning posted on social media with our thanks.                                                    


PLEDGE  $5000.00  Philanthropic Supporter

Create your own seasonal Middle River beer (Pick style, 8% ABV cap, pick 2 specialty ingredients, name on the label, help design label and help name beer). But that’s not the best part!  We will donate 10% of the profit of this beer each year in your or your family's name to a charity of mutual consent.  We'll name the fermenter after you! A special tank label will me made with your name emblazoned on it! Two tickets to our grand opening party.  Also have your name and image forever stitched into the Middle River Family Quilt (8x8 block), which will hang prominently in the historic Northside Cafe, and we will still burn your name into the “our roots are strong” wall as a lifetime supporter. This wall will be in our entryway and made of native Iowa wood. You will have the burning posted on social media with our thanks. 


PLEDGE  $15,000.00  Monuments Men Supporter

Ultimate supporter! Just like the Monuments men and women who gave selflessly of themselves so people could enjoy the art of the ages, so is this supporter to us.

You will receive two 108-membership mugs (one for home, one for the café), a 32oz and 64oz custom ceramic growler numbered, 2 bottles of our limited barrel fermented/aged George Stout beer for life, Special 108 Mug Club t-shirt, one beer a month for life.

A booth in the café will be named in your honor, and a meal will be created and named after you. 

You will also be our guest at the Great American Beerfest 2017 in Denver Colorado.(tickets for 2 to the event and hotel included, airfare not included).

 The donation made from the George Stout “private reserve” each year will be done in your name with the brewery.

You will help us create our annual mead recipe (pick 2 specialty ingredients, name on the label, help design label and help brew the beer with two brewmasters from different breweries).

But that’s not the best part.  We will donate 10% of the profit of this beer each year in your or your family's name to a charity of mutual consent.

A tour and private tasting at 10 Iowa breweries with the owners (including a growler from each brewery).  

The coolest part is we will have two oil paintings done of you standing in front of the Historic Northside Café / Middle River Brewery. A 48”x72” that will hang prominently in the main entrance, and a 30”x40” to hang at home. This portrait will hang next to a 48”x72” painting of the “Monument Man” himself, Congressional Medal of Honor winner George L. Stout.

image of Rembrandt self portrait saved by the Monuments Men

 Also have your name and image forever stitched into the Middle River Family Quilt (8x8 block), which will hang prominently in the historic Northside Cafe, and we will still burn your name into the “our roots are strong” wall as "THE" monumental supporter, and last be our guest of honor at the grand opening!

This is an award worthy of George Clooney!!!
story_txt:
Here
in Iowa we know how things grow. We know about roots, and just like plants,
people have roots.  Historic people and places help keep us rooted, connected,
and strong -  
Middle
River Brewing Co. is a microbrewery built above the 140 yr old historic Northside
Café. Set to open this summer on the town square in Winterset,
Iowa. 
We are known
for: ·  Covered Bridges
of Madison County
· 
Birthplace of John Wayne
· 
Birthplace of the Delicious
apple
· 
George Washington Carver
· 
And Monuments Man George
L. Stout
We will produce two year-round flagship beers
and one flagship soft drink (non-alcoholic) : a traditional Bohemian Pilsner, a
traditional American stout, and a historic sarsaparilla. These will be joined
by rotating seasonal brews, limited release beers, Iowa native guest beers and
tasting room-only experimental beers.
A little about Us
I'm Walter Jahncke and I'm Michele and these are
our children - Walter, Barton, Milton, Amelie and Ren.
Together we began operating the Historic Northside Café on the town square of
Winterset, Iowa nearly four years ago, and now we are opening a brewery.

Our adventure began nearly 8 years ago, when, with no
job or real plan we just up and moved - 5 home schooled kids, mom, dad, faith
that God would care for us and a dream of a simpler life in the country. We
left the city and moved to an acreage about 30 miles southwest of Des Moines in
Madison County. We had no idea what would happen next.
No adventure would be complete without a little adversity. By late 2011, with
our savings depleted and no clear prospects for a good income in Madison
County, we were running out of options. When an opportunity presented itself -
we took another leap of faith. The Historic Northside Café was available for
sale, right on the square of downtown Winterset. We put up our house as
collateral, and took over operations in March of 2012.

Where
are we now?
It has not been easy resurrecting a small town café in
middle America. The community needed time to get to know us. The building needed
a lot more upgrades than we could possibly accomplish all at once. Growth was
slower than we had hoped. But as we approach our fourth year of steady growth
at the Northside, things have never looked better and we are embracing a new
opportunity - opening our own brewery - Middle River Brewing Co.                                                                       
There’s a lot to do when pulling together a
brewery, and like the café this needs a lot of upgrades to bring it to code and
keep its historic value. We've knocked out almost every wall and taken it down
to the original local hardwood frame and our equipment has been delivered. The
paper work is coming together and we're starting to hunt for as many
locally sourced ingredients as possible.

Where
are we headed?
Once open we will be brewing on an electric 3-barrel
brew system. Our beer and soft drinks will be available to drink in the café / tap room,
to take with you in growlers or limited release 750 ml bottles, and sold
in kegs to local festivals, bars and restaurants. 
Why
do we need your help?
Opening your own business in a historic
building is always expensive and a brewery is no exception. This Indiegogo
campaign will help cover expenses of meeting code upgrades, acquiring native
materials to keep the building authentic, and finally add a solar powered system.
We have never been a family to ask for charity, but a little help from you
buying a T-shirt, or beer for life will go a long way toward making the brewery
your favorite place to hang out and have a beer and a meal.

First, acquiring native materials (local

craftsmen and businesses to support our small town economy.
Second, we will be spending any crowd funding
money on adding a solar system to reduce our energy footprint by 40%.
Third, to cover the cost of any code upgrades
needed for staying in compliance with the historic status of the building and

story:
A Little Background

You may not realize it, but autism has probably touched the life of somebody you know. Better yet, imagine receiving an autism diagnosis for your child. What would you do? Who would you turn to for help and support? What about when they grow up; who will hire them?  How will they receive the skills needed to reach their full potential?  Early identification, intensive therapy and transition services typically help these children and their families overcome the educational challenges presented by autism, but this has proven an overwhelming task for our autism resource providers in Northeast Florida to undertake alone.

That’s where the Making Strides For Autism Parent Resource Center and Autism Youth Project come in.  Families are faced with fear, uncertainty, and in many cases the feeling of being completely alone. We need YOUR help to give parents of children with autism the parent to parent support they need through support, training and advocacy programs. As well as assessing youth with autism's strengths and transition those strengths into a career which will allow them to live as independently as possible.


Our Story

As a mother of a son on the autism spectrum, I asked myself recently what is that I can do that will help fellow autism parents the most as they start their autism journey. What do we need the most that is not offered in Northeast Florida.  The help that came to mind was parent resource center and autism outreach program.  A Parent Resource Center to get them the support, training and advocacy that will help their children reach their full potential, successfully transition into life and sustain employment.

That thought inspired Carrence Bass, the mother of a child with autism and Christian McNeill, a dedicated autism advocate, to start the Making Strides For Autism parent resource center,  Since inception, I’ve had one heart-felt wish – may families have an easier time than I did obtaining the services and support needed to raise their children.

Over the last four years I’ve worked with parents, Autism Speaks, providers and currently the City of Jacksonville and UF CARD. So I am dedicated and passionate about 1) Opening the Making Strides For Autism parent resource center 2) removing the stigma of autism and 3) getting kids help early, when it can do the most good.

That’s why I need your support. Because the autism parents in Northeast Florida need our support.  People need to know that the special gifts which come with Autism are an asset—not a burden—to society.


Our Campaign

Making Strides For Autism need your support to make the Making Strides For Autism parent resource center a reality. This center will be the first Northeast Florida Autism Community Parent Resource Center. Our center will assist families who have children with autism.  Our vision is that all ASD families will have universal access to information, training, support, and advocacy skills to help their children reach their full potential. We will open our center and outreach program in January 2017.  Making Strides For Autism has applied for our 501(c)(3) nonprofit status with the IRS.  All donations made while in our pending status are tax deductible. We're currently  working hard to build lasting and cohesive community and national partnerships that will assist the ASD families in Northeast Florida. 

Making Strides For Autism has been invited to be 1 of 35 One Spark creator applicants to participate in The Spark Walk Idea Market at the Jacksonville Landing. An opportunity for us to gain exposure and crowdfund to launch the upcoming parent resource center.  We hope to raise all of the money for our campaign but we believe that this initiative will also help to raise awareness about Making Strides for Autism and the need to help parents of children with autism spectrum disorders living in Northeast Florida. Please support us by sharing our cause on social media, on your websites, with friends, family and employers and by donating on Indiegogo. No amount is too small. From small steps to making strides; every donation helps!


What We Need & What You Get


The Need

Making Strides For Autism has a special niche, and—in its two divisions—meets a critical need.

One in 68 children is diagnosed with autism spectrum disorders.  (1 in 48 are boys and 1 in 189 are girls). Out of these 56% won’t graduate from high school.  Due to the lack of social and/or life skills 85% will be unemployed.  This cost taxpayers 236 Billion a year. 

Meanwhile due to the sometimes demanding needs, this also causes high attrition rates, unproductive work hours and a lack of secondary education participation from parents with children who have ASD.

But statistics doesn’t get to the heart of what we do…

The Mission

Making Strides For Autism is dedicated to helping parents become better prepared to meet the needs of their children with support, training, and advocacy.  We go above and beyond to provide the tools and resource connections needed to assist their children to lead successful and productive lives.  Our Autism Outreach program will assist children and adults with ASD from age 8 through 26, with the essential items they need to thrive, transition into adulthood, gain and sustain employment and succeed in life.  Starting with fun year round inclusion activities based on their strengths and skill sets that we cultivate to help them transition into sustainable employment. Our services and programs are provided free of charge or at very low cost by engaging and connecting a coalition of Northeast Florida community partners to create a village to raise children on the spectrum and help parents and adults on the spectrum.  Making Strides For Autism’s goal is to supplement current projects and/or programs already established in the community and initiate and/or create innovative new initiatives to fulfill the unmet needs in the autism community.

Donor support of the autism center will go directly toward providing the necessary personnel and resources to open the Making Strides For Autism Community Parent Resource Center and Autism Outreach Program for Northeast Florida. This fundraising effort is designed to meet the initial start-up costs, for personnel, our parent resource website. This is the first of our crowdfunding campaigns.  Our long-term goal is to be self-supporting or break even in subsequent years. This campaign will consist of donations to our crowdfunding campaign, corporate donations, selling Making Strides For Autism retail merchandise and grassroots community events. 


The Model

Once our center is opened Making Strides For Autism will be funded through merchandise sales, grants, grassroots community drives and corporate donations. Making Strides For Autism employs parents and/or family members with children on the autism spectrum and people with autism spectrum disorders.  Making Strides For Autism will offer a New Autism Friendly Certification that is a joint project collaborated UF Health Center For Autism & Related Disabilities for businesses in Northeast Florida.  This certification will provide in-depth training on being an autism friendly business for patrons, employees that have children on the spectrum and employing people with autism. 

Businesses that complete this certification will be able to use the Making Strides For Autism Logo on their websites, social media and marketing material to signify they are an autism friendly business to the community.  These businesses will also be listed on our resource database website that we will launch in January 2017 that families and people with ASD can do customized searches to locate resources if they are not able to come into our center.  Services and programs are facilitated through our professionally trained staff and contractors and our collaborative network of social service agencies and school partners.

More On Our Campaign

We’ll need to reach $50,000 to commission phase one. Please help us in being a champion for our cause by donating, liking, sharing, and spreading the word so that we can help to make it a little easier for our families facing autism journeys.  But that’s not where we want to stop!

Three Things Needed

1) Donations  2) Spreading the word about out campaign and 3) Sponsors, Volunteers, Partners and Resources!

The Making Strides campaign is designed to:

  • Raise the initial start-up capital to open our parent resource center and autism outreach program in January 2017
  • Bring more awareness to autism in Northeast Florida
  • Build awareness of the Making Strides For Autism Brand
  • Improve autism parents of Northeast Florida's awareness of services available in the community that meet their child's autism needs
  • Build long lasting and conducive partnerships with businesses, schools, local, state and national organizations that are willing to collaborate to assist parents and children with autism successfully transition in life and reach their full potential
  • Unit the Northeast Florida community for the 1st Annual World Autism Awareness Day/LIUB Kickoff and Autism Resource Fair
  • Unit the Northeast Florida community as we shine a light on autism through artwork at the the Art Touched By Autism Silent Auction Fundraiser
  • Provide 50 Nesel Pack Backpacks filled with school supplies and sensory items for our Fall of 2016 Back-To-School  Fill-A-Nesel Backpack Drive
  • Provide 500 hours of Applied Behavior Analyst (ABA) therapy to children receiving services at our center that cannot afford and/or on a waiting list for therapy
  • Design and launch our autism resource database website
  • Provide 100 of our Autism Team Organizers to parent's that are new to the spectrum that receive services at our center

Success of the Making Strides campaign will be gauged by:

  • Awareness being raised for autism and building stronger community relationships that aids in creating our autism coalition network in Northeast Florida
  • If the money raised covers the fees and the rewards we have promised and leaves enough for a high quality project or venture to be run
  • If enough money and community support and brand awareness is raised to launch the Making Strides for Autism Community Parent Resource Center and Autism Outreach Program
  • By the amount of community participation in the 1st Annual World Autism Awareness Day Kickoff/LIUB and Resource Fair at Hemming Plaza on Saturday, April 2, 2016 from 5-7pm sponsored by the City of Jacksonville’s Disability Service department
  • By the amount of community participation in the Art Touched By Autism Silent Auction Fundraiser. Wednesday, April 6th 5p - 6p during Art Walk. Part of the Downtown Cigar Lounge Art Initiative and Dialogue.  This is a silent auction filled with items from local artist and children with autism.
Rewards
Everyone loves to be rewarded for doing something good.  Your gift will assist Making Strides For Autism provide the following items for parents and children.

•Your gift of $25 will provide 5 MSFA Parent Autism Organizers. These binders help parents to minimize stress, maximize their time and create a system to stay organized.  Parents can store medical, school, legal, community resources, their autism team, childcare and information about their children in one central location, etc…

•Your gift of $50 will help us host training classes for autism family support group meetings.

•Your gift of $100 will cover half the cost of one autism team family planning session. These sessions help families develop a two-year action plan for their child.

•Your gift of $150 will cover the cost of one back to school Nesel Pack backpack and school supplies. These backpacks help children with autism excel in and out of the classroom.  You will also receive a Making Strides For Autism or Captain AUsome t-shirt.

•Your gift of $250 will cover half the expense of MSFA free community events for families of children with autism and related disabilities. You will also receive a Making Strides For Autism or Captain AUsome t-shirt.

•Your gift of $500 will provide one 1 hour Employ Autism Workshop to those professionals that would like to employ people with autism. These workshops include the MSFA Employ Autism Workbook for participants.  Businesses that complete the workshop will earn the MSFA Employ Autism certification. This certification signifies that their business is autism friendly. You will also receive a Making Strides For Autism or Captain AUsome t-shirt.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    Making Strides For Autism takes awareness and translates it into community action. The best way to help this cause is to share the project as fast as you can with social media, websites, friends, family, employers and businesses.  A share is PRICELESS!!  It not only to meets the stretch goals, but to spread awareness.

    Once the campaign is funded, all the money will go to the rewards, launching the Making Strides For Autism Community Parent Resource Center and Autism Youth Outreach Project, completion and maintenance of the Autism Strides resource website and app.

A Little Background





You may not realize it, but autism has probably touched the life of somebody
you know. Better yet, imagine receiving an autism diagnosis for your child.
What would you do? Who would you turn to for help and support? What about when they grow up; who will hire them?  How will they receive the skills needed to reach their full potential?  Early
identification, intensive therapy and transition services typically help these children and their
families overcome the educational challenges presented by autism, but this has
proven an overwhelming task for our autism resource providers in Northeast Florida to
undertake alone.
That’s where the Making Strides For Autism Parent Resource Center and Autism Youth Project come in.  Families are faced with fear, uncertainty,
and in many cases the feeling of being completely alone. We need YOUR
help to give parents of children with autism the parent to parent support they
need through support, training and advocacy programs. As well as assessing youth with autism's strengths and transition those strengths into a career which will allow them to live as independently as possible.

story: .

Hand-Made The Traditional Way

No problem if you're not a sailor. No problem if you're not a Viking. No problem if you're not from the Lord of the Rings. You can still relish the charm of Middle Ages with our Vintage Oak Mugs. Rustic & Stylish the mugs are hand made from over 21 hand processes and is a culmination of 20 different pieces put together the traditional way.

 

A Classic Piece You Would Treasure

It is not a decorative piece, it's made for actual drinking purpose. Made with
Genuine Oak Wood, this mug is food safe and leak proof. Unlike any other
mug, it can hold up to 550ml of beer (apart from the jealous stares of other
unfortunate souls with boring mugs). And besides looking cool, this mug actually
keeps your drink cooler, for a longer time than other drab mugs (made of glass).
It is safer and sturdier (compared with glass mugs that break accidentally) You can
even stand on them, or drive a car over it, the mug won’t break.

So are you finally ready to leave the puny mugs to tiny-sipping sissies and step-up to some real thirst quenching!

             

           

Each of our Mug goes through 21 unique steps to finally shape up in to a One of a kind Vintage Mug.

The binding process does not involve any nails or metal bolts on the inside to hold the wood. This  ensures no metal touches your beverage and rules out rusting of any kind. Its construction is very similar to the age old wine barrel construction.

The strips of wood are engineered in a way that only 2 thin rings on the outside are needed to hold it together. Some mug designs do not have metal rings or wooden handle, but they have a unique design for easy grip.

We insist every single detail of our product is perfect and hence each mug is inspected twice before it is shipped out.

We are particularly proud of our designs as they have a modern, solid, geometric, aesthetic look, while they still maintain the antique, raw feel.

The wood used to create the barrel mugs is Genuine Oak Wood which is furnace treated, which ensures that it is completely moisture-free and dry.

So sit back, and enjoy your drink in this wonderful mug. Worry -Free!

   

The Average Glass Mug keeps your Beer chilled for less than an hour, it starts
to warm up fast, as compared to our wooden mugs. Beer is enjoyed best
when you have it chilled. WoodTrim Mugs have 100% natural oak wood &
protective steel cup on the inner side, this keeps your drink chilled for the
longest duration, Naturally!

           

OPTIONAL FEATURES

Stainless Steel Cup
The wooden cups are perfectly safe for consumption although we do have an option to get a stainless steel cup fitted inside your barrel mug. You will have the option to choose whether you want a steel cup in your mug once the purchase has been made.

Engraving
Never mix your mug with anyone else’s again with the personalised barrel mug. You can now have your mug carved with a quote you like, your name or even a logo. We also have a large bank of design to choose from in case you can’t make up your mind on a design.
The engraving is done with a laser cutter and provides neat and precise results.

Nothing says best buds like a Personalised Beer Mug!
Share the Viking beer experience and spread the joy by gifting a mug. Our personalised mugs make great canvases for friends’ initials, sweet messages or even expressions of mutual love for beer. We’ve got you covered for all your festive and personal gifting needs as each mug is not only unique but also comes with the promise of good beer and great times. 

 

 

Disclaimer
Indiegogo won’t ask you to choose your mug/barrel when you contribute, but don’t worry. We will send you an email with a survey form within a week where you can choose your barrel/mug’s shape, steel cup and engraving.


Our Story

We are a small team of 4 people and our dream project has passed the conceptual stage. We've designed, developed, engineered, and rigorously tested a batch of all our products, sucessfully over the period of 2 years. This has been a ton of work, costly, and time consuming, but now that it's all completed, we are sure, we can deliver top quality products on time.

 

 

Why Use Sustainable Wood?

We have a love affair with wood. Wooden furniture, wooden doors, windows and other wood interior designs are commonplace in almost every home and office. The natural ambiance of wood products makes it a premier choice. From the time of the Aboriginal people till today.

There are several reasons why wood remains the natural choice.

  • Wood is a truly renewable resource that is grown by the sun. In sustainable   forests if forests are cut down to harvest wood new trees are planted to   renew the resource for the long term
  • Wood is a durable material that can last for generations
  • Wood enhances our surroundings by bringing warmth, spirituality, and connection to mother nature into our living spaces
  • Wood is versatile enabling us to maintain traditional looks, or create modern   sleek designs with our products.

Life cycle analysis and scientific studies have shown that using renewable resources such as wood helps the environment over the long term when compared to other materials, and compared to wood that is not sourced from sustainably managed forests.

 

 

Frequently Asked Questions:

How do I wash the cup? Wouldn’t water affect the wood?
Your barrel mug is completely sealed and requires no special care. Wash it by hand with mild soap and warm water. Do not let your mugsoak in water.
NEVER PUT YOUR MUG IN THE DISHWASHER OR MICROWAVE OVEN!

Is it safe to drink out of it?
Yes, it is safe to drink out of the barrel mugs. Each mug has passed our health and safety standards. It has a water-based food safe coating that makes the mug completely resistant to anything that you can survive drinking.

How durable is it? How long will it last?
Each mug is handcrafted from European White Oak which is known for its durability and strength. Show the mug some love and care and it will be your companion for life.

When and how do I choose my mug shape, stainless steel cup and engraving?
Indiegogo does not allow you to select your mug shape and specifications upfront, but you will receive an email within a week of your order that will allow you to pick your shape (with or without the stainless steel cup) and your engraving (from our bank of designs or a personalised one). 

How do I send my logo for engraving?
Within a week of your order we will send you an email asking you to select your barrel mug and its specification. Select the engraving option in the survey and send us your design or logo in an email to @woodtrim in these vector formats(.ai, .eps .cdr) We also have a large bank of design to choose from in case you can’t make up your mind on a design.

Can I sell your product?
Of course you can, drop us and email at support@woodtrim.in and we’re sure we can work something out.

Cheers!

Our StoryWe are a small team of 4 people and our dream project has passed the conceptual stage. We've designed, developed, engineered, and rigorously tested a batch of all our products, sucessfully over the period of 2 years. This has been a ton of work, costly, and time consuming, but now that it's all completed, we are sure, we can deliver top quality products on time.  Why Use Sustainable Wood?We have a love affair with wood. Wooden furniture, wooden doors, windows and other wood interior designs are commonplace in almost every home and office. The natural ambiance of wood products makes it a premier choice. From the time of the Aboriginal people till today.There are several reasons why wood remains the natural choice.
Wood is a truly renewable resource that is grown by the sun. In sustainable   forests if forests are cut down to harvest wood new trees are planted to   renew the resource for the long term
Wood is a durable material that can last for generations
Wood enhances our surroundings by bringing warmth, spirituality, and connection to mother nature into our living spaces
Wood is versatile enabling us to maintain traditional looks, or create modern   sleek designs with our products.
Life cycle analysis and scientific studies have shown that using renewable resources such as wood helps the environment over the long term when compared to other materials, and compared to wood that is not sourced from sustainably managed forests.  Frequently Asked Questions:How do I wash the cup? Wouldn’t water affect the wood?Your barrel mug is completely sealed and requires no special care. Wash it by hand with mild soap and warm water. Do not let your mugsoak in water.NEVER PUT YOUR MUG IN THE DISHWASHER OR MICROWAVE OVEN!Is it safe to drink out of it?Yes, it is safe to drink out of the barrel mugs. Each mug has passed our health and safety standards. It has a water-based food safe coating that makes the mug completely resistant to anything that you can survive drinking.How durable is it? How long will it last?Each mug is handcrafted from European White Oak which is known for its durability and strength. Show the mug some love and care and it will be your companion for life.When and how do I choose my mug shape, stainless steel cup and engraving?Indiegogo does not allow you to select your mug shape and specifications upfront, but you will receive an email within a week of your order that will allow you to pick your shape (with or without the stainless steel cup) and your engraving (from our bank of designs or a personalised one). How do I send my logo for engraving?Within a week of your order we will send you an email asking you to select your barrel mug and its specification. Select the engraving option in the survey and send us your design or logo in an email to @woodtrim in these vector formats(.ai, .eps .cdr) We also have a large bank of design to choose from in case you can’t make up your mind on a design.Can I sell your product?Of course you can, drop us and email at support@woodtrim.in and we’re sure we can work something out.Cheers!

story:
Make Our House a Home

Southwest Creations Collaborative (SCC) is a industrial sewing social enterprise based in Albuquerque, NM.

We were founded in in 1994 as a sewing and handwork poverty alleviation project with a single goal: to provide dignified, living-wage employment to women from low-income communities. We implement strategies from projects around the world that recognize when a woman is given an opportunity to earn an income, she will invest in her children and family first.

For many years, Southwest Creations has dreamed of a new house. A house where we would have room to expand, to thrive, to grow. Now our dream has come true. Our new house in the South Valley Social Enterprise Center will include expanded manufacturing space, a larger daycare, a loading dock and space for our Hacia: Toward the University K-12 family engagement and educational programs. 

And, at our heart, we love to sew, so as a supporter of our Make Our House a Home Campaign, you'll have access to wonderful perks. All the goods, designed by KinStitch and sewn by SCC, are available exclusively through this campaign.

$100 Four Napkins OR Two Tea Towels
$250 One Apron
$500 One Table Runner and Two Tea Towels
$1,000 One Pouf, Two Tea Towels, Four Napkins
$2,500 The Entire Set

Why Should You Support Southwest Creations?

All SCC employees are paid a living wage and have access to affordable on-site childcare, educational opportunities and paid School Involvement Leave, which means they don’t have to choose between receiving a paycheck and engaging in their children’s education. 

We also believe it is our responsibility to ensure our employees have up-to-date skills, which are vital for family stability. We created leadership and employability programs that provide both on and off-site opportunities for employees to improve their English, prepare for the GED, and build skills in facilitation, leadership, tutoring and program oversight.

Using the revenues from our sewing, we created Hacia: Toward the University (Hacia), our vehicle to apply our best practices to impact the greater community. Hacia is a two-generation family engagement program that inspires and supports whole families as they navigate the pipeline from Pre-K to higher education.

Now, we're moving to a new home at the South Valley Social Enterprise Center.  The Center will allow us to expand our business and continue our transformative work with our employees, our children and the community through Hacia.

Every dollar contributed to this campaign will help guarantee we can hit the ground running in our new home and continue to provide great jobs through our industrial sewing and great programs through our Hacia: Toward the University initiatives.

Want to support Southwest Creations but don't want a perk? You can do that here.

Please spread the word about our campaign and help us Make Our House a Home!

 

Thanks to Los Poblanos Historic Inn & Organic Farm for providing the beautiful setting for our perk photography and thanks to photographer Pat Vasquez-Cunningham.

story:
Beloved Friends and Supporters of Everglow Yoga & Wellness

 

As you may know, Everglow has had to close it's doors due to the advent of COVID19. At this moment, which is filled with uncertainty for us all, the future of Everglow is in jeopardy, not to mention the livelihoods of those of us who create and run the space day-to-day.

We have put so much love and time into creating this community space, and would love to continue playing out our dreams, supporting and encouraging all of you and yours on the other side of this pandemic. Now, we ask for your support and shares and LOVE so we may get there together!

 

What we need, and what You get

 

We need to raise a minimum of $28,000 to cover lost revenue from being unable to use the studio space. Classes must stop for now, but our financial obligations and basic expenses do not. This is a challenge!! Your contributions will help pay for rent, teachers, staff, inventory, accounting and legal expenses--it will literally give us solid ground to stand on. 

 

If you decide to purchase something from the campaign you will support the studio financially right away. You can also help to create awareness for the studio when you post pictures of your studio-branded threads and wear them out in the world when we resume our normal activities. Tag us on Instagram with @everglowyogastudiokc  and like/share our Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/everglowyoga

 

Harmony has invested her entire nest egg in this venture, so she believes wholeheartedly in Everglow’s mission and ability to not only survive this closure, but thrive beyond it! She also recognizes the need for additional support at this critical time, in order to secure and pay for all the services that are required in running a small local business.  There are perks for donating, and we thank you sincerely for looking at all the amazing offers we have for you. We are still working out how exactly to navigate that through this uncertain time, as we do not yet know how long this will actually last.  Nonetheless, our main goal is to see all of your shining faces upon reopening - to continue to yoga together, support one another in our collective journeys, and continue building community. Your support will keep this dream alive.

 

Perks!! (beyond Savasana…;)

 

We don’t expect that you’ll donate for nothing, (although of course you are welcome to!) This is an energy exchange, and you won’t walk away feeling “without”. Everglow has a LOT to offer!

 

Even if you can’t make it to our Grand RE-Opening party (when the State of KS says we can!) With a contribution of just $100 you can receive 1 month in our Virtual Studio, an Everglow Tank Top, and 4 classes to use for yourself or gift to a friend when we re-open! Check out all our other perks, including discounted gift cards, Class Packages, Memberships, and Spa Services! You don't want to miss out on these amazing deals.

 

What you help us achieve

 

Yoga is a path to true health and wellness, helping its practitioners find peace by mindfully connecting with their breath. Scientifically speaking, Yoga is a proven method to boost overall fitness, heart health, lower blood pressure, cholesterol and blood sugar. Many practitioners develop a better body image, as the focus in Yoga is not so much on the external body; but the inner workings of the mind and heart. This mindfulness eventually extends to all areas of life, including eating more mindfully—which often results in weight loss as a natural extension of a regular Yoga practice.

 

By supporting Everglow in our mission to continue helping others find the benefits of a regular Yoga practice, you’re supporting so many individuals in their quest for a healthy life. We are all in this together!! We at Everglow have an opportunity to share this ancient (yet modern) practice with people from so many different walks of life, and we are SO grateful to have the opportunity to put our dream out there and share it with you!

 

But it’s only possible through your support.

 

The Impact

 

Yoga + Wellness = Wholehearted Healthy Living!!

 

Your contribution to Everglow, no matter how big or small cannot be understated. Everglow is founded on the tenants of non-violence, truthfulness, righteousness, wisdom, devotion, study, and listening.

 

This is a business, but it is also a labor of love!! It is an offering to our growing community as a whole, but we at Everglow truly believe it goes beyond that. By contributing to our core mission, you contribute to the health and wellness of people from all walks of life! Yourself included. It is our firm belief that the more people who are able to be introduced to a mindful wellness practice, the better our entire world will be. The beneficial impact is far reaching.

 

Risks & Challenges

 

There is a high initial cost of opening and running a boutique yoga studio & wellness center, even here in the Heartland. So many on our team have invested faith, time, effort, money, and skill to get us this far—raising capitol now simply ensures that our time and those resources won’t be lost in the wake of COVID-19 and the ensuing shut-down.

 

Your funding is critical to our success. Yoga Studios are not inherently known as big money makers, but in success they cultivate vibrant and vital communities, offer space for great personal growth, and give back to their communities whenever possible; all because we care so deeply about people.

 

Growth

 

We have a wonderful opportunity to continue to grow in a rapidly expanding area of South Overland Park, nearby the brand new BluHawk development—where we are soon to see an indoor multi-sport complex, as well as a Civic Center/Arena. Not to mention the new hotels, restaurants, and outlet shopping all planned for this incredible area that is already thriving with many housing developments and apartment complexes. 

 

We know this is a wise and well timed investment, not only for the neighborhood, but for those of you who already know the power of Yoga and it’s teachings—who wish to continue to breathe new life and growth into sharing it’s practice and amazing benefits with the world.

 

Our teachers and their teachers have put so much time and energy into their own practice, teaching, and personal growth. We feel it is our responsibility to continue to share, learn, and honor what they have intelligently and graciously given to us. We look forward to sharing and serving in our community for many years to come!

 

Other ways to Contribute

 

We know some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

Please share this with those who you think can make a monetary contribution. Whether that's via email, through social media, or even right here on Indiegogo!

Please let us know if you are present and willing to make karma yoga (service) contributions in Kansas: we still need skilled assistance in social media,  graphics, marketing and getting the word out...every little bit helps!

Send your friends and family and loved ones our way. Please make some noise, and find a way to share this with everyone you know who may find themselves in Kansas City...and remind them to come visit us and pass it forward. Beyond that--come to class, and support your local studio and teachers! 

 

About Harmony:

 

 Harmony has a love for Yoga that goes far beyond her 200 E-RYT training. She began her Yoga practice at home many years ago. Around 2012 she decided to finally join a local studio, wherein she uncovered her true self (beneath layers of social conditioning), and the transformative nature of Yoga. 

 

This ancient practice remains true to its roots, yet is constantly evolving…as modern culture adapts, and methodologies differ. Harmony offers in her classes an essential blend of traditional Yogic philosophy, as well as integrating a modern vibe and functional fitness training, with a strong emphasis on alignment. As a certified mat Pilates teacher and Yoga instructor, she enjoys teaching fusion classes that are both fun and formative, with an emphasis on core stability and strength. This offers those who may not have otherwise tried Yoga, an opportunity to grow physically as well as mentally, leaning into the benefits of a mindful breath and movement practice. 

 

With well over 2000 hours of Yoga teaching under her belt, and countless more practicing as a student, she believes wholeheartedly in the power of mindful movement. In June of 2018 Harmony received her Yoga for First Responders certification, and now hopes to work with local law enforcement, firefighters, and EMT’s. She truly believes Yoga is for everybody, and it is her life mission to create and cultivate a truly conscious, vibrant and diverse community here at Everglow. 

 

Harmony is also a licensed Esthetican, specializing in customized organic facial services. She loves helping people find their glow, from the inside out! Whether that’s through Yoga, Skincare, and/or other healthy living practices; it is her goal to help people uncover their Light and most importantly—SHARE it!!!
