story:
How You Can Help FINANCIALLY

Click the pink BACK IT button located just under our video. 

 There are TWO WAYS you can contribute. 

The first option is to click BACK IT and select an amount in the contributions box and hit continue.  These are DONATIONS!  They are NOT associated with perks (although we promise to shower you with love!)

 

 Every little bit from 10 dollars to 10 thousand dollars helps and gets us closer to our goals.  

The second option is to select one of our amazing perks that has a price point attached.  You can either click a perk on the right hand of the screen or find the perks listed underneath the contribute button once you click BACK IT. 

*NOTE THAT WE WOULD ALSO BE OPEN TO TALKING THROUGH TERMS OF A PERSONAL LOAN OR PARTNERSHIP*

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know the past year has been a strange and challenging one, and some of you may not have the means to contribute financially to this campaign at this time. That doesn’t mean you aren’t a part of Plus Size Pretty community. Follow us on social media (@plussizeprettyboutique), and share our shop news and posts with your friends! Help us get people excited about what’s to come — that is invaluable. You can use the tools right on this Indiegogo page to share this campaign, as well, and urge people you know who are looking for the environment we’re cultivating at Plus Size Pretty to engage! 

We are so grateful for the community members we have already connected with, and the enthusiasm we’ve seen across the country for Plus Size Pretty. We cannot wait to see you all there this summer.

You can also reach out to us about donating Plus Size Clothing.  We will take all donations and take any items we will not sell in our shop to other nonprofits in the city.

Last, we are women of faith who believe in the power of prayer.  Please pray for wisdom and courage for our leadership team and more importantly, pray for that each person who comes into our shop would feel loved and lovely and begin to see themselves as the magnificent creatures they were created to be.

 What is Plus Size Pretty?

Plus Size Pretty Consignment Boutique will be a plus size consignment store where community members can gather, shop for the latest trends, get styled by one of our trained stylists, find the courage to try new trends, join a cocktail book club, attend a plus-size yoga session, and participate in a workshop to truly understand self-care, self love, and what it means to be body positive.  We are ready to build this, but we need your support.

*Picture of the Plus Size Pretty Storefront*

Leadership

Founder Jamie Lee Quickert has loved fashion from the time she put on her mama’s high-heels and her dad’s oversized tee-shirt as a little girl and strutted down the imaginary runway in her living room. Like most little girls, as she grew up and she became more aware of her own body and her size. Constantly comparing herself to her smaller peers and unable to find the same quality fashions in her size, Jamie became more insecure about her body. She began to dress to cover parts she was ashamed of instead of dressing in clothes and colors she loved.  

After surviving an abusive relationship,  a sexual assault, and a suicide attempt that left her confidence shattered and caused significant weight gain, Jamie began to pick up the pieces and rethink how she saw herself and others.

Since then Jamie has made it her mission to embolden and empower women of all sizes and to encourage them to see their inner and outer beauty.

Jamie has become a nationally known business leader and public speaker.  As a volunteer for Dress for Success, a member of the Business Journals Women’s Leadership Council, and a 40 Under 40 winner,she is passionate about giving women a hand up and encouraging them personally and professionally.  Jamie will use her background in sales, marketing and events to run the marketing, online presence, and community programs.  Jamie will lead the overall vision and control the brand as CEO while her partner runs the day to day operations of the store.

*Founder Jamie Quickert standing outside of her storefront at 924 West Broad Street*

COO Samantha (Sam) Saunders grew up trying to hide her body under baggy clothes and being ashamed of the fact that she was larger than so many of her peers. As she tells the story “An afternoon at Jamie’s family pool changed my life. I had on an oversized swim shirt and bathing suit bottoms. After a short conversation about body image, Jamie pulled me out of the pool and told me to come with her. 

Jamie handed me a bikini top and told me to try it on.  I told her that I was fat and could not wear it.  She laughed and replied “You can wear anything you want to wear”

We spent the afternoon laughing and having an impromptu photoshoot. A few days later Jamie took me shopping and helped me pick out a new wardrobe that highlighted my shape instead of hide it. I was hooked. I felt beautiful and empowered and wanted other women to feel the same”

Having a background working with broken and hurting women as the Ministry Lead at Gracehaven Sam was already passionate about empowering and encouraging women. Knowing they wanted to open up a consignment store for Plus Size women, Sam left her job and began management training at Torrid, a Plus-Size Specialty Store.  She also works as a Stylist for Stitch Fix. Sam will use her background in leadership and retail sales as the COO and will run the day-to-day business of the shop

(Picture of Sam in her first Bikini!)

We daily imagine Plus Size Pretty once it opens: music drifting from our open doors to a bustling Broad Street, sun filling the room and cozy candles creating a welcoming atmosphere, squeals of delight from our clients as they find treasured pieces, laughter, and tears and honest conversations as we build community and encourage and empower women to love themselves just as they are.

 

We have a beautiful vision for this place — help us make it a reality.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We have chosen to crowdfund our $16,000 - $60,000 start-up capital need because as small business owners and female entrepreneurs we know we will be indebted to someone when it comes to the funds we need.

We would prefer to be indebted to the community that our space will be used and loved by once it is established.

It speaks to our desire to be a community hub - instead of being backed by a singular lender, we will be backed by a collective of shoppers, social media followers, friends, family and neighbors.

 

In return for your financial support, we’ve built out some great incentives at different tiers of giving.   Perks can also be given back to the shop to use for our work with nonprofits or given as gifts. 

 

CONTRIBUTIONS

Every little bit helps!  From $10 to $10,000 you can help us make our vision a reality!  Each level comes with a special Plus Size Pretty perk. 

Flamingo Friends (≤$50)

Boutique Besties  ($51-$100)​

Stylish Supporters ($101-$150

Pink Partners  ($151-$250)​

High Heel Helpers  ($251-$500)

Designer Doners ​($501-$1000)​

Leopard Print Legends ($1,001-$2,500)

Beautiful Benefactors ($2,501-$5,000)

Pretty Patrons ($5,001-$10,000)

GOAT (≥$10,000)
 

A key piece of the financial legwork is already underway: We are grateful and fortunate to have found a well-established and beloved neighborhood diner to lease the space in the building next door to them at an affordable rate. If we don’t reach our entire goal through this campaign, we will explore secondary options for completing the capital raise, and the funds raised through this campaign will still go towards the opening of PLUS SIZE PRETTY 

Lending your financial support to our capital raise first and foremost means that we will be able to execute our vision for a beautiful boutique consignment store where community members can gather, shop for the latest trends, find the courage to try new styles, join a cocktail book club, attend a plus size yoga session, and participate in a workshop to truly understand self-care, self love, and what it means to be body positive.  We are ready to build this, but we need your support.

The money raised through this campaign will contribute towards: 

  • Purchasing an initial inventory of clothes, shoes and accessories
  • Funding a fashion specific point of sale system that will ensure efficiency in inventory processing and facilitate comprehensive online sales capability while seamlessly integrating with brick-and-mortar sales
  • Marketing Plan, Website Design, Logos
  • Signage for Store Front
  • Lawyer Fees and Licensing
  • Establishing a budget for furnishing and outfitting the space, including purchasing shoe racks, display tables, clothing racks, mirrors, rugs, paint, wallpaper, and décor.
  • Speaking of the decor, these funds will also help us in funding a local artist who is already dreaming up truly inspiring and joyful artwork.
  • Funding security upgrades to the store
  • Paying for the first half of the year rent until we establish profitability
  • Funding the initial salary of a full-time manager for the store to ensure consistent and professional operations

The Impact

We are ready to hit the ground running, and our goal is to open the shop on AUGUST 7th!  Your support for this campaign will make this timeline possible. In order to ensure we have a robust inventory of the clothes, shoes and accessories our shoppers want, we have to make an investment. In order to ensure we are prepared to start a business, we have to identify and purchase the right equipment. In order to ensure that our customers feel welcomed and inspired by the space we cultivate, we have to find comfortable and beautiful furnishings and fixtures. We want to build a place Franklinton and Columbus will be proud of and excited to visit, and that takes not just a great vision, but also resources. 

Columbus needs a Plus-Size Consignment Shop. More so, Columbus needs the type of space where those who have felt overlook feel valued and special, and where revenue generates more benefit for the community.

Our other goal in pursuing start-up funding in this manner is to ensure that any financial success we see in the store means that we can execute more of our vision for our community: bringing in experts to lead panel discussions; small classes on health and nutrition that are informative while still encouraging those in attendance to love themselves and their bodies;  author events, book club and other community gatherings for readers; plus size yoga classes, paint nights, fashion shows and all the other ideas we have brewing. In addition to keeping a roof over the store, the lights on, and the racks stocked, the more of our revenue we don’t have to use for loan or interest payments to a bank or a major investor, the more of it we can use to create space, events, and memories for our community. You can make that possible by giving to this campaign.

 

Risks & Challenges

Brick-and-mortar is expensive, so we are dramatically scaling our business to be able to make this happen. We are both confident and cautious!  Thankfully, we are situated in TWO thriving industries, have the strong support of our community, and benefit from Jamie and Sam’s experience and high energy along with invaluable advice and mentorship from those already in Plus Size resale business and other entrepreneurs.

Plus Size Pretty envisions a unique space within two thriving industries – clothing resale and plus-size fashion.

Secondhand apparel, offline and online, is an $28 billion industry in the USA. According to the report published by Allied Market Research, “Plus Size clothing Market garnered $480.99 billion globally in 2019 and is anticipated to reach $696.71 billion by 2027, growing at a CAGR of 5.9% during the forecast period. 

While all business is risky we do see an upward trend in both of our market segments. Plus, while brick-and-mortar is declining in some areas, it is actually in a state of growth for many plus-size fashion retailers.

 

Jamie Quickert, founder of Plus Size Pretty has both the knowledge and passion to successfully grow her business.  With a variety of experience in fashion, sales, training & development, and a variety of other areas, Jamie is uniquely suited to oversee this vision. Jamie’s high-energy and excitement is coupled with a strategic mind, strong work ethic, and uncompromising values.  She is building an amazing team of hands-on leadership starting with COO Samantha Saunders

 

 

Thank you so much for taking the time to read our story and for being a part of this chapter. We could not do it without you!

Stylishly Yours,

Jamie and Sam
story_txt:
How You Can Help FINANCIALLYClick the pink BACK IT button located just under our video.  There are TWO WAYS you can contribute. The first option is to click BACK IT and select an amount in the contributions box and hit continue.  These are DONATIONS!  They are NOT associated with perks (although we promise to shower you with love!)  Every little bit from 10 dollars to 10 thousand dollars helps and gets us closer to our goals.  The second option is to select one of our amazing perks that has a price point attached.  You can either click a perk on the right hand of the screen or find the perks listed underneath the contribute button once you click BACK IT. *NOTE THAT WE WOULD ALSO BE OPEN TO TALKING THROUGH TERMS OF A PERSONAL LOAN OR PARTNERSHIP* Other Ways You Can HelpWe know the past year has been a strange and challenging one, and some of you may not have the means to contribute financially to this campaign at this time. That doesn’t mean you aren’t a part of Plus Size Pretty community. Follow us on social media (@plussizeprettyboutique), and share our shop news and posts with your friends! Help us get people excited about what’s to come — that is invaluable. You can use the tools right on this Indiegogo page to share this campaign, as well, and urge people you know who are looking for the environment we’re cultivating at Plus Size Pretty to engage! We are so grateful for the community members we have already connected with, and the enthusiasm we’ve seen across the country for Plus Size Pretty. We cannot wait to see you all there this summer.You can also reach out to us about donating Plus Size Clothing.  We will take all donations and take any items we will not sell in our shop to other nonprofits in the city.Last, we are women of faith who believe in the power of prayer.  Please pray for wisdom and courage for our leadership team and more importantly, pray for that each person who comes into our shop would feel loved and lovely and begin to see themselves as the magnificent creatures they were created to be. What is Plus Size Pretty?Plus Size Pretty Consignment Boutique will be a plus size consignment store where community members can gather, shop for the latest trends, get styled by one of our trained stylists, find the courage to try new trends, join a cocktail book club, attend a plus-size yoga session, and participate in a workshop to truly understand self-care, self love, and what it means to be body positive.  We are ready to build this, but we need your support.*Picture of the Plus Size Pretty Storefront*LeadershipFounder Jamie Lee Quickert has loved fashion from the time she put on her mama’s high-heels and her dad’s oversized tee-shirt as a little girl and strutted down the imaginary runway in her living room. Like most little girls, as she grew up and she became more aware of her own body and her size. Constantly comparing herself to her smaller peers and unable to find the same quality fashions in her size, Jamie became more insecure about her body. She began to dress to cover parts she was ashamed of instead of dressing in clothes and colors she loved.  After surviving an abusive relationship,  a sexual assault, and a suicide attempt that left her confidence shattered and caused significant weight gain, Jamie began to pick up the pieces and rethink how she saw herself and others.Since then Jamie has made it her mission to embolden and empower women of all sizes and to encourage them to see their inner and outer beauty.Jamie has become a nationally known business leader and public speaker.  As a volunteer for Dress for Success, a member of the Business Journals Women’s Leadership Council, and a 40 Under 40 winner,she is passionate about giving women a hand up and encouraging them personally and professionally.  Jamie will use her background in sales, marketing and events to run the marketing, online presence, and community programs.  Jamie will lead the overall vision and control the brand as CEO while her partner runs the day to day operations of the store.*Founder Jamie Quickert standing outside of her storefront at 924 West Broad Street*COO Samantha (Sam) Saunders grew up trying to hide her body under baggy clothes and being ashamed of the fact that she was larger than so many of her peers. As she tells the story “An afternoon at Jamie’s family pool changed my life. I had on an oversized swim shirt and bathing suit bottoms. After a short conversation about body image, Jamie pulled me out of the pool and told me to come with her. Jamie handed me a bikini top and told me to try it on.  I told her that I was fat and could not wear it.  She laughed and replied “You can wear anything you want to wear” We spent the afternoon laughing and having an impromptu photoshoot. A few days later Jamie took me shopping and helped me pick out a new wardrobe that highlighted my shape instead of hide it. I was hooked. I felt beautiful and empowered and wanted other women to feel the same”Having a background working with broken and hurting women as the Ministry Lead at Gracehaven Sam was already passionate about empowering and encouraging women. Knowing they wanted to open up a consignment store for Plus Size women, Sam left her job and began management training at Torrid, a Plus-Size Specialty Store.  She also works as a Stylist for Stitch Fix. Sam will use her background in leadership and retail sales as the COO and will run the day-to-day business of the shop(Picture of Sam in her first Bikini!)We daily imagine Plus Size Pretty once it opens: music drifting from our open doors to a bustling Broad Street, sun filling the room and cozy candles creating a welcoming atmosphere, squeals of delight from our clients as they find treasured pieces, laughter, and tears and honest conversations as we build community and encourage and empower women to love themselves just as they are. We have a beautiful vision for this place — help us make it a reality.  What We Need & What You GetWe have chosen to crowdfund our $16,000 - $60,000 start-up capital need because as small business owners and female entrepreneurs we know we will be indebted to someone when it comes to the funds we need.We would prefer to be indebted to the community that our space will be used and loved by once it is established.It speaks to our desire to be a community hub - instead of being backed by a singular lender, we will be backed by a collective of shoppers, social media followers, friends, family and neighbors. In return for your financial support, we’ve built out some great incentives at different tiers of giving.   Perks can also be given back to the shop to use for our work with nonprofits or given as gifts.  CONTRIBUTIONSEvery little bit helps!  From $10 to $10,000 you can help us make our vision a reality!  Each level comes with a special Plus Size Pretty perk. Flamingo Friends (≤$50)Boutique Besties  ($51-$100)​Stylish Supporters ($101-$150Pink Partners  ($151-$250)​High Heel Helpers  ($251-$500)Designer Doners ​($501-$1000)​Leopard Print Legends ($1,001-$2,500)Beautiful Benefactors ($2,501-$5,000)Pretty Patrons ($5,001-$10,000)GOAT (≥$10,000) A key piece of the financial legwork is already underway: We are grateful and fortunate to have found a well-established and beloved neighborhood diner to lease the space in the building next door to them at an affordable rate. If we don’t reach our entire goal through this campaign, we will explore secondary options for completing the capital raise, and the funds raised through this campaign will still go towards the opening of PLUS SIZE PRETTY Lending your financial support to our capital raise first and foremost means that we will be able to execute our vision for a beautiful boutique consignment store where community members can gather, shop for the latest trends, find the courage to try new styles, join a cocktail book club, attend a plus size yoga session, and participate in a workshop to truly understand self-care, self love, and what it means to be body positive.  We are ready to build this, but we need your support.The money raised through this campaign will contribute towards:

Funding a fashion specific point of sale system that will ensure efficiency in inventory processing and facilitate comprehensive online sales capability while seamlessly integrating with brick-and-mortar sales
Marketing Plan, Website Design, Logos
Signage for Store Front
Lawyer Fees and Licensing

Speaking of the decor, these funds will also help us in funding a local artist who is already dreaming up truly inspiring and joyful artwork.

story:
Short Summary

Hi! Hopefully you’ve already watched our campaign video so we can skip past the “I’m Annie” and “I’m Luke” part. But in all honesty, we want to give you a little insight into who we are and what we’re up to:

 

Both born and raised in Columbus OH, each with a little time elsewhere (Chicago and Houston, respectively), we have spent a combined 30 years working in the food/beverage/hospitality industry. We have served Columbus at some of the top establishments, been a part of countless restaurant and bar openings, and trained bartenders and servers across the city. We have proudly come to the realization that this is our path and our profession, and we had better start working for ourselves!

 

So what is Law Bird? In short it’s our dream for both ourselves and the hungry (thirsty) and passionate consumers here in Columbus. We’ve been joking that we are opening our dream bar that we’ll never get to visit, and while that’s partly true, it’s not for us, it’s for YOU. We are working to create an exceptional space for our guests to come try new things, find unique favorites, and genuinely enjoy the curated selection of wine, cocktails, and small plates we have put together.

 

Why are we doing an Indiegogo Campaign? For us, this is the difference between being truly able to execute our vision and having to make unwanted quality based sacrifices. Like we said in the video: “It’s not necessarily about the finer things, but the right things”. So we’re not talking about picking $18/sf tile (although it was gorgeous!) but more along the lines of bringing all the details together and creating a cohesive and beautiful experience for you.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are here to raise $30,000. Some of that money is going to go to a little bit of everything: the padding and upholstery on the back of the bench seats, barstools, the actual bar itself. We are working to do this the right way, and in some areas that means doing a lot ourselves (making the table tops, painting the space), but there are definitely things we are leaving to the professionals (you know like plumbing, electrical, building walls). But it is also going to pay for changes required by the city. We've already been handed one $10k To-Do list from the City of Columbus and because we want to have more than 40 of you in the bar at a time, and we want to be able to use our basement for storage, we forked it all over. All in all, there are things we know will happen, that we have planned for. It's the unknown that we don't know about!

 

What’s in it for you? Well, while we are working to make the space incredible for everyone, we want to make sure that we offer some EXTRA amazing perks for those of you who help make it happen. Yes, this includes swag, but more importantly we wanted to offer personally curated experiences as well.

 

One of our mottos is that we serve people, not cocktails, and what this means to us is that we are here to serve  YOU, not just whatever we’re putting in a glass for you. Want to learn more about any beverage related topic (fermentation 101, what is mezcal?, what is this new “orange wine” category?, what makes Japanese whisky so special?) - then pick the “Up Close & Personal” perk and we will work create a two hour master class for you and three friends on the topic of your choosing. We want to get to know you better, so that we may serve you better.

 

The Impact

Why this and why here? Columbus is primed for new and exciting concepts made FOR Columbus residents BY Columbus residents. We are truly excited to be a part of the South High strip of the Brewery District, adding to the incredible other local businesses there that we LOVE (Antiques On High, Ambrose & Eve, Smoked On High, Daily Growler, ect). We know that Law Bird will round out the offering in the area, wholly complimenting the other businesses, as well as help to create a new destination district within Columbus. 

Why wine, cocktails, and snacks? Because we're crazy about them and we're pretty sure you are too! In short, these are the things that we love and we believe that we can offer an experience unlike any that exists in Columbus.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone has the ability to donate, and that’s ok! What we do ask is that you share your excitement, our story, our video, and our campaign. Help us spread the word, which will only help spread the love too! Also, if you’re not already, follow along on Instagram @LawBirdBar for all sorts of updates and sneak peeks!

story:
Short Summary

Our cabin is 90% finished and nearly ready for guest to enjoy our private little paradise. However, there are a few things we need your help and support with so we're offering pre-bookings in order to keep the ball rolling and open our doors sooner for you guys!

We will be offering pre-booking subject to availability. Please contact us first via instagram and let us know which dates you require before proceeding with any contributions.

About US

Just a 2 min walk from the glistening Enchanted River and within a 10 minute walk of the famous Cambugahay Falls, our cabin offers a naturally-built bamboo retreat for those looking for something unique.

With no immediate neighbors, the cabin provides a relaxed, rustic and utterly private space to enjoy the mindfulness of the stunning surroundings, while offering convenient access to some of Siquijor’s most beautiful attractions and some of the island’s best kept secrets.

 

Wifi ✔

Hot water ✔

Private landscape garden ✔

Outdoor cinema✔

Fire/BBQ Pit ✔

Indoor cooking facilities ✔

Refrigerator ✔ 

King size bed ✔

Garden lounging areas ✔

Jungle shower✔

Neighboring Enchanted river ✔

Recycling facilities  ✔

 

Note: The cabin is in a small valley and you have to walk down a small hill to reach the entrance. The entrance itself is about 70m from the road with a 25m decline to get down to the house.  For most people this won't be an issue but we would like to mention it for those who may be physically unfit or elderly may prefer somewhere with easier access. 

Availability

During your stay you will be met by our local host, who will show you the property. The host lives nearby if any problems arise but please remember we're not a hotel.

Neighbourhood 

Situated in the hillside just 1km north of Lazi town centre, guests can relax in the landscape garden, prepare fresh seafood or vegan food from the local vegetable market or use the rope-swing at the nearby enchanted river.  

It is a short 3 minute scooter ride to the local town. Where you can find all the amenities you need. A 10-15 minute riverside walk will lead you to one of the island’s most beautiful attractions, Cambugahay Falls with its cool mountain spring water and turquoise-coloured pools.

Lazi itself is a quaint little town, largely unaffected by tourism. Home to the national heritage site ✞ San Isidro Church and Convent ✞ along with some interesting local architecture, Lazi has heaps of character and photo opportunities. Bakeries and the local wet market sell fresh bread and local produce daily, while cute little cafes offer up freshly brewed coffee, shakes and local dishes along with some western comfort foods too.

For the more adventurous traveler, underwater caves, hidden pools, rice paddies and local farming communities are abundantly dotted around the surrounding area and while some are signposted others, you'll have to discover yourself - ideal for those who like to explore.

Getting around 

While staying at the cabin, we recommend that our guests consider renting a scooter to get around the surrounding valleys and coastal roads. 

Outside of Lazi itself, a 20 minute ride east will take you to some of the island’s most hidden beaches, mahogany forests and the super photogenic Salagdoong cliff diving spot.

30-40 minutes west, meanwhile, will lead you to the beachfront town of San Juan for white sandy beaches and great fresh, local eats.

Getting here

For international travelers we recommend that you fly into Dumaguete airport (which involves a transit in Manila) and then get the fast craft to Siquijor island.

To get from the airport to the ferry you can either take a taxi or a tricycle which takes about 10 mins (fair should be 150-200PHP). There are numourous ferries that run between Dumaguete & Siquijor but please let us know what time your flight arrives so we can advise.

Once on the island, renting a scooter is easy and by far the best way to get around.

What We Need & What You Get

Our house is complete with electric, running water and most importantly, a good internet connection! Here's what we have left to complete

  • Our garden is 70% finished but we need to finish the fence and add some finishing touches
  • Our cinema areas has a screen (and projector) but no sand and seating just yet. 
  • We need to make a bed and add homely elements to our sleeping space.
  • Our kitchen is done but needs all those final finishing touches
  • Our entrance is accessible but we're making a path for a scooter and need to add lights. 

The Impact

With your contribution and pre-bookings we can help to complete our goals and open our doors to you wonderfully adventurous people. We've worked so hard on making something special and we need your help to make our dreams come to life.

Challenges

Our challenges are small and mostly to do with time . We would love to see our space occupied and with so much interest online would like to offer potential guest a way of pre-booking in exchange for a little helping hand in the funding department.

Realistically, we believe that we can open doors on the the 8th of February 

Other Ways You Can Help

Any other contributions, ideas and physical support are all welcome.

It is a short 3 minute scooter ride to the local town. Where you can find all the amenities you need. A 10-15 minute riverside walk will lead you to one of the island’s most beautiful attractions, Cambugahay Falls with its cool mountain spring water and turquoise-coloured pools.
Lazi itself is a quaint little town, largely unaffected by tourism. Home to the national heritage site ✞ San Isidro Church and Convent ✞ along with some interesting local architecture, Lazi has heaps of character and photo opportunities. Bakeries and the local wet market sell fresh bread and local produce daily, while cute little cafes offer up freshly brewed coffee, shakes and local dishes along with some western comfort foods too.
For the more adventurous traveler, underwater caves, hidden pools, rice paddies and local farming communities are abundantly dotted around the surrounding area and while some are signposted others, you'll have to discover yourself - ideal for those who like to explore.
Getting around 
While staying at the cabin, we recommend that our guests consider renting a scooter to get around the surrounding valleys and coastal roads. 
Outside of Lazi itself, a 20 minute ride east will take you to some of the island’s most hidden beaches, mahogany forests and the super photogenic Salagdoong cliff diving spot.
30-40 minutes west, meanwhile, will lead you to the beachfront town of San Juan for white sandy beaches and great fresh, local eats.
Getting here
For international travelers we recommend that you fly into Dumaguete airport (which involves a transit in Manila) and then get the fast craft to Siquijor island.
To get from the airport to the ferry you can either take a taxi or a tricycle which takes about 10 mins (fair should be 150-200PHP). There are numourous ferries that run between Dumaguete & Siquijor but please let us know what time your flight arrives so we can advise.
Once on the island, renting a scooter is easy and by far the best way to get around.

What We Need & What You Get
Our house is complete with electric, running water and most importantly, a good internet connection! Here's what we have left to complete

Our garden is 70% finished but we need to finish the fence and add some finishing touches
Our cinema areas has a screen (and projector) but no sand and seating just yet. 
We need to make a bed and add homely elements to our sleeping space.
Our kitchen is done but needs all those final finishing touches
Our entrance is accessible but we're making a path for a scooter and need to add lights. 


The Impact
With your contribution and pre-bookings we can help to complete our goals and open our doors to you wonderfully adventurous people. We've worked so hard on making something special and we need your help to make our dreams come to life.

Challenges
Our challenges are small and mostly to do with time . We would love to see our space occupied and with so much interest online would like to offer potential guest a way of pre-booking in exchange for a little helping hand in the funding department.
Realistically, we believe that we can open doors on the the 8th of February 

Other Ways You Can Help
Any other contributions, ideas and physical support are all welcome.

story:
To our dear clients and all friends of KnotStressed Therapies:

We're asking you to support us and our 23 self-employed practitioners in any way you can so that we can to keep our clinic going during the next 4-18 months of uncertainty. 

It has taken 15 years to get KnotStressed to the point it is now with a beautiful, vibrant community of people who enjoy our services. We LOVE offering you all our services and many of you have become good friends to us over the years. It would be heartbreaking if we are forced to fold. 

The Coronavirus threat is open-ended and it's likely that our services will be severely curtailed for most of 2020. So, we are using the time to get creative! 

We're moving yoga classes, parent and baby courses, birth workshops and training online until such time as it's safe to gather in groups.

We've created some awesome 'beat the stay-at-home blues' new services for you all to enjoy while social distancing measures are in place. 

We urgently need your help to make this transition to providing services online, and to support our massage therapists who are now unable to work to their full potential. You can do this by buying a perk through this crowdfunder. Thank you!

We are hoping to support our local community through this fundraiser. We will be donating £1 for every £25 we raise to the Edinburgh North East Food Bank. 

New to KnotStressed Therapies?

At KnotStressed Therapies, since we opened our clinic we have:

  • provided a gorgeous, nurturing space for our lovely clients to relax in 
  • offered an extensive range of fabulous treatments - swedish massage, reflexology, deep tissue massage, hypnotherapy, pregnancy massage, hot stones massage, postnatal massage, physiotherapy, and so much more...  
  • supported many Edinburgh families through pregnancy, birth and the postnatal period through our pregnancy and postnatal massage, birth preparation, pregnancy and birth support groups, hypnobirthing and yoga offerings.
  • welcomed and entertained countless little ones and their parents through our Baby Massage & Yoga, Baby Signing and Mum & Baby Yoga classes.
  • trained over 400 people in Pregnancy Massage, Postnatal Massage, Hands Free Massage, Relax & Sing Baby Massage & Yoga, Relax & Sing Baby Signing
  • enjoyed being part of a completely wonderful community of excellent clients.

Whether you are new to KnotStressed Therapies or a loyal client, we would be enormously grateful if you would consider supporting us through this crowdfunder.  

Risks & Challenges

We are an energetic, entrepeneurial, motivated and enthusiastic group of self-employed practitioners. We will be turning our minds to ensuring we do everything we can to transition to online service provision and continue to provide a community space for our clients - even if is a virtual community for the next few months!

We've set our fundraising goal at £7k. Even with our current business savings, the government small business grant and the recent welcome announcement for support for self-employed practitioners, we think £7k is the minimum that we will need to ride out the Covid-19 threat. As a hands-on business, it is likely that our services could be affected for as long as March 2021 (going by the current virus impact prediction models). Any funds we can raise by selling gift vouchers and online classes in advance would give us time to get our online courses established, cover core running costs, help us support our massage therapists who are unable to work at all at the moment, and enable our business to stay afloat whilst the virus restricts the services we can offer. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that this is an incredibly difficult time for everyone. If you are unable to contribute financially, you can still help us by getting the word out and making some noise about our campaign. 

  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools to tell everyone you know about our online services and gift vouchers. We've got some really great perks on offer!

From the depths of our hearts, THANK YOU. 

With all our love and best wishes to you all for a healthy and safe time ahead, 

Onie, Krista, Juan, Penny, Kat, Gabe, Lynne-Marie, Clare B, Claire M, Clare K, Jen, Daniela, Rhian, Ashley, Kristina, Anne, Orielle, Becky, Robyn, Sarah, Jo, Martina, Christina and Nikki xxxx

story:
Breve Resumen

Curry-Ya! es un proyecto familiar que comenzó en 2015 con la idea de traer a España el Curry Japonés y algunos de sus platos mas tradicionales y desconocidos por el gran público.

Nuestros clientes nos han regalado 5 años de estupendas experiencias, y hemos creado una familia cada vez mas grande, que disfruta de los platos que preparamos y del entorno que entre todos hemos creado en Curry-Ya!

Actualmente con el COVID 19, hemos tenido que cerrar por el Estado de Alarma, nuestros 3 locales. El pago de alquileres especialmente y otros gastos que continúan pese al cierre, nos pone en serios aprietos, por lo que recurrimos a esta campaña para poder sobrevivir y pasada esta amarga Pandemia, seguir disfrutando de vuestra compañía en nuestros locales.

Aprovechamos para solidarizarnos con aquellos que están sufriendo esta pandemia y lanzar un grito de esperanza y apoyo a todos...gambarou! (ánimo!)

Os gradecemos vuestro apoyo y cariño, siempre! Arigatou!

 

Qué necesitamos?

Apoyo financiero para pagar las deudas que estamos acumulando.

Solo el pago de alquileres de los tres locales nos supone unos 6.500€/mes, otros gastos como la luz, agua, internet, seguros sociales, nóminas que no se vean amparadas por las ayudas estatales (5 nóminas no son susceptibles de recibir ayudas del gobierno, aún estamos en espera de que las autoridades nos informen)... seguros, tasas, pago de financiaciones...etc, unos 8.500€/mes. Pensamos que el estado de alerta durará 2 meses..., por lo que hemos calculado que tendremos unas deudas acumuladas de 30.000€.

El dinero conseguido con esta campaña, por tanto, será íntegramente utilizado para pagar las deudas que se producirán por la crisis del COVID-19.

Que recibes?

Lo primero nuestro más sincero agradecimiento por ayudarnos. Además hemos preparado unos productos/recuerdos exclusivos, diseñados por Oscar y Edu, que nos recordarán nuestra lucha contra está pandemia, los productos son:

- Chapa,

- Pegatina,

- Bolsa de tela,

- Camiseta

- Ticket Virtual Comida para dos.

- Donaciones directas de 5 ó 20 €

*1 La producción de las recompensas no se realizará hasta finalizado el estado de alarma. Se estima que la entrega se haría en Julio y podría ser en mano en alguno de nuestros locales, o por envío dentro de España si se elige la opción de envío.

*2 Para poder realizar todos los productos, necesitamos recaudar al menos 2.000€. Si no se llegará a esta cifra, por favor permítenos que el dinero que has aportado se te pueda canjear por consumiciones en nuestros locales, muchas gracias por tu comprensión.

*3 Si te interesa algún producto y estas fuera de España, contáctanos por las redes por si pudiéramos mandar allí donde estés!

 

Cualquier ayuda es buena!

Os damos las gracias por haber leído hasta aquí :), y os pedimos que si no podéis contribuir económicamente, que nos ayudéis a distribuir esta campaña en vuestras redes sociales, y allí donde podais! Gracias! Arigatou!

Compartid este link!: https://www.indiegogo.com/project/preview/ebc5505c

story:
Background:

As of 03/16/2020, the San Diego County Board of Supervisors ordered the temporary closure of all restaurants and bars until 03/31/20. In considering the risks involved for our staff and their families, we have decided not to open for takeout or deliveries.

Our intention at Tahona Mezcaleria is to be a place of communion around one of the most misunderstood spirits. In the past year and a half since opening, we have become a staple of the Old Town community and have been blessed with amazing support from San Diegans. 

None of what we have accomplished at Tahona would have been possible without the hard work of our employees. Our team's motto is to make everyone feel at home when they walk through our doors. Tahona's mission to educate and empower mezcal producers would not be possible without the daily commitment towards excellence by every single one of our team members.

As you can imagine, this abrupt restaurant closure places our entire staff in a hard situation. We are not sure how much time will pass before we can reopen, and in the meantime there is no alternative work for which they can apply.

This is why we are starting this campaign to raise funds to support our team. We're in this together and with your support, we will prevail!

Here's how you can support us during these tough times:

- Buy one of our designer T’s: we’ve partnered with a local business to produce these t-shirts on demand based on your purchase, thus supporting them in the process. We will donate 100% of the proceeds of t-shirt sales to our staff.

- Purchase a pre-sale of a Mezcal & Tacos tasting experience: upon the re-opening of Tahona Mezcaleria, you will be able to call to book your spot to enjoy this incredible experience! Again, 100% of proceeds from the sale of these tasting experiences will be donated to our staff.

We hope to see all of you very soon to cheer to our health and a better future!

Tahona Management

story:
WHY OAKLAND? WHY BIKE TOURS?

Eleven years ago, my wife and I--both educators and both possessing, “champagne tastes on a beer budget” AND  a desire to travel, looked around one day and wondered why we needed our cars. So, we sold them and used that money plus our yearly “car-free” savings to travel as far and wide as we could at every opportunity during every conceivable vacation. While traveling we took tours, lots of them: walking, foodie and BIKE tours. Between the two of us, I was (and am) the copious note taker and I noted everything: length of tour, crowds, food choices, the equipment, the sights, etc.  I realized this was something I could do for my beloved town: Oakland.

WHEN YOU REALIZE THERE MAY BE ANOTHER PATH FOR YOU...A BIKE PATH.

As an Oakland native, long time educator, lifelong cyclist, and self-proclaimed Oakland Enthusiast I figured that I had just the right amount of nerdiness and exuberance to make bike tours in Oakland a reality. I love riding my bike, I love talking to new people, I love talking about Oakland and at forty-five years old...why not now?

For years,  I had dreamed of ways to share, show off, and give back to the complex city that has given me so much. This Is Oakland Bike Tours will offer a look at and insight into all the contradictory feelings of devotion, frustration, admiration, exasperation, vivaciousness,  doggedness and love that inspires Oakland's residents and makes the town, The Town.

WHY TOUR OAKLAND? Don’t worry you can handle it!

Part of what makes a tour in Oakland appealing is our gritty perseverance in the face of anything & everything… economic downturn? We can handle it. Golden State Warriors are champions? We can handle it. Earthquakes and fires? We can handle it. Exploding foodie culture? We can handle it. Raiders are moving to Vegas?  We can handle it. Gentrification? We can handle it. Thriving art and music scene? We can handle it. Anything you can throw at Oakland we come through strong and HANDLE TOWN BUSINESS.

YOUR RIDE. YOUR CHOICE. OUR GIFT.

As cliche and corny as it may seem I want to give back to the town that has given me so much. In that vein, every tour allows guests to choose from a curated list of charities that are doing good work to improve the lives of Oaklanders who are “handling it” but still need a hand...

HOW ARE THE TOURS? HELLA GOOD!

From my copious note-taking of tours around the world, I decided that This Is Oakland Bike Tours will be small and intimate with eight riders maximum, the tours will be a meander--not a race, guests will have a chance to enjoy tasty bites, and the tour routes will provide a balance of stopping to look and riding to see.

HOW CAN I HELP? DONOR FATIGUE IS REAL…

Donor fatigue is real. We are faced with what seems to be an innumerable amount of tragedy and hardship. I understand that, and I feel the fatigue when I turn on the news, read my email or look at social media. Without belittling what is going on locally or globally I ask that you give because I’m offering something to spark joy and bring optimism to my community and those who visit without sacrificing or ignoring the hard-truths that the city of Oakland and the greater Bay Area face. This is me being “hella real”.

SO, WHERE DOES MY MONEY GO?

NO FUNDS? SHARE, SHARE, AND SHARE AGAIN!

That being said, if you aren’t in a place to give financially please give by sharing, sharing, and sharing again! Get the word out! Call that auntie you haven’t spoken to in awhile, text that college roommate who made it big in the tech world, slip your favorite barista a link along with the tip. And I will give you... my heartiest thanks!

You can also...

Follow This Is Oakland Bike Tours & share the Indiegogo Link

Indiegogo: https://igg.me/at/TIOBT

On facebook: https://facebook.com/thisIsoaklandbiketours

On instagram: https://instagram.com/thisisoaklandbiketours

On twitter: https://twitter.com/oaklandbiketrs

Visit the website: www.thisisoaklandbiketours.com

Join me on a tour and rate This Is Oakland Bike Tours on Trip Advisor or Yelp.

 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
From Umezushi To Kitchen In An Arch

It is hard to talk about KIAA without mentioning it's progenitor, Umezushi. The main purpose of KIAA is to provide a dedicated space for the delicate food preparation required by Umezushi. At the same time it allows for the general public to gain unique access to our lovingly prepared ingredients.

Since Terry Huang opened Umezushi in October 2012 in a railway arch on Mirabel street, it has slowly gained local and national recognition of its quality, service, value, and peculiar location. Fast forward to 2017 and Umezushi has received numerous awards, along with praise from media and food critics alike. All of which has some unintended consequences to our humble 16 seat establishment: space in Umezushi has become saturated. What was designed for a team of 4 people now houses an army of 12 strong! Lunch breaks in our office is like playing human Jenga, and morning preparation is not too dissimilar from reconstructing Giza with fish fillets - quite a sight, I tell you! And during the shift the back of house is like dodgems with glasses and knives. You get the picture now, I hope? With such demand we really needed something or somewhere to allow us to maintain and continually improve our quality, and this is how KIAA came about.

In 2015 we learned of another under-arch space just across the road (yes, we are a little obsessed with these railway wonders). After a long, hard battle of negotiations (largely involving checking emails and phones to see if we have any responses) we finally signed the papers in August 2017 and KIAA was able to begin.


What is KIAA about?

KIAA should be your first port of call if you find yourself asking the following questions:

  • I want to host a sushi making party. Where do I start?
  • Where can I get sushi quality fish and seafood?
  • I cannot be bothered with washing and cooking the rice, and filleting fish. I just want to make sushi. What can I do?
  • Where can I learn to make sushi?
  • Where can I obtain high quality sake?

In KIAA, you will find everything utilised in Umezushi. You will have the option to get the most primitive level ingredients and prepare from scratch, or everything prepared and ready for assembly, the choice is yours. To best utilise the kitchen space we will be offering cookery lessons such as basic knife skills, fish filleting, and sashimi and sushi preparation.

As part of the ongoing improvement process, we will be importing whole tuna directly from source and process them ourselves. We find much of the tuna fillets is no longer suitable for our standards. By getting as close to the source as possible, it will allows us to have maximum control and quality. It should in theory allow us to perform techniques such as maturing.

Of course, we cannot miss our ever so famous unagi. Having KIAA will not only mean that we can maintain a healthy amount of stock to satisfy all your cravings but also you take some extra home to enjoy it at any time you desire.

Apart from the kitchen functionality of KIAA, there will be a comprehensive sake cellar for lovers of delicious sake to indulge and the curious sake novice to sample!

You can out preliminary grocery product list HERE.

This encapsulates the idea of KIAA. We will look at what is required to get us there in the next section.


Rewards!

Before we dive into the nitty gritty, let's take a look at some of the exciting perks that we have planned for you.

For you to impress

We will be offering various cookery classes from a fermentation workshop and knife training, to full on sushi preparation and Japanese cooking. We aim to give you everything you need to know to reproduce the results at home. Impress your guests with your new found skills!

For you to indulge

Also on offer are a few special treats from the Umezushi restaurant itself, including meals, seafood feast, and an one off special kaiseki menu. They are for pure indulgence.

For the exclusivity

There is a small number of very special perks that we offer in this campaign, including standing reservation at Umezushi and VIP cards. They really show off your obsession in us.

You can find further details in the perks section (on the right hand side, we believe?) of this campaign. Everything will be explained in detail there!

 

Finance

This is the slightly scary section - finance! The KIAA project involves building up a 110m^2 empty shell unit and filling it with equipment and stock. The estimated cost of the project is in the region of £110,000. We have secured funding of £50,000 from Umezushi itself, friends, and other investors, and this funding will allow us to complete the building work. We are hoping to raise the missing £60,000 (net) from this campaign, which will allow us to purchase cooking and refrigeration equipment. The detailed plan is in the appendix part of this campaign.

 

How Will This Campaign Help?

As we already mentioned earlier, this campaign is to help us purchasing the equipment required for KIAA. This new equipment have four goals:

  • Increase production capacity.
  • Improve quality.
  • Improve consistency.
  • Even better food safety.

The campaigned amount will allow us to produce and store everything at the optimal level that we planned to do. Each contribution will take us a step closer to that. You will find a list of equipment that we intend to purchase in Appendix II.

Below is just a short video about the building work.

Risks & Challenges

Any project and investment comes with risks, known or unknown. We have identified three major risks of our project below.

Delays!!!

It seems that most building works are done in a different universe. An universe that time runs at different (slower) speed. During our planning, we try to bring it back down to earth and give everything a reasonable target with a good contingency. We will also pay extra attention in supervising the building work. The site is just opposite to Umezushi, so we have no excuse...

What if we don't meet our campaign target?

This is a genuine concern for us. Firstly, we will probably have a serious conversation with ourselves in front of the mirror. We have never done crowdfunding before and anything could happen. Although, we are optimistic about our target, we need to be realistic. We have plan B, and plan C in place incase we cannot reach our target in one step. We have an incremental implementation of our plan. The keystone of the project is the completion of the initial building work, which we have planned, budgeted, and funded. We will adjust our service and product offering according to what equipment we are able to purchase based on the final contribution.

What if KIAA does not take off?

This is actually one problem that we worry about the least. After some furious clicking on the calculator, we worked out that the running cost of KIAA can already be covered by Umezushi. What it means is that even if we have no customers in KIAA, we will still be able to offer better quality food prepared in a safer environment and larger capacity, just with less profit. So, the 12 strong at Umezushi have all agreed to eat less during their lunch break to make up for the difference!

As for the unknown risks? well... we will just cross our fingers and hope for the best and see what lemon the world throws at us.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Nothing takes your fancy but the altruistic you is screaming to come out? Get in touch! We love new ideas and any help we can get is greatly appreciated! 

 

Appendix I - The Building Plan

The current site is a shell unit with a toilet and kitchenette and the plan is to put in these features:

  • mezzanine floor for offices and staff room
  • chilled wine cellar
  • cold prep kitchen
  • hot prep kitchen
  • store front

You can find the plan at this LINK. It is very straight forward, like a matchbox inside a tunnel. How hard can it be?

 

Appendix II - Equipment List

Below is a list of equipment that we plan to install in KIAA:

  • -65C walk in freezer
  • walk in fridge
  • high power blast freezer
  • thawing chamber
  • filleting sink station
  • 2-door counter fridge
  • 3-door counter fridge
  • fermentation fridge
  • crashed-ice machine
  • brat pan
  • steamer
  • oven
  • deep fryer
  • induction range cooker
  • vacuum packing machine
  • sous vide
  • extraction canopy and louvre
  • kitchen work benches and sinks
  • dishwasher

story:
Mia Freedman has worked very hard for years to build the worst website on the internet, and now she's looking to cash in by selling it, thus providing US, the ordinary Aussie everyday punters in the street, with an opportunity to make it the BEST website on the internet. With Ben Pobjie as managing editor of Mamamia, clickbait will finally be used for good, and not evil. 

Mamamia under Pobjie will be funny, ridiculous, occasionally informative, and extremely rude.

Having taken a quick look at Mamamia the site, I estimate its value at around $5000. If we raise that much, I'll put in a bid for this amount, and I confidently anticipate that Mia will leap at the opportunity to maximise her profit to that extent. Anything raised over that amount will go towards purchasing the publishing rights to various celebrities' perfect responses to things.

story:
The Vision

Members of the International Churches of Christ (ICOC) community travel all around the world for many reasons. Often times a barrier to traveling is the high cost of overnight accommodations.

Members attempt to find other members in sister churches around the world to coordinate overnight housing. They desire to connect with other Christians for mutual encouragement and to save a few dollars along the way. This pursuit can be challenging when:  

  • They don't know anyone personally where they are going
  • Members they knew in the city have since moved away 
  • They feel awkward contacting local ministry leaders listed on the church's website to see if a host can be found
  • The list can go on and on...

The very fiber of the ICOC community is love, relationships, and hospitality. For years, disciples in the church have demonstrated their love by hosting others as an expression of Christian faith. They have seen a need and answered the call, with open doors and open hearts.  They have freely shared with others out of what has been given to them.  

The vision for Come & Stay came to Founder Cheryl Parker as a result of the joy she gained from hosting sisters in her home in Virginia when she lived there. Conversely when she traveled, she often felt insecure when seeking housing for herself. And frustration when trying to help other disciples in her ministry connect when they traveled.  

It is from that place that the concept for Come & Stay was born...a platform to simplify connections between hosts and travelers within the ICOC community. A solution to help make travel more accessible, coordination seamless and goodness shared

Come & Stay: A Global Platform

Come & Stay will be built exclusively for the International Churches of Christ community. Through member profiles, house listings and a messaging system, the site will enable Travelers to connect with potential Hosts for short-term overnight stays known as  "Hospitality Exchanges". 

HOST membership will be completely FREE! Hosts will create a member profile and listing for their home to share about their household, what they have to offer, and expectations of their guests. Hosts will be able to respond to Traveler inquiries through the Come & Stay messaging system.  A Host Rewards Program will be designed where Hosts can earn points for successful stays coordinated through Come & Stay which can be redeemed for great perks!

TRAVELER membership will be an annual membership fee around the average cost of a one to two night stay at a hotel in the US. Travelers can create a member profile and will have access to Host listings. Travelers will be able to initiate communication with potential Hosts through the Come & Stay messaging system.  

Traveler members will also have the capability to exchange their entire home with other Traveler members if they so choose, for "Home Exchanges". Home Exchanges are a great way to go on vacations and mission trips around the world on a limited budget!

Will it be safe?

Come & Stay is rooted in trust, sharing and caring. A verification process will be done between Come & Stay and local churches to ensure members belong to a local International Church of Christ community. As an extra layer of protection, the platform will have built-in verification tools. By creating a detailed listing, a member profile and writing reviews, members become active participants in ensuring transparency on the platform.  

Support with a Financial Contribution!

Monies raised in our first crowdfunding campaign this past Summer will be combined with funds raised during this campaign to start the development phase of a Come & Stay web application. 

Funding received in excess of the goal will be used to further advance the development of Come & Stay throughout ICOC churches globally. 

With your help, we will be able to launch the first version of Come & Stay in early 2017. Come & Stay will change the way disciples travel! 

The Impact

Travel touches all of our lives. Think of the reasons you travel:

  • Leisure and adventure
  • Educational and career pursuits 
  • Medical appointments and legal proceedings 
  • Relationship seeking and relationship building 
  • Missionary efforts and disaster relief 
  • Moving away and moving back 'home' 

Church members all around the world are like extended family. Local ministries will be enriched by the connections it's members will be able to make through Come & Stay. 

  • Relationships will be built that will last for eternity
  • Families and individuals will discover and explore new places
  • And ultimately, more needs will be met as we are called to "share with the Lord’s people who are in need"

Ways You Can Help

  • Choose one of our amazing perks and contribute TODAY!
  • Like us on Facebook @comeandstay and Follow us on Twitter @comeandstayicoc 
  • Share Come & Stay with your local congregation and disciples you know around the world  
  • Provide your email address so we can stay in touch
  • And pray for our efforts!

The Team

This initiative is being spearheaded by members of the Austin Christian Church. 

Brandon Knicely, Jaemin Lee, Vivian Igunbor, Cheryl Parker, Audrey Vivar, Christian Ray

story:
Who am I?

My name is Jessica, I am a veteran of the U.S. Army and U.S. Air Force Reserve, a military spouse, full time student, and the Founder and CEO of an events company. During an internship for my degree, I was introduced to the Cambridge Innovation Center, a coworking space in Miami. I learned a lot about entrepreneurship and met some amazing people, but I realized that I was often the only veteran or military spouse in discussions about business in Miami. I decided that other vets and military spouse entrepreneurs should have access to the conversations, the workspace, and the resources that I experience daily at CIC. 

About Coworking at CIC Miami: 

The shared coworking space at CIC Miami is a 3,200 square foot, hyper-modern library-style space with a little under 100 desks, two private conference rooms, and cubby storage. Located on the southwest corner of the building, the assembly space is filled with natural light and boasts gorgeous views of the Downtown Miami skyline. Our shared coworking space is the most concentrated area of collaboration between companies in all stages of the entrepreneurial life cycle, and a uniquely helpful place for many to start their start-up journey.

Click here for a complete list of amenities. 

What We Need

CIC Miami has generously offered a rate of $150/month for vets and military spouses. We are asking for a minimum $15,400 to host 10 veteran and military spouse owned businesses at CIC Miami for (6) months in 2018:

  • 10 companies x $150 = $1500/month
  • $1500 x 6 months = $9000
  • Unlimited monthly parking @ $65 x 10 companies = $650 x 6 months = $3900
  • $250 to cover costs for each company to host an event at CIC Miami during the 6 month program.

The Program

The six (6) month program is broken into three phases: Red Phase, White Phase, & Blue Phase

Red Phase - Analysis: We will analyze each business or idea and identify areas for improvement. Members will undergo an in-depth look at their business plans, marketing plans, finances, and business analytics from qualified and certified professionals. 

White Phase - Construction: This phase is to implement systems and automation to streamline business operations and promote growth. This phase will consist of creating a plan and locating specific resources to facilitate that plan's success. Each business will receive guidance and mentorship from local business experts. 

Blue Phase - Execution: This phase is to execute the plan created in White Phase, culminating in a pitch competition to win funding for their business at the end of the program.

Risks & Challenges

No idea, no matter how well intentioned, is without its challenges. Here are a few we've identified and how we plan to overcome them.

  1. Whether they've been out for one month or 10 years, transitioning from active duty service as a military member or military spouse is challenging, and the added stress of entrepreneurship can be debilitating. We plan to tackle the challenge of transition with assistance from local organizations, community support, and lots of communication with the members of the cohort.
  2. Financial woes can derail the best plans, and the South Florida economy is not cheap. We plan to tackle the challenge of finance by offering this program completely free of charge to the members of the cohort. 
  3. Skin In the Game: The workspace and resources are "free" but the members of the cohort will pay for this benefit with time, dedication, and commitment. Each phase will require each member to reach certain milestones that will help their business grow and prove they are in it to win it. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Money is great, but it's not all we need to make this a successful program. Here are some ways you can help:

  • SHARE! Spread the word about the program and the campaign!
  • VISIT! If you're local to the Miami area, reach out to us and take a tour of CIC! We'd love for you to see the environment and opportunities first hand!
  • MENTOR! Do you think you have an expertise that will lend well to the program? Contact us to schedule a meeting or call! 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

$1500 x 6 months = $9000
Unlimited monthly parking @ $65 x 10 companies = $650 x 6 months = $3900
$250 to cover costs for each company to host an event at CIC Miami during the 6 month program.

The Program

The six (6) month program is broken into three phases: Red Phase, White Phase, & Blue Phase
Red Phase - Analysis: We will analyze each business or idea and identify areas for improvement. Members will undergo an in-depth look at their business plans, marketing plans, finances, and business analytics from qualified and certified professionals. 
White Phase - Construction: This phase is to implement systems and automation to streamline business operations and promote growth. This phase will consist of creating a plan and locating specific resources to facilitate that plan's success. Each business will receive guidance and mentorship from local business experts. 
Blue Phase - Execution: This phase is to execute the plan created in White Phase, culminating in a pitch competition to win funding for their business at the end of the program.
Risks & Challenges
No idea, no matter how well intentioned, is without its challenges. Here are a few we've identified and how we plan to overcome them.

Whether they've been out for one month or 10 years, transitioning from active duty service as a military member or military spouse is challenging, and the added stress of entrepreneurship can be debilitating. We plan to tackle the challenge of transition with assistance from local organizations, community support, and lots of communication with the members of the cohort.
Financial woes can derail the best plans, and the South Florida economy is not cheap. We plan to tackle the challenge of finance by offering this program completely free of charge to the members of the cohort. 
Skin In the Game: The workspace and resources are "free" but the members of the cohort will pay for this benefit with time, dedication, and commitment. Each phase will require each member to reach certain milestones that will help their business grow and prove they are in it to win it. 

Other Ways You Can Help
Money is great, but it's not all we need to make this a successful program. Here are some ways you can help:

SHARE! Spread the word about the program and the campaign!
VISIT! If you're local to the Miami area, reach out to us and take a tour of CIC! We'd love for you to see the environment and opportunities first hand!
MENTOR! Do you think you have an expertise that will lend well to the program? Contact us to schedule a meeting or call! 
THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
The story
My name is Mario Lizarazu and I'm a bike mechanic. I'm opening a bike shop in the Historic La Buena building on 22nd St and S 4th Ave which will also be the home of Monsoon Chocolate, a gourmet chocolate maker that will also serve food and coffee. This area is in the beginning stages of revitalization and a prime location for a bike shop. Less than two miles from downtown with views of A-Mountain. There's Starr Pass resort and the Tucson Mountain Park on the west with miles and miles of mountain bike trails and El Tour De Tucson starts just up the street and passes by the shop. I have extensive knowledge with all makes and models, high end, low end and everything in between and experience managing and sale. I have also made dealer agreements with Ellsworth Handcrafted Bicycles, Voodoo Cycles and State Bicycles, I'll be offering professional bike repair, bikes sales, parts, accessories and much more. I take pride in my work and make it a point to always keep learning. I'm a Shimano certified technician and a member of the Professional Bicycle Mechanics Association (PBMA) and have been an on-site mechanic for Outside Magazine's annual bike test. I've been ready to open my own bike shop for a very long time and the time is now. I'm really reaching for the American dream here, building something out of nothing. I'm definitely not in the best position financially to make this bike shop happen the way I want it so I'm doing what I can, as I can. I don't take anything home as an owner and I probably won't for a few years, everything the shop makes will be going back into the shop for operating costs and inventory. It's not going to be easy and I'll probably ride my bike even less than I have been since I started this business but it will be worth it to be able to call this bike shop my own. So please buy a service plan, buy a bike or upgrade what you have and spread the good word because by doing so you'll be helping a rad bike shop and a rad bike mechanic make a dream become reality.

 I've been working in bike shops as a mechanic   for well over 18 years after learning the trade   from BICAS at age 14 and I've been at it ever since.   I've always dreamed of opening a bike shop where the bike mechanic works one on one with the customer in a professional setting, a bike shop focused on the service department but at the same time, just a bike shop. It's always bothered me that the customer would sometimes talk to 3 different employees and sometimes never even talk to the mechanic when getting service done on their bike. There should be a more personal relationship with your bike mechanic or even your bike shop employee and you should know about their experience and whether they're qualified to service your bike or give you advice about a product.

After 18 years working mostly as a mechanic in several different bike shops I realized I just wasn't finding the kind of bike shop I was looking for. I was in no position to just open my own shop, so with the encouragement of my awesome girlfriend I went off on my own. I took on more hours at my part time job at the Rialto Theatre, spending nights at the theatre and days working on bikes. 

I first started my business in a small space next to my kitchen working as an independent mechanic and quickly expanded into my living room. My business continued to grow, but moving forward was difficult without a storefront because most distributors won't work with independents, you need to be a retail establishment with open hours and a commercial location. 

Now it's time for the next chapter, Tucson Bicycle Service the bike shop. I'm offering Service Plans, Tune Ups and discounts as incentives in order to raise funds for opening costs. I have two levels of service plans, the basic level service plan is designed for the everyday rider and comes with two (2) basic tune ups, free bike checks ($30 value)  25% off additional labor, 10% off parts and 10% off pick up and delivery services for a year. The Pro level service plan is more aimed at the avid racer who really beats up their bike at the races, this level comes with two (2) pro tune ups, free bike checks ($30 value) 50% off additional labor 20% off parts, 20% off pick up and delivery services and 10% off at Tucson Rising Phoenix Fitness and defense (more discounts will be added as they become available). Both level service plans are offered in 1yr, 2yr or 4yr, 10% of the fee is donated to a local non-profit. There's also tune ups, gift cards and discounts. 

PRO SERVICE PLAN DONATION

  • $100 for every 4yr plan
  • $50 for every 2yr plan
  • $25 for every 1yr plan

BASIC SERVICE PLAN DONATION

  • $60 for every 4yr plan
  • $30 for every 2yr plan
  • $15 for every 1yr plan

I can't thank everyone who believed in me and supported my dream enough, but I'm not home free yet. There's a lot of expenses in a bike shop. I'll need all the help and support I can get, I have a lot of plans but I'm starting small on my own and I’m determined to grow into something amazing. So, please contribute! Whether it be $1 or $1000, building materials, tools, supplies, helping hands or just word of mouth, anything and everything helps. I'm also open to the idea of a partner or investor if it's the right person, so please let me know if you think that's you and we can set up a meeting to talk. Thank you for reading and I hope to be your mechanic and bike shop for a very long time.

Needs & Perks
I set this campaign for $15,000 which is a fraction of what is needed. But just to get things started, I'm in need of things that make a bike shop, a bike shop. I need fixtures, merchandise, bikes, register, some working capital and much more tools and supplies. I also need to pay rent, insurance, utilities. In return for your support you'll get a rad bike shop in Tucson, all kinds of services, discounts and other opportunities to make it feel like it's your bike shop.

story:
Our Mission is Simple.

To make a living feeding hungry minds with books while empowering the lives of our employees and  positively impacting our community. Books feed the mind. Work feeds the heart.

Our employees are all adults with Special Needs that perform the most critical tasks in our operation.  These include sourcing and checking inventory, housing inventory, picking orders and critically quality control, packing and mail preparation, 

Whether employees stay and train with us and move onto other positions or employment we have a place for everyone, with your help we'd love to offer and lot more employment. 

Over time, we’ve learned how to work, flow, and thrive together as one. And make work fun. We like to say we don’t employ anyone with disabilities, just a team with different abilities.

Our Product.

  • We sell over 28,000 books, DVDs, CDs, Blue-ray, and Audio books 
  • We stock best-sellers, used and new, rare and obscure
  • We offer both a 100% authentic and money back guarantee
  • Green Street Books is a certified Amazon seller with 10,000 positive feedback ratings and 100% positive overall score

Our Impact.

In the big picture, we see our job as one of public service. Our business model is a blend of "for profit" with non-profit work. It’s every bit as important to us to make a difference as it is to make a buck. And it’s working.

We have changed lives in our community and worldwide. All achieved while solely employing adults with special needs who love coming to work.

Our Partners.

The majority of inventory is purchased from our nonprofit partners in the San Francisco Bay Area.  The monies paid are used to support a host of literacy programs in local communities.

We help libraries collect and sort books that might otherwise have been disposed of, and turn them into much needed revenue for social programs. It’s a business model that keeps us very busy, working hard. And one that allows us to sleep especially well at night, too.

Why Indiegogo? 

Green Street Books has grown from a garage-based operation to now occupying a 2,700 square foot warehouse with over 288K customers over the last four years.

It’s thrilling and motivating, but we need more resources than our self-funding will allow. With your support, we'd like to:

  • Provide  multiple new positions for adults with special needs
  • Increase our community footprint and double our funding of non-profits with literacy programs. 
  • Take our employees out in the field, we are proud of them and they are amazing. 
  • Purchase a delivery van to take in the field with our work and employees. 

Our Offer.

If you love what we’re doing, we have an enticing proposal, we offer the most competitive prices beating Amazon's lowest competing price (including Prime): http://shop.greenstreetbooks.org/

Discounts are for you and your family. We will e-mail out codes to use at checkout starting June 6th, 2017 and available to use immediately. 

  • $10 funding, 3% product discount, unlimited for 12 months 

 

  • $25 funding, 5% product discount, unlimited for 12 months 

 

  • $50 funding, 7% product discount, unlimited for 12 months 

 

  • $75 funding, 10% product discount, unlimited for 12 months

 

  • $100 funding, 12% product discount, unlimited for 12 months

 

  • $200 funding, 15% product  discount, unlimited for 12 months

 

Discounts are good on any item over $1.50. Our only restriction is no commercial sellers or competitors in good faith, take advantage of this offer. 

Products must be purchased directly from our webstore. We take credit cards, Amazon payments and Paypal. Please note delivery options that are also the most competitive.

Thanks for your consideration!

http://greenstreetbooks.org/
